title: An Absolutely Spectacular Stay
text:
While I have had the pleasure of staying at the Towers a handful of times, both with and without children, over the past ten years, it was our most recent stay that truly cemented why this will forever be our "go-to" when staying in Manhattan, regardless of the particulars. 

While the room was absolutely spectacular down to the linens and provided products, it was the level of service we experienced during our spring break visit that was above and beyond. Upon check-in, we were warmly greeted by Jimm Kalinka at Guest Services. From that moment forward, Jimm made us feel as if we were the only guests at the hotel. My young daughters will never forget how special they were made to feel. It is very evident that Jimm, along with truly every other wonderful employee we had the pleasure of meeting during our stay (servers, housekeeping, room service, etc.) loves and takes pride in their job.

I also would like to mention Medy at mail services who was such a delight when I had to handle a few business items during our stay.

Finally, Mike, the amazing bell captain, learned it was one of our daughters birthdays. An incredibly kind gesture of treats and a birthday card for her ensued and we were all just so touched at such thoughtfulness.

We all know the choices are endless when it comes to hotel options in New York. I hope this review helps anyone considering The Towers to book with confidence. We sincerely look forward to our next visit, as soon as possible!

title: Beautiful wedding venue
text: We attended a beautiful wedding at The Palace hotel. The ceremony, cocktail hour and reception were held all held in an elegant, private space. The staff was friendly and professional from the moment we walked in. Everything was perfect!

title: Enjoy the Tower
text: It was my first time in NY and after much consideration I made a reservation at the Tower. There were many American Express benefits, so I made a reservation via American Express. I was on a high floor and could enjoy the Manhattan cityscape and the Hudson River from my room. The room service was also very good.

title: The Concierge Ani help us a lot making all the reservations we need the hotel is in the heart of manhattan  . The Best .
text: Ani the concierge the best she helped us getting reservations for museums and lunch the hotel is in a great location thank you Lotte New York palace you did an amazing job. We recommend this hotel the hotel is five stars and the service was excellent

title: Amazing weekend in NYC
text: Can’t say enough about our recent stay with you.  We had a whirlwind 3-day trip to NYC and loved every minute of it!  We got to stay on the 14th floor, and we had a stunning view of St. Patrick's Cathedral.  The best part of our stay was the Lotte staff!  From our check-in with Jorge to the lovely doormen Nana and Fran who were so warm and welcoming!  This historic hotel is so beautiful, and we were lucky to learn so much about its history through a lovely tour with Dan N.  He was so helpful and knowledgeable about the hotel!  We were so lucky to stay here, the service was amazing, The room and the hotel were exceptional and we hope to be back very soon!

title: Great location and very well run hotel.
text: We recently stayed at the Lotte New York Palace for a trip to NYC for a week. It was really a great hotel. Aside from a nice room, with comfortable beds, the hotel staff were all really wonderful, from the Doormen, to the Bellhops, to the Housekeeping. Eveyone was so nice to our kids and super helpful. Combine all that with the location and I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again!!

title: BEST LOCATION. EXCELLENT SERVICE
text: Best hotel to stay in NY! Very close to most of the iconic places in the city. Gossip Girl scenes were also filmed here so it’s definitely a plus. The staff were also friendly and approachable especially the receptionist who assisted us, Rebacca Villasenor is her name. I would definitely check in at this hotel again when I get back in NY.

title: for Gossip Girl fans
text: I didn't stay at the hotel, but was there to see the rooms where the Gossip Girl scenes were filmed. Maurice gave us a great tour of the hotel and always told us which scene was being filmed here. I can only recommend it to all Gossip Girl fans!

title: Classic 5 star luxury
text: My wife and I loved our stay at the Towers.  We made the arrangements through Amex and like we hoped, we received an upgrade (though I can't imagine going wrong with any of the rooms, as their smallest rooms are still big!), plus a credit for what would otherwise be a ridiculously expensive breakfast (I guess it comes with the territory).  The 'hotel within a hotel' concept suited us well, as the Towers has its own front desk staff (when we were there over a busy weekend, there were still always twice as many attendants in behind the desk than there were people to use them).  The views from our 46th story room were breathteaking, and the beds were ultra-comfortable.  Oh, I can't think of a better location for a hotel to serve as a home-base, whether to west or east, up or down. My only suggestion is that they upgrade the TVs to larger, smart TVs like we see now in most hotels.  Oh and shout-out to Norma, who helped me make my wife's birthday very special!

title: BEST HOLIDAY EVER
text: Thank you for the most amazing trip , I couldn’t have asked for a better hotel to stay in in my life !! It was a dream . A massive thank you to Norma and Matthew who took me and my family up to the penthouses and showed us were gossip girl was filmed this felt like a dream and I don’t think I will ever get over the whole experience. I will definitely be back and It was the best 5 days of my life ❤️

title: What a magical hotel!
text: I have stayed in a LOT of hotels. This is absolutely one of the best experiences we have ever had. The service is remarkable, rooms (we stayed in the towers) are so big and comfortable with the best views of the city, and the location is central to everything. I couldn’t recommend this hotel enough.

title: Ask from Christian, amazing  houst
text: Christian was amazing, he showed us the hotel and gave us the tour of the principal places of sex and the city scenes. Ask for him, he is an amazing houst.  The hotel is beautiful and the bar is incredible for an after hour or a private event. The library is amazing

title: Liars and Cheats
text:
Being part of a Korean conglomerate, you would think that this hotel would operate with some honour and professionalism.

We were there last week and checked into our suite in The Towers.   First impressions were impressive as the room was huge and the layout worked perfectly for us.   We also had an amazing review and the room was nice and quiet.

We've travelled extensively using one travel agent and know that they always send us a welcome gift.  In addition, our travel agent was aware that it was my husband's birthday, so it was pretty much guaranteed that they would send us something.

A few minutes after checking in, a staff member opened the room door with no notice to us.   This would happen THREE times during our stay of four days.  The staff member brought in a bucket with sparkling wine and a plate of chocolates and announced that this was compliments of the hotel.  We also received a card saying the same thing.

I decided to wait until the next day (my husband's actual birthday) to see if we received anything from our travel agent and when we didn't, I send our travel agent an email to say thank you for the wine and chocolates.  I knew that even though the hotel said it was from them, I was pretty sure that it was from him, and our travel agent confirmed this.    A couple of hours later, we received an identical bottle of wine and chocolates, this time with a card from our travel agent and no apology from the hotel.

What does it say about the hotel and the staff when they lied and cheated about the welcome gift?    In my opinion, this is a completely dishonourable way of doing business. If I didn't know my travel agent well, they would have gotten away with it and the rightful sender would never have received a thank you.

I did mention this to the front desk when we were checking out and was told that someone would be in touch, but 3 days later, I still haven't hear anything.

In addition, for 3 days of our stay, one of the two passenger elevators was out of service so we had to use the freight elevator and the day we were checking, both passenger elevators were out of service.    I also noticed that we were rarely greeted by anyone at the front desk even when they weren't helping customers.    To me, this all shows that this hotel is far from luxury.

title: Lotte Palace Gossip Girl Tour
text: Maitre D’Etage gave us the Gossip Girl tour and it was amazing! What a gorgeous historical mansion with amazing city views. He was informative and a true pleasure. Thank you for sharing the Palace with us. Be sure to ask for him if you are staying at the Palace.

title: Samir!!!
text: Samir was amazing! He went above and beyond and gave us an excellent tour of the history behind the hotel which was incredible! He is truly one of the best workers here and deserves a major raise! The hotel all has increase staff but Samir was the best by far!

title: Unparalleled Hospitality: A Remarkable Stay at Lotte New York Palace
text:
After numerous visits to the city and stays at various locations across Manhattan, my recent experience at Lotte New York Palace truly stood out. 

The service surpassed all expectations, thanks in large part to the exceptional care provided by Norma and Melody. 

Their attentiveness and professionalism were unparalleled, making my family and me feel truly valued and pampered. 

Their personalized approach made us feel like VIPs, and I can confidently say that I’ve never experienced such extraordinary hospitality elsewhere in the world. 

From now on, Lotte New York Palace will be our exclusive choice whenever we visit the city.

title: Great Stay at The Towers at Lotte
text: What a great experience!!! The property is very well maintained and well kept. Our room had windows that opened which was nice to experience the city. The hotel is close to all the local attractions, shopping, theatre district, and great restaurants. The staff are very professional and attentive. Everyone from the doorman, the front desk, the housekeepers, and more were all super helpful and professional!!!

title: Everything was great and Kal Naim, the concierge made my trip. He was so helpful and accommodating!!!
text: Everyone was great. Kal Naim, the concierge was especially kind, helpful and accommodating. When I’m traveling alone I really appreciate these special people because it makes me feel safe, secure and taken care of!!! I always look forward to seeing his smiling face each time I return.

title: Thanks for making the cold and wet Big Apple a warm and cozy Baked Apple at the Towers at the Palace!!
text: We traveled to NY about a few weeks ago during the first week of January. Our visit was for a meeting in Long Island but chose to stay at the Palace to attend Mass at St Patrick’s Cathedral. The Palace was gorgeous!  It was tastefully and appropriately decorated for the holidays! We arrived from LAX to JFK on a red eye, rented a car and drove from JFK to the Manhattan.  It was well before our check-in but quickly found ourselves tired, cold and ready to hit the hay early.  Staff at the Palace greeted us warmly and gave us the utmost attention and refuge at the Towers within the Palace.  From the first stops with George at the drive-up, Rey in the Valet, Rebecca at the front desk, Henry at the bell desk, and concierge staff.  Everyone is well-experienced in hospitality and attentive. An early check-in was quickly arranged with an upgrade. Our initial room was upgraded to an exceptionally appointed room with delightful views of St Patrick’s Cathedral and wonderful service by the housekeeping staff.  We spent the week without any questions or concerns about the City, with carefully described directions to our various stops, provided with taxis on call, reservations at Peter Lugars, and smiling faces at the breakfast cafe which even had The du Haman, the special tea from France’s Le Palais du The. Thank you to Rebecca who welcomed us with open arms and saw us off with an appetite to return. Rebecca transformed the cold and wet big apple into a warm baked apple and made the comings and goings from the Palace like a second home. Come to the Palace to make the Big Apple seem like a cozy warm baked apple, we even met the General Manager of the Palace, Uwe Kunz, who gave that same hospitality vibe felt throughout.  Many many thanks!  We arrived tired and cold and left relaxed and warm with a desire to return.  We had such a wonderful experience, even our 19 year old attending UC Berkeley asked to return to the Palace!!  Highest Recommendation!

title: Great experience!
text: My stay here couldn’t not have been better all thanks to Kal. He made me feel like family and was so kind. He took the time to listen to what we were looking for and made the perfect recommendation accordingly. All his recommendations he made were exactly what me and my family were looking for never being to NYC. I will definitely be coming back!

title: A Million Stars to everyone at The Towers at Lotte New York Palace! An amazing hotel!
text:
What a fabulous treat staying here was. I chose this hotel for my bachelorette party/trip, and having never been here I was a bit tentative, however, once we arrived I was super impressed and so glad that I had made this my choice hotel for us all. The hotel is immaculate and beautiful, the staff professional and caring, going out of their way to serve you and all your needs, and the location is the best. Absolute walking distance to everyting we needed. Breakfast in the hotel was wonderful and we enjoyed beginning our day here. In the evening after returning to the hotel we had a great time in the bar with some wonderfully cool cocktails. Sleep was great as the room was the perfect temperature, quiet, comfy beds and a large bathroom. Everything we needed was provided.  
Christian at the Concierge Desk was a great help and no matter how many times we asked for directions, recommendations, tickets for somethihg or whatever, he remained helpful, frirendly, warm and kind. He was super accommodating and made our trip just perfect. 
Dalmasi at the mail and information desk was also above and beyond and helped us get a bottle of champagne to a friend who was in NY at the same time, amongst many many other things. 
All the staff, cleaners, wait staff, front desk, etc etc went out of their way to make sure that all was right and that we enjoyed a wonderful time. I highly recommend this hotel and you can be sure that we will stay here again the next time that we are in NY.

title: Great accomodations
text: Had an awesome experience staying at the towers. I use to live in NYC and was expecting low water pressure, but was pleasantly surprised that wasn't the case here :) Rebecca and the rest of the staff were all great and my family enjoyed everything from the spa to the food :) will be booking another stay again.

title: Excellence
text: The hotel stay was excellent!  The suite was in very good condition. Room service staff was phenomenal and the breakfasts that we ordered were delicious. The staff was wonderful especially Rebecca at the Towers front desk! We will definitely come back again!

title: Definitely Top 3 NYC Hotels
text: I love this hotel and I try to stay there every time I have business in NYC. The rooms are so spacious (hard to find in NYC), the gym is great, the food is great and the location is fantastic. Also the staff is amazing! The service and staff are so incredibly pleasant and accommodating - always a 5-star experience. Shout out to Rebecca V in guest services for taking good care of me on this last trip! The staff are really one of the best parts of this hotel.

title: Exquisite Stay-Perfection
text: We had a fabulous time in New York City visiting our daughter. Particularly amazing Rebecca assisted us immeasurably. She never failed to go above and beyond and not a single need of ours was overlooked.

title: Hotel fit for a queen
text:
We had amazing service from the second we parked our car.  We felt appreciated and special with each person that helped us.   Anna-Marie was there to greet us.   She assisted us in making the reservations and then once there set us up with the concierge, Diego and Ani. who both assisted us in making plans for the weekend.  The appearance of the hotel was fantastic.   The trees were decorated so perfectly.  The room had the best view of the city and upon entrance was clean and spacious.  The beds were comfortable, and the kids felt like queens with the robes and slippers.   How posh!
I recommended this hotel to three people since our stay.  We will most definitely be back.

title: If you want luxury, stay at The Lotte Towers
text: The Lotte Towers exceeded my expectations for a luxury stay! The staff was excellent.Rebecca Villasenor particularly is the best representation of this grand 5 Star Hotel; elegant, classy and so very helpful in every way, providing a level of service hard to find elsewhere. The Lotte Towers is a priceless experience!

title: Best hotel
text: This is one of my favorite hotels to come to because it is always clean, the service is amazing and it’s in the best location. Rebecca Villasenor helped us get checked in and made sure we were happy the whole trip. It feels like you are visiting family when you come down and see her from the elevators. She was helpful in recommending the best places to eat and things to do in the area. I highly recommend this hotel and wouldn’t stay anywhere else.

title: Exceptional Stay
text:
I recently had an outstanding stay at Lotte Palace Hotel. The impeccable service provided by Rebecca, truly made my experience exceptional. Her attentiveness, professionalism, and genuine care for guests stood. The hotel itself was a haven of comfort and luxury. The rooms were elegantly appointed, and the amenities provided added an extra layer of indulgence to the experience. 
 I highly recommend both the hotel and commendable staff for a memorable stay.

title: Amazing stay. Service and attention even better!
text: Giving my experience at lotte 5 stars is too few! Special shout outs to Michael and Clara for going above and beyond to make our experience comfortable and memorable. It was a busy, stressful, and sold out weekend stay, but you would never have guessed it. They were kind, attentive, and patient the entire time. World class service at a world class hotel.

title: Festive December Stay at the Palace
text:
In early December, we had the opportunity to return to NYC and of course we would choose to stay at Lotte, our favorite hotel.  However, by the time we tried to reserve a suite the hotel was already sold-out, but Clara and Michael were able to find us a suite at the Palace side.  Even though we had always enjoyed the Towers during our previous stays, the palace signature suite did not disappoint.  The rooms were just as comfortable and meticulously clean, we had a corner suite with gorgeous views, and the staff was superb.  Michael and Clara arranged for early check-in which is important as we had young grandchildren staying with us, and I had requested through Clara ahead of time for a refrigerator and a roll-away, and they were all ready for us.  The gifts of bottle of wine and fruit platter made us feel welcome and appreciated, another sign of attentiveness of Clara and Michael always showed to make our stay an enjoyable experience.  
The courtyard with their iconic Christmas tree, and the holiday decorations throughout the hotel were festive and beautiful.  We even had pictures taken with the Rockettes at the hotel the morning we arrived.  The kids also received a personalized gift from Santa!
We had a most wonderful weekend to kick off the holidays.  Thank you again Lotte for your amazing staff and service.

title: Amazing hotel & Gossip Girl tour
text: Superb location, easy walking distance to Broadway, Fifth Avenue, Central Park, Grand Central Station etc.  Easy check in and despite being busy the staff were very accommodating when we asked if we could be moved to a higher floor.  The Pomme Palais bakery was really good.  All the staff were helpful and friendly.  The hotel looked magical with all the Christmas decorations. A special thank you to Samir who gave our daughters a behind the scene tour of the filming locations in the hotel of Gossip Girl, including Serena’s apartment.  They couldn’t believe their luck - it made their holiday! An absolute highlight!  I’d definitely recommend staying here.

title: Christmas in the City at The Towers at Lotte New York Palace
text: A city stay at The Towers at Lotte New York Palace is a must for any traveler hoping to enjoy a true Christmas trip to NYC.  Our Towers agent named Jimm Kalinka made everything very special for us from ensuring our room was absolutely perfect to helping with suggestions on places to go and things to see.  Perfectly located in mid-town, excellent staff such as Jimm and Clara and you will have a holiday trip with lasting memories.

title: NYC NYE
text:
WOW!!! The Towers are such a wonderful and quiet addition to the Palace. We really enjoyed the extra size of the room and the additional privacy being on the 51st floor! The city view from our King Bed room was AMAZING and had a great unobscured view of the East River in to Queens, along with many of the dizzying city skyscrapers. 

Aside from the exceptional comfort of our room, we found the customer service and, overall, all hotel staff to be very warm, accomodating, and helpful. Norma, our desk receptionist, did an outstanding job helping us check-in, deal with stowing luggage before room time, and giving us a history of the hotel along with tips for city excursions. It was so wonderful to have been able to experience a hotel with staff so kind and welcoming. That seems to be a very rare and unique quality anymore these days.

Thank you for helping make this trip so memorable and welcoming! This has truly been an outstanding stay and one for the memories. Happy New Year!!

title: Lotte NY Palace Rocks!
text: Festive family trip to NYC for New Years. The Lotte Palace is fantastic especially the location. Our concierges, Christian Ribeiro and Diego are top notch and extremely helpful in planning our customized trip and orchestrating last minute, spontaneous reservations. I highly recommend this hotel for a family trip anytime particularly during the holidays.

title: Will not return
text: The staff at the hotel is unfriendly, unwelcoming.  We were very disappointed in our stay, we won't return.   There are multiple other luxury hotel options within a few block radius that we have stayed at and had a much more enjoyable and welcoming experience, in which the Lotte Towers do not compare in experience.

title: The BEST place to stay!
text: The Lotte Palace is our FAVORITE play to stay in New York! Shoutout to Michael who made our check-in process absolutely wonderful! He is so kind, bubbly, and so extremely helpful! He checked us in last year, and we were SO excited when he checked us in this year. He did a fantastic job explaining all the amenities, recommended places nearby, and made us feel so welcome. 10/10 experience! The most Christmassy place in the city!

title: In room service
text: Upon our arrival to our suite I was surprised to see there was no coffee machine....it had to be requested.  When I did, housekeeping brought a machine to our room.  When I asked where to plug it in, he simply said, "behind the fridge" but didn't offer to help move the fridge in order to plug it in.  Turned out the cord was too short!  I moved the machine in the morning but it did not work!  I ordered a second one, which did not work.  When housekeeping came w the 3rd machine, we were told NONE of these machines ever woirk!!  My astonishment was over the top because I was told by the manager of housekeeping he had run the machine before sending it up.  This must have been an outright lie because the emplyee who brought the machine up tried to work it and was unable to.  You may think this is a small complaint but it aggravated me to the point that I do not think your staff cares much for it's guests if a minor request like this cannot be accommodated.  I would not recommend this hotel because of this - seems you'd rather have your guests use the expensive room service & pay staff to deliver a simple item like coffee!!  We paid a premium for our suite AND 2 others.....surely you can do better!!

title: Amazing part of Christmas in New York🎄
text:

5 stars❗️❗️❗️

Our room was fantastic (had a king with pullout bed for the kids) which was very spacious. The location was fantastic to walk to so many different things. 
Thank you for making this a truely extraordinary trip.

title: Great New York fall getaway

Mr Christian Ribeiro at the concierge desk was very helpful friendly and professional .  As for the location it was perfect everything within walking distance .

title: Wonderful Experience And Service

title: A great time!!!

title: The Lotte New York Palace Hotel Met the Challenge

title: What a welcome should be like

title: Subpar experience, far better options in NYC than The Towers at Lotte
text:
Like a few other reviewers, I have no idea how and why people think so highly of this place. This hotel seemingly offers a quintessential, traditional NYC-hospitality experience, but I can assure you they fall short in all aspects. Our experience was extremely frustrating due to malfunctioning equipment in our room and the lack of communication and proactiveness of hotel employees. They disregarded our requests to not enter our room in our absence. Twice they didn't meet their own time estimate and once they couldn't provide one. 
There are far better options in the city. Some rooms may have great views, but the rooms themselves are bad - closer to a motel than a five-star hotel. We stayed because of a complementary third night — I should have known better, I felt sorry all weekend I dragged my wife there. 

Pros:
- Elevated rooms - so nice views. However, ours was facing east, which is the side you want to avoid (nothing is interesting to look at).
- the gym has all the equipment you need
- Villard is a pleasant space and breakfast is really good (coffee and pastries, especially). It takes a while to be acknowledged and seated even when the room is half full (they appreciate it when you make reservations). Don’t order cheese in your omelet; it will make it extremely bitter, and don’t order the avocado toast as they used cheap sliced bread.
- They honor the Amex platinum status seamlessly
- I used Uber, and I noticed too late that their car service has one or more Mercedes Maybach.

Cons:
- Our room wasn’t ready when we arrived at 4:45pm. The front desk was unable to give us a timeline and simply invited us to sit in the lobby. They couldn’t say for how long and invited us to check into another room for the time being. Then, 15 minutes later, the room was ready—a weird, broken experience.
- The hotel is outdated. Old tech in the room (DVD player but no Bluetooth speaker or smart TV). Aging, under-maintained interior decor. Lighting is inadequate. Malfunctioning sheers and shades. Loud A/C. Slow elevators.
- Unresponsive concierge via text. Don’t read requests and don’t communicate (management called and woke me up to warn me they needed to check a breaker in my room for a problem not in our room and then never showed up - I waited for them 2 hrs as I do not like to have surprise visits - I contacted them and they just told me the breaker wasn’t in my room, after all, and they didn’t want to call me and wake me up again).
- When I called out malfunctions in our room, I specifically requested staff not to come to our in our absence. They ignored our request, which was extremely frustrating.
- The lobby area is often crowded with guests standing and waiting with their luggage. It feels like a Hyatt Regency on the day of a large conference, but in a smaller lobby. 
- Some front desk and concierge staff are rude. Upon checking out, we were not asked how our stay was and were not greeted out. Surprising lack of manners.

title: DON'T GO ANYWHERE ELSE!
text: When I think about the Lotte NY Palace, a flood of beautiful memories comes barreling through.  My family and I have been staying at this luxury hotel for almost 2 decades, and I’m sorry it’s taken me this long to write the review that I should have written years ago.  We have stayed in a variety of their rooms in both the Palace and the Towers over the years— singles, doubles, kings, one and two bedroom suites, you name it, and every experience is better than the last.  From the warm and welcoming staff (who know us by name now and who have become like family to us), to the historic Villard Restaurant and perfect Pomme Palais coffee shop downstairs, the Lotte NY Palace has become our home away from home.  We live in Los Angeles and come to NY regularly and we wouldn’t stay anywhere else.  There is a comfort level there that we haven’t been able to duplicate and the hotel is also perfectly located to St. Patrick’s Cathedral, 5th Avenue, Rockefeller Center, Radio City Music Hall, Central Park, and just a 20 minute walk to all of our favorite Broadway shows/theaters (so no need to worry about getting a cab at rush hour)!  We have also celebrated numerous family occasions there over the years, from our daughter’s NYU college graduation to birthdays, anniversaries, and weddings—all such happy and cherished memories, thanks to this fabulous hotel.  But more than anything (including the beautifully appointed, ultra clean, and bright and comfortable rooms), it’s the staff that keeps us coming back year after year…the darling Isaac and Ray, our very favorite doormen; Jimm, Alfred, and the entire front desk staff--especially our beloved Ani, jack of all trades, who happily moves around from desk to desk, and welcomes us back literally with open arms every time we come; and the sweet and kind Miles Gomez, the front office manager who takes the best care of us and on our last visit so graciously upgraded us to the Penthouse Suite!  And the housekeeping and room service staff are all equally as kind and wonderful! We are forever indebted to everyone at the Lotte NY Palace for making EVERY trip we take to the city so special and unforgettable. Can’t wait to come back and see our NY Palace family! :)

title: Disappointed by Subpar Service at Lotte New York Palace
text:
Hotel was booked through Platinum American Express Fine hotel which comes with some benefits  (breakfast for two, $100 experience credit, room upgrade when available)
And this review is truly for a 5-star hotel and experience. Although I would've given this hotel much higher rate if it was a 3-4 star hotel. However, this hotel is considered a true 5-star luxury hotel. 

My rating category for luxury hotel  
*Smooth check in/ check out process
*Customer Service
*Quality of Rooms
*Food/ restaurant 
*Overall experience and attitude of staff and hotel. 

I recently had the opportunity to stay at The Lotte Hotel with high expectations, given its reputation as a five-star establishment. Unfortunately, my experience was far from the luxury and service I had anticipated. From the moment I walked, it was clear that this visit was going to be different.

1) Check in process: Check in process was notably lacking in efficiency and hospitality. Long wait times and an indifferent attitude from staff left me wondering if I had walked into the wrong place. (There was one person working on the desk with numerous people waiting for a check- in.) Smooth Check- in is a fundamental part of positive hotel experience and it was disheartening to see it falter so early on. The staff rushed the check in and did not go over all the benefits of “fine hotel” instead gave me a card that had a list.
2) When I inquired about room upgrade the answer by staff was “we are completely sold out of bigger rooms. We are extremely popular, and we 
 are completely sold out to September.”
Although I understood that the room upgrade was only when available, I did not expect this type of response from a 5-star Hotel to their guest. 
3) My luggage was switched and was delivered to a different room. 
4) Requested a rollaway bed, fridge and some extra amenities since I did not get the upgrade. (This was requested around 3PM)
We left the hotel came back around 9PM expecting a full set up in the room. Unfortunately, nothing was set up upon our return. 

*View of the room was spectacular; however, rooms were outdated, and we were never provided with turndown service. 
Manager did call us and apologized. She tried her best to improve the situation and surprised my kids the next day with some goodies, but unfortunately the next morning it just spiraled once again.

5) We waited close to 30 minutes for breakfast next morning. (The staff during check in should’ve told us to make reservation for the breakfast since our benefits included breakfast for two) Breakfast was rushed and waiters were overwhelmed. They had forgotten about our table, and I had to call a different waiter to make a simple drink order after being seated over 10 minutes. 
6) I tried to speak to the manager in person unfortunately I waited for the manager for 20 minutes and he never showed up.  At this point I felt unheard and undervalued as a guest, and just gave up trying to improve the situation and just walked away. 

The hotel seemed way too busy and chaotic to be considered a 5-star hotel.  Although The Towers have a separate entrance, the chaotic and craziness of the hotel carries into the entrance. 
I believe that every guest deserves to feel valued and respected during their stay, regardless of the circumstances. Unfortunately, my experience at Lotte Hotel did not reflect these principles. 

In conclusion, my stay at The Towers at Lotte Palace fell far short of the five-star experience I had hoped for. I cannot in good conscience recommend this hotel to others until the service and attention to detail improve significantly.

title: Staff
text: I found the staff extremely helpful and accommodating. I had two special requests and they were amazing with both . Specifically Dalmasi Rivera at the mail and information desk went above and beyond to help me . From that standpoint alone it makes you want to return again and again

title: Great location, hotel and price
text:
This is our second time this year staying at the Lotte. Both times have been excellent. Staff, amenities, updated… everything . We have stayed at so many high end hotels in this city’s and have decided this is our new hotel. So often I feel like we are over paying and not getting what we paid for. Here, I feel like the prices for the rooms are fair, and appropriate for what we are getting.

Thank you to the staff, especially Rebecca, Diego and Charles for going out of their way for us. We couldn’t be happier with this hotel.

title: A hotel with people that really care for your well being
text: I am having a wonderful stay at the hotel. The front office manager Miles Gomez was exceptionally nice. I am 7 wks pregnant and he went above and beyond to make me feel comfortable. Highly recommended

title: Staff appreciation - Rebecca and Miles
text: I travel here frequently and this time stayed with my three daughters.  The reason we keep coming back to this particular hotel is the staff. They always go out of their way to make sure everything is taken care of and you are welcomed and treated with kindness and care. This time, we got stuck because of weather and I can’t say enough nice things about Rebecca and Miles who seamlessly handed our change in reservations.  They made the process much easier than it could’ve been.  Thank you, Rebecca and Miles-we truly appreciate it and will be back soon!

title: Best customer service
text: Miles helped my company book a guests’ stay. He was timely, professional and extremely accommodating. We love to book our guests here because of the excellent service he provides and offers. Would highly recommend staying at the Lotte Palace.

title: Amazing
text: Our favorite NYC hotel!! Had my birthday celebration here and upgraded to the Towers. It was absolutely amazing, the room was very large and comfortable, staff was great….bellman, reception desk and bar area.  Would definitely recommend.

title: Staying at the Lotte
text: The experience is phenomenal. The staff treat you well and will upgrade your room. Michael Frick was such a sweetheart and very knowledgeable about all things musicals and NYC. Amazing experience. If there’s a place to stay while in NYC, the Lotte Palace is the place to be.

title: A home away from home in NYC
text:
I love the Lotte New York Palace. I have been staying on the towers side for the past 10+ years and have been in the main part of the hotel as well. On the Towers side, you feel like you are in a world of your own. 

From when you arrive, the doormen, including big George, greet you and see so happy to see you. In coming for years, I always feel welcome and valued. My son has grown up coming here and he and a George have a special connection. 

At the front desk, Jimm has been amazing to me and my family and always goes the extra mile. He makes my stay extra special and always is kind and friendly. Anna Marie is also amazing and so kind. You can tell they love being there. 

The rooms are spacious, especially for NYC, and if you can get a view of Fifth Avenue, you are in great shape. 

I always like staying on higher floors, for a more expansive view of the city - especially at night - but really, the hotel does not seem to have a bad view (or I have gotten lucky with my stays!). 

If you need some extra help with what to do while you are in NYC, stop at the concierge desk - they spend so much time helping make sure you have options - and they can help you get reservations or pre-buy tickets. Ani is so sweet and kind. And always gives an extra smile to my son. Isabella and Kal are terrific too! They know the City inside and out and have never led me astray. And they take the time to make sure you know what you need to. If you need something - go see one of them!

The food is terrific at the hotel and there are options for even the pickiest of eaters. 

The bell staff is super fast and helpful. 

You are walking distance to Rockefeller Center - a huge plus at the holidays! - and always close to shopping and transportation. 

I cannot recommend this hotel enough. It is my home away from home when I come back “home” to New York City!

I would definitely look at the Towers side of the Palace when you consider where to stay in Manhattan.

title: Thank you, Miles!
text: I have always dreamed of having my bachelorette party at the Palace and was so excited for the trip. When we told the Palace we were here for such a celebration, they went above and beyond to make it breathtakingly memorable! Miles was so incredibly helpful and ensured I experienced the weekend of my dreams! I can't express how much his help made everything so special and memorable for me! I will absolutely be staying here again and recommending it to anyone who will listen! THANK YOU to Miles & the Palace team for giving me the experience of a lifetime! It was beyond perfect!

title: Incredible Adult Excursion in the City
text: Absolutely Amazing weekend at the Towers @ NY Palace.  We typically do a family vacation at the Towers each year but this year we found ourselves as empty nesters.  What an incredible opportunity to do the City from a different adult perspective.  The hotel is located in walking distance of Saks, Bergdorf and all the fabulousness that is 5th Avenue. Walking distance to the most sought after reservations at Monkey Bar, Polo Bar, and the Cafe at Bergdorf.  The concierge Diego was able to secure reservations that we could not get ourselves. Fabulous restaurants like Carbone and Il Mulino.  Tip: call Diego at the time of booking to work on your reservations and attractions.   The service at the Towers is top notch. Rebecca was our guest service agent for the week and catered to our every whim.  Our personal bellman Angel greeted us each morning with water and transportation for our daily cit excursions. No better way to enjoy NYC

title: Lotte Palace Towers NYC
text: Wonderful stay at the Towers of the Lotte Palace. Breathtaking views from our spacious room on the 53rd floor. Great location! The bellmen and doormen were wonderful, very friendly and helpful. We enjoyed a delicious breakfast at VILLARD RESTAURANT. Rebecca checked us in upon arrival. We were glad to see her again when we checked out. She offered dining suggestions and was very sweet.

title: Great hotel, better service
text: The hotel checks all the boxes for a more classic nyc getaway weekend. Lincy at reception was amazing and incredibly helpful to make our stay memorable and check in a breeze. The location is fairly central in the city and walkable to many tourist attractions in midtown and to Grand Central for easy transport around the rest of New York.

title: NYC summer visit.
text: Centrally located to all the places you eant to visit: Times Square,  Broadway, Central Park, etc., all walking distance.  From the moment you arrive to the moment you leave, you are taken care of by  professionals like guest service worker Jorge or doormen, Micheal. Gorgeous views and an extremely comfortable room. A must stay!

title: Perfect NY Experience!
text: My wife and I spent several nights at the Palace with our daughter and her two friends celebrating a 14th birthday. From the moment we arrived at the Palace, the staff was fantastic.  They welcomed us like family, assisted with reservations, and always had a smile and positive comment.  The rooms were clean, well-appointed, spacious, and had fantastic views.  Our main contact Miles Gomez (Front Office Manager) took care of everything we needed.  You will love the hotel and its location!

title: Best Trip Ever
text: Our stay at The Towers at Lotte New York Palace was unforgettable! For starters, when our original accommodation was no longer available, the manager Miles Gomez offered us a wonderful upgrade. It was incredible! Also, all the staff were so friendly and helpful. The amenities were fabulous. The location is perfect. Everything about this hotel is top notch. I can’t imagine staying anywhere else when I return to New York City.

title: Gets it done
text: Lindy found a way to enable an early check in when travel plans did not work as planned. The room was nice and comfortable and everyone on staff helpful and friendly. Travel can be chaotic and when things work as expected you get time to enjoy what’s around you.

title: My favorite Hotel in Manhattan
text:
One of my favorite Hotel in Manhattan.

title: Zelaya NY Vacation

Ruben, Gina, JT and Julian Zelaya

title: Luxury Bachelorette weekend
text: I had an amazing time in one of their suites for my bachelorette party! The service is incredible, too. Ask for Miles - he gave us great recommendations for brunch and bars in the area

title: Amazing customer service and kindness! Beautiful hotel!!
text: My sisters and I visited this hotel because of its significance in Gossip Girl, one of our favorite shows. We met Miles Gomez there and he offered us a personal tour of filming sites and the suites on site. He was kind and generous and offered information about possible future stays and allowed us to visit places in the hotel that were meaningful to Gossip Girl fans. There are not many people in the world who would take the time to be as kind as Miles was to us, and I would highly recommend visiting this hotel if you are ever in the area and staying there. Each of the staff members that we came into contact with were gracious and kind. I will definitely be staying at this hotel in the future. What a beautiful spot!!

title: Best hotel in NYC! Luxurious, Comfortable, Spacious, Friendly, Iconic location
text:
Wow, what an incredible experience!  I booked a weekend with my sister and friends at Lotte and was blow away by the level of customer service, the comfort of the rooms and the incredible location.  Paul and Miles truly ensured we had the best stay and the best weekend, they really elevated our experience to another level!  We stayed in the Jewel Suite, a one of a kind 3 story suite with the most gorgeous views of NYC and the most comfortable bed I have ever slept on. The terrace of this suite is not to be missed! 

Some of our other guests stayed in Palace Tower king rooms and had an equally amazing experience. The size of even a standard king room is way larger than the average hotel room in NYC, so our entire party was extremely comfortable.  Coming from CA, we are used to space and large rooms and the Lotte rooms were huge!  No one wanted to leave! 

The room service was absolutely delicious and anything we needed for the room came quickly.  

I cannot acknowledge enough how helpful and accommodating and kind everything at the Lotte was and the level of warmth we were greeted with at every corner. We truly felt like the princesses of the Lotte! The location is also perfect, near 5th ave, Saks, St. Patrick’s cathedral, a lot of beautiful bars and restaurants and coffee shops. We walked a lot because of the convenience and the gorgeous weather. 

Thank you so much everyone at Lotte, Paul and Miles for truly making our weekend unforgettable and spectacular!  What a gem of a hotel, we will definitely be back time and time again, I can’t imagine ever staying anywhere else in NYC ever again.

title: Perfection
text: The Towers at Lotte New York Palace were nothing short of perfect. We were greeted by incredible staff who cared for us all trip. Miles was amazing - he made us feel so special and made sure my friend had a perfect birthday. Cal, Charlie, Ray, and Maurice were so accommodating. We can’t wait to come back!!!

title: Enjoyable Stay and Helpful Staff!
text: Enjoyed staying at the Towers while visiting NY for business.  Accommodations were exceptional, restaurant served appetizing food and staff were extremely helpful, especially Jimm!  Looking forward to staying there again!

title: Mehr überdurchschnittliches Business- als Luxushotel
text:
Bei unserem ersten Aufenthalt im New York Palace Towers, konnte uns das Hotel nicht so recht überzeugen. Auch wenn Forbes dem Towers 5 Sterne zugesteht, von uns gibt es nur gute 4 Sterne. Das Hotel ist mehr Business- als Luxusherberge. Der letzte Schliff fehlt aus unserer Sicht. 

Die öffentlichen Bereiche sind so, wie man es von den älteren Hotels kennt und erwartet. Etwas dunkel gehalten, aber sehr gut gepflegt, ob Halle, Empfang oder Flure. Das Restaurant, der Goldroom ist extrem dunkel, was besonders beim Frühstück nicht so recht Wohlfühlatmosphäre aufkommen lässt.

Die Zimmer der einfachen Kategorie sind einfach mit wenig Mobiliar, aber zweckmäßig eingerichtet. Dazu wirken sie nicht mehr ganz so frisch. Die Suiten, wir erhielten ein Upgrade, sind dagegen natürlich besser und komfortabler - aber könnten auch eine Auffrischung und ein bisschen Deko gebrauchen. Die Bad war der 5 Sterne Kategorie entsprechend, mit abgetrennter Dusche, Badewanne und einem in den USA eher seltenen Bidet. Über die Badeartikel von Molton Brown haben uns natürlich überzeugt. Hervorzuheben, der Blick auf Die Stadt vom Zimmer aus.

Das im Goldroom Frühstück war in Ordnung, die dafür aufgerufenen Preise, sofern das Frühstück nicht inklusive ist, jedoch nicht. 2 Personen 150,- USD ist schon eine Hausnummer für nichts außergewöhnliches. 

Der Service im Hotel hat uns nicht überzeugt. Insgesamt hatten wir bei einem 5-Sterne-Rating mehr erwartet. Der Service ist nicht zu vergleichen mit dem Service, etwa im St. Regis, dem Peninsula oder dem Pierre. Hervorzuheben nur die Bell-Mannschaft und die Reinigungsfee unserer Etage.

Das Preis-Leistungsverhältnis stimmt in diesem Hotel aus unserer Sicht nicht. Mit rund 800,- Euro pro Nacht ist das zwar nicht teurer als andere Luxushotels in der Stadt, allerdings bietet es auch weniger. Wer persönlichen Service und Individualität sucht, ist hier falsch. Im Lotte zählt das Geschäft. Aus diesem Grund würden wir dem Haus auch nur 4 sehr gute geben. Für den 5 Stern reicht es aus unserer Sicht nicht. Auf Grund seiner Lage würden wir das Hotel aber durchaus empfehlen.

title: Literally a Palace
text: We had originally booked two regular rooms, but we were upgraded to a lovely two bedroom suite. It was so lavish and had beautiful views of the city. The staff was amazing. We were also very impressed by the laundry service we received. The shirts were so nicely folded, and they even kept their fold in our suitcase throughout our long journey home. We can’t wait to come back!

title: Manhattan you wish for
text: Everything you wish for in a hotel - but rarely find. Super friendly & helpful staff, excellent rooms with top quality details, a great view and ideal location in midtown Manhattan from which to enjoy the city!

title: A Lotte to love at the Palace!
text: My go-to NYC hotel. Fantastic location, cozy bedding, chic bar and restaurants, but the real treasure: concierge extraordinaire, Kal Naim. He secured us tickets to the Taylor Swift concert (and had transportation options ready and waiting when I checked in).  Couldn’t have been easier or more fun. Thanks, Kal!

title: Amazing stay and a special thank you to Kal at the concierge
text: We had a lovely stay at the Lotte Palace - room and location were just perfect.  Kal at the concierge was the kindest and most patient and helpful man ever and helped my daughter sort out the logistic to the concert. Thank you Kal also for recommending a good place to eat real Neapolitan pizza :-)

title: Amazing stay
text: Amazing stay at the palace!! The room was perfect and staff very kind. I would especially like to give credit to Kal at the concierge, he went above and beyond to help me and I am very thankful made my stay 1000 time easier. Thank you kal!!!

title: ONE OF THE BEST IN NYC
text:
We can gladly and confidently say that for us  THE LOTTE NEW YORK PALACE  is 5 stars in every category. This is the best experience you can have in New York City! Fabulous views, excellent accommodations, lovely restaurants/ bar, The hotel  itself is so beautiful!!, “The  staff was exceptional., very attentive and friendly.
LOTTE  NEW YORK PALACE is right in the heart of the city. It is located just few steps  from St Patricks Cathedral, Rockefeller  Center , Radio  City Music Hall, Grand Central terminal just to mention a few iconic places. If you  want a really luxurious indulgent experience try one of the best !!
THE LOTTE NEW YORK PALACE

title: There’s no place like the Palace!
text: Bravo and Brava! I have had the luxury off and on to stay at the New York Palace for over 20 years. As always, the level of professionalism and commensurate excellence from the entire team was palpable. From the iconic doormen and bellmen, to such formidable team members as Miles and Stacy. They all delivered with a vengeance. Our family looks forward to many future stays! There’s no place like the Palace.

title: An Experience- but a bit dated.
text:
First off, in all my travels I’ve never encountered a front office manager or any front of house staff the likes of Miles Gomez. Such a warm, genuine, personable person who truly makes you feel like you are his biggest priority. 
As far as the hotel, it has a very special vibe similar to what was the Waldorf, Astoria, New York. It is full of visiting foreign dignitaries (Even foreign Military Generals in full uniform) and a very professional staff who obviously have massive tenure here. 
That being said, the hotel is dated and is in need of a complete renovation. 
Great experience though; I would give it 4.3 stars.

title: Palace Stay
text:
The New York Palace is a grand old school hotel,
But what sets it apart is the outstanding staff.
Our concierge, Kal, made the “impossible” happen for our family of four and procured
Same day theater tickets. He did this cheerfully and with a smile! A true asset to a remarkable
Hotel. Everyone in service was patient and helpful
which is why we consistently return when we visit New York.

title: Giovanini Family Trip
text: My family’s experience with the Towers at Lotte New York Palace could not have been any better. Miles and Ani, the front office manager and our concierge were absolutely delightful, and truly the highlight of our stay! They were both kind, helpful, and professional, but what left the greatest impact was how personal they made the experience for us. They each communicated with us - prior to our check in date - to get to know my kids, my husband, and myself in an effort to truly make our vacation the best it could be. Miles and Ani dig deeper and learned all of our interests and hobbies, allowing them to find ideal suggestions and recommendations too. Everybody at the hotel really went above and beyond, and really made all of us feel important and special as individuals, not just as a group! Most of all, Miles was nothing short of a friend to us while we were there. He even took the better part of his day off, showed us the hotel’s crowning penthouse, and joined my family and me for a relaxed tour around uptown Manhattan. Furthermore, he reached out to a connection and found a way to give us a special look at the rooftop gardens at Rockefeller center - a filming location from several of my family’s favorite shows and movies! - and all of this on his own personal time. The personal experience he gave us meant the world to all four of us, and we can’t possibly thank him enough!

title: Great service at the Lotte New York Palace
text: We used the Lotte for our guests who came to NYC for our daughters wedding that was nearby. We couldn't have been happier with the services provided. We were given an excellent wedding room block rate. Certain people wanted coextend it and they were accommodated. The staff was very helpful to us and all our guests! We HIGHLY recommend the Lotte! Looking forward to staying again!

title: Towers Stay
text: This hotel exceeded all of our expectations. Miles Gomez was the absolute best in every aspect and added so much to our trip to make it the best. Charlie helped us out so much and treated us like family. Ray was the best doorman we could ask for. Kal was helpful in everything we could ask for. Maurice led the best tour throughout the hotel and doubled and the best photographer. We love the Lotte New York Palace, especially The Towers experience.

title: The Best Spot to Relax in Midtown
text: The Towers are my favorite place to end the day in NYC. The rooms are well appointed and very clean and fresh. The atmosphere is relaxed and conducive to recharging for another day. The staff is always so pleasant and are the most helpful of any I have encountered. I love Rarities, the bar featuring rare and unique spirits of all types dating back over a hundred years sometimes. All in all, my favorite place to stay in Manhatten.

title: Oasis in busy NYC
text:
Miles and Clara were wonderful. They helped us a lot and made sure we enjoyed our stay at the Tower. The executive suite was immaculate, spacious, comfortable, and had everything we needed and more. The room came with lots of amenities and a beautiful view of St. Patrick's cathedral and west of midtown from Madison Ave. Because the room was spacious and quiet, you did not feel like you were in NYC.

We ordered room service for breakfast. The food was very fresh and tasty. Everyone was very friendly and open to spending time with us to recommend what to do in NYC for the weekend.

We lived in NYC for more than 10 years and return to visit once in a while. We could not have stayed at a better place for a weekend in NYC.

title: Fabulous Easter Getaway
text: We can confidently rate the hotel 5 stars in every category. This is the best experience you can have in New York City! Absolutely fabulous views, excellent accommodations, lovely restaurants/bar and superb service.The hotel itself is so beautiful and iconic, the location awesome just steps from Saks 5th Ave, Rockefeller center, and right across from St Patricks Cathedral. We have stayed in various rooms and suites and every one of them has been superb. This time was spectacular .... if you ever want a really luxurious indulgent experience try one of their fabulous penthouse suites, the views are breathtaking, the amenities and service beyond anything you can ask for. Hats off to the fabulous staff and a beautiful hotel. Thank you from our Hearts for making this visit truly special we cant wait to be back in July. Special thanks to Miles, Nancy, Ruth, Ani, Papa, Chris, Eddie, Samir. We cant say enough great things about our experience.

title: buen hotel, excelente ubicacion
text: exelente servicio, muy como, lugar centrico, a 5 minutos de varios lugares turisticos, puedes llegar caminando sin problema, el cuarto totalmente limpio, con cafe de cortescia en la entrada, ademas de una almohadas super comodas

title: Best birthday ever!
text: We stayed at the Lotte New York Palace for my 40th birthday. There were 6 of us across 3 rooms. I will absolutely stay here again! The location is ideal. The rooms are so comfortable. The concierge is incredibly helpful. And our trip was PERFECT! I cannot wait to return.

title: Nice hotel in great midtown location
text: We enjoyed our time at the Lotte Towers.  Staff were very friendly and helpful.  Appreciated they reached out via chat as well re housekeeping etc.  But bathrooms need updating (for a 5 star hotel having an old bathtub is unexpected) and was disappointed that lobby bar has still not re-opened post pandemic and that the mini bar was left bare as well.  Most other hotels including in NYC of this caliber have resumed full amenities.

title: Amazing Stay in NYC to celebrate birthdays!
text: This is the very best hotel in NYC!  All arrangements were made by Jimm Kalinka at the Towers and, as always, he did a spectacular job attending to every detail of our stay.  We were there to celebrate our birthdays and all three of us were made to feel special with every big and small detail that Jimm put in place for us! We were registered quickly and when we returned from our busy day, we were greeted with champagne before getting on the elevator.  The room was amazing and the bed and linens are of the very highest quality.  Jimm saw to every possible detail before I even knew I needed something. Jimm also has the best recommendations for where to find any type of restaurant or anything you may need. I can recommend Jimm and the NY Palace Towers with the highest assurances of a most amazing, wonderful and most comfortable stay in New York City!  Also, the location is in the middle of everything and close to all attractions you could possibly want to see!

title: A big THANK YOU to Miles
text: Miles Gomez was extremely friendly, helpful and did an excellent job of accommodating our special requests - thanks so much for going above and beyond with service. It made the stay much more relaxing and enjoyable !!!!

title: Thank you, Lincy!
text:
I’m back at the Lotte New York Palace after just a shade over five months.  How does a great place get even better?  Well, first of all, special shout out to Lincy at The Towers.  Like last November, I rolled into Manhattan at 8:40a, after having had barely two hours sleep, on a red-eye from San Francisco.  She remembered me from my last visit, and *she let me into my room,* although check-in time isn’t until 4p.  I don’t know what I would have done without her.
Also, room service hours have been extended!  I understand that services were curtailed across the industry during the pandemic, but this is a great boon to someone like me, who comes here alone for the theater.  I don’t get back to the hotel room until after 11:00p, and at my previous visit, room service stopped at 10:30; now it’s available until 2:00a.
I hate leaving.  I can’t wait to come back.

title: Amazing Vacation April 1-8-2023
text: We spent seven nights at the Lotte Towers Hotel. Our room was spacious, the queen beds were very comfortable, and the view from the 53rd floor was spectacular! All staff members, including the front desk, hotel porters, servers, and housekeeping, were kind, courteous, and friendly. The concierge team, including Diego, Rene, and Kal, went above and beyond assisting with event tickets, dinner reservations, directions, and overall knowledge of the city. We were very impressed with their expertise and willingness to help with every detail in planning the itinerary for our trip. The Gold Room was a highlight as we enjoyed drinks and light appetizers before heading out for the evening. My husband and I enjoyed a lovely rare tequila at Rarities. The server was very knowledgeable about aged liquors, and we enjoyed our conversation with him. My daughter is a major Gossip Girl fan, so she had a great time seeing the hotel in real life. Our stay was enjoyable, and we are already talking about when we will return to NYC and stay at The Lotte again. Thank you for helping us make beautiful memories!

title: First trip to the Big Apple with a 16 year old
text:
We chose The Lotte New York Palace because of its location, but now I can not only recommend for location, but also for the quality and service it offers. 

I emailed prior to our stay with room requests such as kettle and also a higher floor. Both requests were accommodated - for which I am very grateful. 

Prior to arriving. Diego ( concierge) replied to my emails with my queries regarding tourist attractions etc. His suggestions and prompt, friendly replies made me feel at ease planning the days of my trip. 

During my stay Christian ( Concierge) helped us understand the Subway. He also suggested two restaurants, booking them for me and texting me with the time and location. 

Miles Gomez ( Front Desk Manager) allowed us to swap rooms on our last day, so we could stay in a room for longer as we had a very late flight. For this I am most grateful, we could enjoy some more sightseeing and come back to the comfort of private facilities before our long flight. 

House keepers did a great job, lovely comfy beds, spotlessly clean rooms and they greeted you with a cheerful smile when we saw them. 

In my opinion, the upgrade to a Cathedral view is a must, the view it amazing of St Patrick’s, which being slightly lower means you get great views of Rockefeller, Top of the Rocks and the NY skyline.  We had room  2620. 

Subway is just 5 mins walk either to Lexington 51st St or at Rockefeller. 

I was a nervous mum bringing my son to New York on my own. I felt safe in and around the hotel even walked back from restaurants at night. 

Thank you to all the staff at the Lotte New York Palace…. You made my son’s first trip to the States perfect!

title: LOVE!!!
text: Beautiful hotel. Friendly staff. Great location. Drinks in the gold room and a vanilla latte from the adorable coffee shop is a must! Advice: when leaving hotel room allow 10 minutes for the elevators. Overall loved the Lotte. My husband and I will 100% be back again!

title: Clara and Miles at the front desk made our stay extra special. Thank you!
text:
Prior to arriving New York City I called Lotte New York Palace and Clara answered all my questions and ensured our room reservation details were accurate.

Today, Clara and Miles welcome us and were very cordial. They took care of me and my friends from the moment we arrived till we went up to our room. 

Our stay has been so wonderful! The hotel employees have been so warm and welcoming. Oh and Peter the Bellhop was also wonderful! Thank you all so much!

title: Best hotel and staff in the city!!!
text: The whole experience was top notch. The concierge gave the best brunch recommendation. The bell hop was so friendly and helpful and storing my luggage. Most of all, Clara and Miles at the front desk seamlessly checked us in, prepared our room, and provided extra stuff in our room, since we were having a girls weekend. Love love love this hotel and its staff!! What an amazing experience!

title: NYC Visit 3/9-14
text:
This was our 1st trip back to NY in over 10 years - due to business, retiring 4 years ago and health concerns.  The Lotte New York Palace was recommended by our daughter-in-law and her sister, they stayed in late November 2022. We also had explored through Amex Travel Fine Hotels & Resorts, which we have used many times over the years.
The Lotte New York Palace had many outstanding employees - which we would like to mention:
Bellman-George, he met us and handled our baggage - Maurice, Lobby Customer Service Agent who helped us and directed us with our inquiries and gave us a great place close by for lunch, Kadir, waiter at Villard who helped several mornings at breakfast, Jose' the Gold Room bartender and Nicola' -gold Room waiter - both helped us several nights in the Gold Room and made our stay very pleasant and comfortable - with their stories and caring attention. Two gentlemen not on staff but enriched our stay was the Gift Shop owner with his daily help and Kevin Draper who provided the Mansion Tour.  Housekeeping was very helpful, attentive, and always close by and helpful.  The concierges were helpful in arranging our airport transportation and the car services provided were excellent.  Our trip was to see our granddaughter sing at Carnegie Hall & visit a few museums, a jeweler we use, and St Patrick's Cathedral.  We accomplished all and were well pleased with the Hotel and NYC - a wonderful trip.
A few points on the room - it was comfortable but could easily be updated in a few inexpensive ways: 1) provide USB plugs or pads for charging phones, 2) have the desk chairs with wheels or footed to slide easier, 3) add a hand bar in the shower, 4) add a built in "footstep" or bench in the shower, and 5) add a spray wand in the shower.

Thank you very much and we hope to return again in the coming year.  

Have A Great Year

title: Our Favorite Family Hotel
text: It is with much gratitude that I share my heartfelt thanks to the staff of the Lotte. They are truly superior to any other. They are kind, enthusiastic, helpful and attentive. We had the best time especially thanks to Louis, Maurice and Lincey. We celebrated a big birthday for my son and it was a trip we’ll never forget! Maurice made our son feel like a real prince and we look forward to seeing him and his teammates again upon our return (hopefully soon)!

title: Best service ever for Birthday
text: Sandy, Miles, Charles and Maurice were amazing!!!! They did everything possible to make it my friend’s birthday beyond special!!! Best service we could imagine!!! Couldn’t ask for a more accommodating staff!!

title: 4.5...wish we could give 1/2 star increments...not quite a 5
text:
We really enjoyed our stay at the Lotte Towers overall, but it's not quite on par with other 5-star properties. Close, but there's a few things that keep it from that top category...I'll let you be the judge.

First the "pros," since there were many! The category of room that we booked 
(executive suite, king tower) was very large by any standard, and particularly so by NYC standards. The pictures of the suite posted by the hotel itself are true to life. The furnishings are a tiny bit dated, but of high quality, tasteful and cohesive. The views from the 44th floor are incredible.  Our suite looked directly at the cathedral and beyond. 

There is generous closet space. The towels are thick, the bedding is comfortable, and the Molton Brown toiletries were generously supplied and replaced as needed (in addition to the usual, we were provided with an eye gel and a "lip saver" gel, plus shaving kit, dental kit, vanity kit, etc.)  Water bottles were in the room and freely given each day.  The temperature of the room could be adjusted, and better yet, the windows can crack open for those who love fresh air even in February. 

The location is good depending on your plans, of course.  It's about a 15-20 minute walk through well populated areas to the Broadway shows, but a few blocks away (so, quieter) from the craziness of Times Square. 

Now for the "cons." The room is not as modern or as thoughtful as a 5-star property should be.  There are no usb ports by the bed. The bathroom has a huge tub but a small shower (although, the shower is strong and satisfying.) Also - pet peeve here - the shower has no shaving perch for the ladies, and the only shelf is one of those tiny wire corner toiletry holders that's just big enough to hold the tiny toiletry bottles, but not your razor. The toilet is not in its own compartment, and is not even in a discrete corner of the bathroom - it's directly adjacent to one of the sinks.  What this means is that whoever is using that sink is practically sitting on the toilet itself. 

There is an oddly empty-looking cabinet/minibar in the room that might have been meant to hold a coffeemaker, but none was supplied. Possibly you could ask for one, but should you have to in a 5-star property? There was a refrigerator in a cabinet in the room, but it had a big sign on it warning you not to store anything of your own in it. The sign advised that you could request a separate refrigerator if you wanted one, but again, who wants to do that and have an ugly refrigerator sitting openly in your room? Not quite a 5-star experience.

The Lotte Tower elevators are very, very small and there aren't enough of them.  From the 44th floor, we often had to let some elevators go as they were too crowded. And, there was usually a wait, so you would need to build that time into your itinerary.

We booked this room using our Amex through the Fine Hotels program, which grants free daily breakfast as well as late (4pm) checkout. (The program also grants a free room upgrade when available...for those Amex users who care about this feature, we were not granted an upgrade, which is rare but it does happen...that said, we were very satisfied with our category of room and an upgrade wasn't a big deal in this circumstance.)  I mention the Amex FHR program because the free breakfast means you will want to eat breakfast on the property every day.  And, this is a problem at the Lotte Towers. The breakfast restaurant, Villard, is lovely but way too small for a hotel of this size.  On Sunday, we were turned away because we did not have a reservation (we wanted an unplanned Sunday morning...not advisable at this property with such a tiny restaurant.) We were able to use our FHR breakfast credit for room service instead, but the 45m delivery estimate turned into over an hour (probably an elevator/wait problem!) which kept us in the hotel on Sunday longer than we had hoped.

Finally, despite alerting the hotel that we would be using our late checkout benefit, the cleaning staff attempted to come into our room to clean no fewer than three times that last day. Each time, we explained we would not be checking out for a few more hours, but then it happened again and again. We ended up leaving for the airport an hour earlier than planned, deciding that the airport lounge would be more restful than the pushiness of the cleaning staff.

These "cons" would not keep me from staying at the Lotte Towers again...the space alone is magnificent and the views from this category of room are just wonderful and well worth some of the "cons" mentioned...but I would be comparing it price-wise to other properties in NYC. If breakfast on site, at leisure and without preplanning, is an important aspect of the trip, I definitely would not stay at the Lotte Towers. If a modern room (i.e., with updated amenities such as bedside usb, large shower and separate toilet compartment) is a priority, also pass on this property.  All that said, a solid 4.5 from me.

title: Impeccable Stay
text: Absolutely impeccable service! George entertained our children with karaoke when our car service was late, Maurice gave multiple teddy bears, crowns and advice to our group of six girls celebrating their seventh birthdays. Miles, the manager, made check in seamless. We could not ask for a better location or better staff. We look forward to making this an annual trip!

title: Best Stay in New York
text: I had an excellent experience staying at the The Towers. The location was perfect for getting around the city. I really appreciate Chris Vasquez for assisting with the reservation and the excellent suggestions he gave to explore the city. His customer service experience was excellent and I cannot wait until I am back in New York again!

title: An absolute must stay location
text: I traveled to NYC for a friend’s 50th birthday. We had THE BEST experience at the Lotte New York Palace. Front Office Manager Miles Gomez provided exceptional service. He was great to work with in the planning stages and went above and beyond to personalize our stay. Miles is warm and genuine in wanting every guest to feel celebrity status! The entire guest services staff made us feel so welcome upon arrival and every interaction along the way exceeded my expectations. Bellman George Matos also made our experience fun and memorable. Every staff member was friendly and accommodating. The two-bedroom suite we stayed in was stunning. It was spacious, beautifully decorated, immaculate and comfortable. I highly recommend the Lotte New York Palace and cannot wait to stay again.

title: Birthday celebration!
text: I just celebrated my 50th birthday at this beautiful hotel! Miles Gomez (front office manager) and the ENTIRE staff were nothing short of amazing! We were welcomed with warmth and a smile by everyone we encountered.   Our suite was amazing and Miles took care of every special detail possible.  From a bottle of delicious champagne in our room to a beautiful and festive plate of macaroons, he thought of everything we needed and wanted! Our suite was large, spacious, clean and modern.  I can’t wait to go back!  Thank you Miles and the entire staff, you made this birthday girl very very happy!

title: Excellent service!
text: It is always a pleasure to stay at The Palace, specifically The Towers. The service is a step above - Miles, Jim, and Clara go above and beyond to take care of us and make this place feel like a home away from home!!

title: Recent stay at the towers - amazing!!
text: My boyfriend and I had the most amazing stay in The Towers and incredible getaway to NYC! Our suite was so spacious and the views of the Cathedral were breathtaking. The hotel’s location is perfect and just steps from Saks Fifth Avenue and Rockefeller Center. I can’t wait to return for another visit this summer. Everything was amazing from start to finish and I can’t say enough good things about my stay

title: N a rien d un palace hormis sa déco et sa situation géographique. A déconseiller pour des français
text: Hôtel très bien situé, vue magnifique hôtel très joli. Toutefois services médiocres pour le prix personne ne fait d effort pour se faire comprendre en français. Hôtel bruyant. Pas de café ou thé en chambre pas de mini bar. Et technologie des années 80

title: Above and Beyond
text: Staff members we encountered were friendly, courteous, and helpful. Especially Miles! He not only helped us with a special request, he went out of his way to give  us a tour of this gorgeous hotel. He’s a gem!

title: Better Second Time Around
text: Second time at this hotel in 2023 was much better. Had two 2 bedroom suites and we were pretty comfortable, they really are a good value if you need the space. Location is good and this time we had breakfast included which we enjoyed every day. Food was good but service a bit slow at times. Together with location, the doormen and bellmen continue to be their best asset.

title: Excellent stay!
text:
We had an amazing stay here for a long weekend in February for my teenage nephew's first trip to NYC. For this trip, I wanted a family-friendly suite in Midtown, and couldn't have picked a better property. The location is excellent: it's very close to the best shopping and easy to get to all the major sights and activities on your list. It doesn't feel chaotic, though, and we really enjoyed coming back to relax after a full day of running around town. 

I specifically want to recognize the excellent customer service we received. On check-in, due to a mix-up with our original reservation, Miles, the manager, immediately upgraded us to a corner suite in The Towers. It was spacious with great views, a kitchenette and plenty of bedroom/bathroom space for everyone to feel comfortable. My nephew became ill on the day we were leaving, and the front desk staff graciously arranged a much later checkout for us and made sure we were stocked with masks and tissues before leaving for the airport. 

We also had treatments at the ila Only spa, which was the perfect way to end a day that started with climbing the Statue of Liberty, haha. We ordered coffee and pastries at Pomme Palais a couple of times but did not dine on property otherwise. I do look forward to visiting again, though, and think this is a great luxury hotel in Midtown for any type of travel.

title: Wonderful hotel experience!
text: I went with my two girls to stay in NYC for the weekend not knowing the hotel service at the Lotte New York Palace almost trumped our actual experiences! From the moment we walked in, we were greeted kindly with nice smiles. Our hotel room ended up being upgraded and Miles, was such an amazing help! Thank you Miles for everything! You made our stay wonderful! What an amazing hotel.

title: Feels like home!
text: We stay here frequently for business and vacation travel and it’s our favorite NYC hotel. The staff are consistently friendly and helpful. We grab breakfast at Pomme Palais every morning before heading out to work and love the great selection of pastries and breakfast sandwiches as well as the piping hot coffee (extra points for the coffee sleeves!). The rooms are generously sized and the windows open so that you can adjust the in-room climate to your taste. There are convenient and plentiful outlets. The bathrooms are stocked with Molton Brown bath products and the bath sheets are plush without pilling. The garage is convenient (and covered) with a doorway directly into the hotel lobby so you’re protected from the elements and can unload/pack your car with relative privacy. There is a downstairs lounge which has a private club feel and plush soft spaces keeping the noise levels down and providing a nice spot for cocktails and conversation. We can’t wait until our next stay!

title: Best hotel ever!!!
text: Stayed at the Lotte Palace with my friends to celebrate New Years and had the absolute best experience. I could seriously go on and on about how friendly and helpful the staff were here and always greeted us with a smile every time we arrived back at our hotel. Our room had the best view of the city and a great set up. Miles Gomez was especially helpful and went above and beyond to make sure our stay was perfect. We will definitely be staying at the Lotte again for our next visit to NY.

title: Best service I have ever experienced!
