We stayed at the Lotte Palace and I was so excited because this was where Serena lived on Gossip Girl. When I was taking a picture in front of the court yard, a security gaurd named Maurice offered to show me other spots in the hotel that Gossip Girl was filmed. I was so excited! He took me throughout the hotel and showed me where some of the scenes were shot. He even told me exactly where to stand for pictures! He was so nice and gave me a crown similar to the one Blair Waldor wore! This was the most exciting part of my trip! He gave me a memory that I will cherish forever!

title: Incredible staff and hotel!
text:
I had an incredible 3 night stay at the Towers! The Towers staff were all very helpful and professional. If there was any request, they responded very promptly. I would highly recommend staying here- felt wonderful coming back to the towers after a day of touring. 
One of the highlights was Mauricio gave me and my family a gossip girls tour! It was so awesome! My family got to appreciate the architecture and I got to see all my favorite scenes from gossip girls. He even took a picture of us at the end at the library. Overall highly recommend! I hope next time I visit my the usual restaurants will be open but given the circumstances, it was wonderul!

title: The Courteous concierge
text: Mr. Rene Moran is an outstanding concierge who has made our stay here at the Lotte New York Palace an enjoyable experience. We have consulted Mr. Moran on a variety of activities and he is batting 100%.  The restaurants he has recommended have been spot on, as we have enjoyed eateries from the high end to local neighborhood restaurants. Mr. Moran is affable, courteous and a professional at his craft. We appreciate his service, positive attitude and most important his sincere spirit of giving. Mr. Moran is an asset to your company. We love Rene!

title: Beautiful hotel with amazing staff!
text:
My fiancé and I live in the city and come to the Palace whenever we can for a staycation. We have always loved our stays at the Palace, but the hotel became even more special to us when we got engaged there in November. With the help of Miles and the other hotel employees, my fiancé was able pull off the engagement of a lifetime!… and we gained our new lifelong friend, Miles, in the process! 

Needless to say, we refuse to stay, or have our families stay, anywhere else in the city. Miles truly makes the Palace feel like a second home… so much so, we are planning to have our wedding there! 

Last week, I had family travel into the city to go dress shopping. It was my family’s first time staying at the hotel. Miles greeted us with open arms, (LITERALLY) and made my family feel right at home.  He also put us in contact with Rachel, so we could start wedding planning logistics. I’m not surprised that she was just as amazing as Miles. She was happy to meet with us and bring us from room to room, and was happy to answer my mom’s 100 questions.  She was able to sell my family on the wedding at the palace (THANK YOU RACHEL!) and made me even more excited to get married!

Thank you, Miles and Rachel, for making my family love the Palace Hotel as much as I do! 

The Palace is filled with employees like Miles and Rachel, warm and happy people (something that’s hard to come by in NYC!), who love doing their jobs to the best of their ability. Take this, pair it with a stunning hotel with breathtaking city views, and you have one of the best hotels in NYC!

title: Maurice has the best gossip girl tour
text: I went to the hotel after I read an article about a secret gossip girl tour given by a staff member called Maurice. He was amazing and showed the best spots. Everyone was so nice and helpful. Xoxo, Gaby

title: Gorgeous property with extraordinary staff
text: The Lotte New York Palace is truly the most amazing hotel in NYC. The rooms are stunning and spacious, and the views are incredible! Our room faced the Cathedral, and we enjoyed the skyline day and night. The location is incredible - the best shops on 5th Ave. and Rockefeller are just steps away. The lobby is fabulous with a large sitting area. Most of all, the staff went above and beyond to make our stay special. Miles was especially accommodating and friendly! We so enjoyed our stay, and we will definitely be back!

title: Wedding weekend!
text:
I can’t say enough about the Lotte New York Palace hotel. The rooms are beautiful, the location is amazing but more than that, the staff is by far the most attentive, sincere and welcoming group of people you’ll come across. We booked a block of rooms for our daughter’s NYC wedding  with the help of Peter Sofides and May Yam and their events team. They were so wonderful to work with, they  answered all of our questions and attended to any changes we had, and we had quite a few. Our guests were also thrilled with their experience at the hotel. 
So many people made our stay so wonderful. Peter and May, Samir the bellman, Dom the bellman, Jason with Pommes Palais and Singh in housekeeping.
Whenever we returned to the hotel we were always greeted with a smile and light conversation from the doormen and a genuine interest in our stay and the events of our daughters wedding.  They even helped us with arrangements for our daughters dog Winston! We actually started to call the hotel home. Thank you for a wonderful stay, we will be back!

title: The most amazing hotel in NYC!!!
text: I stayed at the Towers for a couple of days, and I will never book another hotel in New York City ever again! This place was the most gorgeous hotel I have ever been to, from the grand staircase when you walk in to our amazing room overlooking Madison. The rooms in the hotel were they filmed Gossip Girl were very cool as well! The location is impossible to beat too, it was located right in Midtown so we were close to anywhere we wanted to go in the city. We were greeted by Jimm at The Towers, and he gave us the most warm welcome we could have asked for! He was super helpful in answering any of our questions about how to get to a museum or what restaurant we should try that night. Overall, it was a 10/10 experience, and we will only stay at The Palace from now on.

title: Excellent Luxury Hotel in NYC
text:
This hotel is immaculate, the suites are extremely beautiful and fit for royalty. The staffs are very cautious and extremely efficient. I worked on a project at this hotel and it was a very delightful experience for me and my team. I will highly recommend this hotel, if you are looking for a hotel that gives the top-notch luxury experience in the middle of NYC. 
Thank you so much again Tracy!!! for all your assistance and warm hospitality, it was an absolute pleasure working with you.  I am looking forward to working on many more projects with you at The Lotte!

title: My NYC Engagement weekend!!!
text:
My girlfriend  and I love to visit NYC. I had planned to get engaged and I knew that I had to step it up a notch. Lotte New York Palace and asst. manager Miles Gomez hit it out of the park. 

From the room size, to the spectacular views from our window, but more importantly the attention that Miles put into our special night, everything was special. We returned  to our room to find flowers, champagne on ice, and a congratulatory note from Miles and the hotel staff.

 This location is central to many of the things that we enjoy doing, shopping, dining and shows. Hope to stop back soon really soon.

title: Stunning hotel, wonderful attentive staff but you should know…..
text: This hotel is top-notch but for a few things.  Since guests are paying top dollar to stay here I think it’s only fair you’re aware of a few things.  First the good stuff- fab location,  short walk to most anywhere, great staff, friendly, quick, attentive.  Beautiful place, I mean WOW!  We staying in Executive suite (a king bedroom, a living room, HUGE bathroom with tub and marble shower, bidet, double sinks, premium Molton Brown toiletries. Two closets, safe, mini fridge. TVs in each room. Oh yeah, the view!  We were on 34th floor and the view was all of st Patrick’s cathedral.  Just stunning!  Now the problems.  There is only one working elevator (max limit 4 people) for the towers.  Tons of elevators for The Palace guests.  So expect to wait…a lot.  None of the bars or restaurants are reopened yet.  And my only other complaint is the front entrance, the one so heavily featured on Gossip Girl, is closed.  No idea why but disappointing, as everyone wants to see that area for a few selfies, maybe that’s why it’s closed?  MLB teams stay here so keep your eyes open for sightings.  The Chamber Magic show, in the hotel is a must see.  Great show!  Overall I would recommend this hotel, but they really need to expedite the elevator situation.  Lots of guests were a bit ticked off.

title: Beautiful hotel with exceptional staff
text: The hotel is absolutely beautiful and every member of the staff that  I came in contact with went out of their way to make everything about our stay perfect, from the doormen, to the housekeeper, the front desk and Carlos in the Pomme Bakery.  Special shout out to Kevin, who found me wondering around on the Palace side of the hotel and instead of just giving me directions to what I was looking for he showed me around pointing out the history and beautiful architecture.  It is thoughtful  gestures like this that separate the Lotte New York Palace from the rest.   Clearly an exceptionally well managed property.

title: Far Exceeded My High Expectations
text: On the train headed back to Boston after a wonderful friends weekend in NYC! The Lotte was the highlight of our stay! Francesca in reservations reached out in advance of our arrival to ask what would make our stay special - and she and the staff knocked it out of the park. We got a fabulous room upgrade and lots of attentive and helpful service throughout our stay. We made lots of joyful memories with their help. Looking forward to our next stay!

title: Picture Perfect
text:
We just returned from two glorious nights in a beautifully appointed suite with a spectacular view. We slept well on a very comfortable bed with fine linens. 

The best part of the stay was the superb staff starting with George, who met us at the entrance and tended to our car and bags. His charm and great humor kept us entertained while Denise and Jimm  at the the front desk efficiently checked us in. Omar brought us to our room and helped us settle in. Maurice helped us find a perfect lunch spot and Isabella, the Towers concierge recommended a great restaurant for dinner. 

We stopped in to Pomme Palais coffee shop for a perfect latte and later a cold drink. Juan Carlos, Chris and Jason took great care of us. 

When we needed a taxi, John was right there to make one appear and to welcome us back when we returned. 

We chatted several times with Martin, the hotel manager, who made sure all our needs we well attended to. 

We would enthusiastically recommend this hotel to anyone coming to NYC for business or pleasure.

title: An elegant oasis of delight in the heart of Midtown!
text:
I had the pleasure of staying here in a one bedroom suite for three nights.  Check in was easy, and Jimm at the front desk made me feel welcome.  There were plenty of bellmen on duty to assist with luggage, and all with warm welcomes.

The room was astonishing ... truly a spacious and elegant retreat from the city, sitting 47 stories above the ground.  The views were magnificent, and the overall feeling was calming and solid.  There was a large desk in the bedroom for a laptop, with plenty of plugs (although no USB plug outlets in the room), and a large TV in the bedroom easily viewed from bed and the work desk.  The lighting is coordinated and controlled across the suite, with settings from full on to full off, relaxed, and evening light and it works beautifully to create the mood.  The bed was comfy with high quality linens and pillows.  There were also plush robes available, large closets, and a large in-room safe.

Two bathrooms in the suite...one half bath for guests, and a very large and spacious master bath with toilet, bidet, deep bathtub (not very comfortable however if you're over 6 feet tall), and a large shower with wonderful pressure.  The towels were a little thin I thought, and could be refreshed.  Plenty of room for toiletries and two sinks and all done in black marble.  High quality Molton Brown spa products.

The room also included a full kitchen with refrigerator, range, sink and dishwasher although because of COVID there were no dishes or glassware to be found.

The suite was kept spotlessly clean, and there is a fine cafe on the premises for pastry and morning coffee.

All in all this was a terrific way to be in midtown Manhattan.  Friendly staff, elegant quarters, and smiling service abound.

title: Return To NYC
text: The Palace was exceptional, as always. The staff went above and beyond to welcome my family back to hotel. Every staff member we encountered was incredible. The hotel was in top form and we felt very safe. The hotel purchased state of the art equipment to ensure all guests remained safe at all times. We wouldn’t stay at any other place. Thank you for a big welcome back to New York City!

title: Luxurious Staycation
text: I planned a staycation, as we all live in New York, for a girls weekend with my daughters to honor my older daughter who is getting married in October.  I contacted the Lotte before our arrival and the concierge, Isabella, reviewed our itinerary and made some great suggestions.  As I checked in, before my daughters arrived, the assistant front desk manager, Miles, greeted me with a congratulatory bottle of chilled champagne with glasses and teddy bears.  You are never too old for a teddy bear! The room was spacious with a table with two chairs and a bench.   The beds were very comfortable. There were robes, slippers and WIFI.  Our west side view was strikingly beautiful from the 45th floor.  Though Covid restrictions have closed the bars and restaurants at the Lotte, the Pomme Palais onsite is open and offered delicious breakfast, lunch and drinks.  We were able to enjoy the ILA Spa and the Chamber Magic Show onsite. The historic building is beautiful and the staff, including Samir, Olga and George (who told me he has been with the NY Palace for 34 years) made every effort to make our weekend memorable.

title: Miles and Ahmed
text: I was tasked with helping my friend set up for his engagement at the hotel, but Miles and Ahmed completely stole my job. They were such a pleasure to work with and set the room up beautifully! Ahmed is a creative, artistic man and Miles is truly a professional. I couldn’t have been more relieved than having those two in charge of making my friends special day, special. I could write so much more with specifics, but even then it wouldn’t be enough.

title: Unforgettable Weekend @ the Lotte Palace.... Didn't Want to Leave!
text:
From the minute I got out of the car to checkin, the entire weekend was perfect. Every single staff member was incredibly welcoming, friendly, and made you feel like you were at home. Upon checking in, Luis Ortega (Manager) came out to personally greet me and welcome me. It was such a nice treat and made me feel extra special.

After checkin in, Maurice helped bring our bags to our room and he was just an wonderful person and we had a great conversation with him. We looked forward to seeing him as we were leaving and coming back to the hotel!

Brittny Amendolare (Senior Meetings and Events Manager)  personally worked with us ahead of checking in and throughout our stay to make sure our wedding weekend was great and we had everything we needed. Her communication was very clear and was very easy to work with. Brittny is very professional, experienced, and her style was very much a driver and got things done without being pushy. We were thrilled to work with Brittny and stay at the Palace. The entire weekend felt like a dream. 

During our stay, we also worked with Kaan (Senior Member of the Catering & Security Team) who was exceptional.  

Thank you to the entire staff at the Lotte Palace for a perfect NYC weekend during COVID and still feeling safe in a spotless hotel!

title: Mr De la Garza
text:
When we arrived to the hotel from the airport, my wife and I got off the taxi and went into the lobby to check in. After a couple of minutes we realized we had left the luggage inside the trunk of the taxi and hadn’t taken it out when we arrived. 
We were very worried but got great help from the hotel.
I would like to thank the hotel security for their help, especially two people who helped track the taxi’s location through my iPad’s GPS that was left in the taxi inside my carry on. It was a difficult process but thanks to their help we were able to localize the driver and recover our possessions.
Miles Gómez and George, drove his car with my iPhone and intercepted the taxi and recovered my luggage. Wonderful service.

title: NY Palace is reopened with the rest of NYC!
text:
I have stayed at the Lotte NY Palace for years prior to COVID but not for the last 18 months.  The new gym and spa are fantastic and best in midtown.

What really makes the Palace special are the staff:  James Klawitter and Michael Frick are two people that really helped me in a family bind to extend a night when the hotel had 3 weddings going on

title: AMAZING Experience at The Palace - highly recommend!!
text: The Lotte New York Palace Hotel (affectionally known as "The Palace") is truly the créme de la créme of NYC hotels. Since Gossip Girl premiered in 2007, it's been my life-long dream to visit the hotel and check out the iconic courtyard - and, of course, see the gorgeous architecture and structure. The staff is exceptional. Friendly, kind, and they go out of their way to ensure you have a fantastic stay. I could not recommend The Palace more - the attention to detail and gorgeous design / architecture throughout the entire hotel is absolutely impeccable. Plus... the Gossip Girl filming locations are truly unmatched ;) I have to shoutout the head of security, Maurice Legere - he was incredible! It was my birthday weekend, and he went out of his way to make sure we had a fantastic experience at The Palace. This is my absolute favorite hotel to stay at in NYC. You know you love The Palace! XOXO!

title: Always reliable and consistnet
text: The rooms are spacious and well designed, Good views of the city from the tower. Bell desk and mail room have been helpful with the large number of packages getting delivered here. Obviously location is good.

title: Miles is the BEST!
text: The Towers is the best of the best!! This is the go to place to stay whenever you visit NYC. Location is perfect and close to major landmarks. The bakery downstairs has great food that perfect for a quick bite to eat. The staff is always AMAZING. Miles always goes above and beyond to make your stay perfect and is always so welcoming. I will never stay anywhere else in NYC!

title: Maurice the guide
text:
Had a impromptu walk about at the Lotte! Beautiful hotel with lots of history and pageantry. Had the good fortune of seeing Maurice who gave us some nice tidbits of history about the hotel. Hotel was filming today otherwise I’m sure Maurice would have walked us around more.
Wonderful employees like Maurice makes staying at such a lovely hotel even nicer! It’s the people (employees) that care about the guests who make the hotel home for a few days. Thank you Maurice! (And Isabella at the concierge was also very helpful and gave some suggestions on what to do and where to go)

title: Gossip Girl Tour
text: We happened to walk by this gorgeous palace while visiting New York City and Maurice gave us a tour of all the places where Gossip Girl was filmed! My friends and I are BIG Gossip Girl fans so this was so cool to see! Maurice was so friendly and nice and even talked about the specific scenes for each location in the palace! He also took some great pictures of us in the best spots! The palace was absolutely beautiful. Thank you, Maurice!

title: My visit was too short!
text:
Was in NYC for a one night business trip. They upgraded me to an amazing corner suite and I must say it was super stunning!  Lovely view and everything felt luxurious.

Beautiful rooms and an absolutely stunning property!  Can't wait to return and hopefully with my family one day!  Told my teenage daughers the hotel was featured on Gossip Girl and they were extremely jealous and made me promise to bring them here one day!!

title: AMAZING!
text: Would rate this a thousand if I could. Genuinely the best hotel I’ve ever stayed at. The room was INCREDIBLE and the staff were so nice and helpful. Came with my sister for a Gossip Girl themed weekend - as the Palace is one of the main locations in the series - and one of the concierge’s took us on a tour to show us some of the rooms that were used for scenes. How amazing is that? Will absolutely be coming back very soon.

title: Incredible Views, a Piece of Iconic NYC
text: From a warm welcome on arrival by Brittney Amendolare, to the most beautiful accommodations... The Palace continues to be one of the best hotels in NYC. Their renovations are so well appointed, I personally loved the Peloton bike placed perfectly in the large windows for some sightseeing and exercise.

title: The Place to be in NYC
text: Stayed in the amazing Triplex Champagne Suite - can you say rooftop hot tub with a real working fireplace in the terrace living space!  Didn’t know this existed in A NYC hotel.  Let’s talk about service. Greeted by the Hotel Manager Martin and escorted to the suite. We were holding a small meeting and Ahmed from their AV team went as far as going to the Best Buy to get a connector I had forgotten.  We arranged lunch and refreshments through the Pomme Palais Cafe and it was wonderful. Thanks to Veronica and Tiffany.  Although the hotel is still in limited service mode we had everything we needed and felt safe, secure and comfortable.  Thanks for a great stay. We will be back.

title: Friendly / Attentive Staff, Amazing Suites/ Great View
text: A true icon of NYC, The New York Palace is as stunning as ever. The staff is so friendly and helpful. From the servers at Pomme (Thank you Veronica and Juan Carlos), to the event manager, Brittny, who welcomed us and made sure that we had everything we needed- not a single detail is over looked. Few can say they get to spend the day in a historic mansion that's been converted into an iconic NYC hotel. I am lucky to say that I have, and YOU should too.

title: Superior Concierge Service!!
text: This Concierge team at the Lotte NY Palace Hotel is second to none!  I needed to arrange for a last-minute COVID test with time running out, and Kal was able to schedule quickly and efficiently for me.  He went above and beyond for me, and I am so appreciative.  He followed through until the very end and the job was done.  This guy takes customer service to the highest level!  Truly amazing Concierge service at the Lotte New York Palace....thank you Kal!!

title: Gossip Girl Tour
text: Maurice completed our trip. My friends and I are huge Gossip Girl fans, so we just wanted to visit the palace to take pictures at the classic gold stairs. Little did we know that we would a secret Gossip Girl Your. From the gold room to the famous kitchen, it was everything I could have imagined. It was so special and made our trip. Thank you, Maurice!!

title: Excellent trip!
text: My sister and I recently had our first stay at the Lotte New York Palace and it was absolutely exceptional. We were greeted by incredibly friendly staff and our check-in was smooth and quick. We had wanted to partake in spa services but some of them were unavailable due to maintaining safety with Covid-19 protocols.  When we expressed our interest to our concierge Kal, he immediately helped facilitate spa services (massages and pedicures) in our hotel room. He was incredibly professional and helpful and made our stay everything we hoped it would be. The spa services we received were also excellent and the masseurs and nail technicians were incredibly accommodating and made us feel so relaxed. The view from our room on the 53rd floor was exceptional and our room was incredibly clean (huge thanks to the housekeeping staff). I would recommend this hotel to anyone and we would absolutely stay at the Lotte New York Palace again as the people who helped us made us feel so welcome.

title: Fantastic First Stay!
text: This was our first time staying at the Lotte NY Palace as our other hotel closed as a result of the pandemic.  Our first stay was spectacular and started out with the friendly greeting and introduction to the Hotel by the doorman and bellman.  The staff was very accommodating and friendly as well. Especially Isabella, the Concierge and Veronica in the Pomme Palais.  I enjoyed my daily chats with them and made my family feel like home.  The breakfast selections at the Pomme Palais were more than adequate and very tasty.  The view from our room on the 48th floor was excellent and cannot give the housekeeping staff enough praise as well.   This hotel has obviously been very well maintained and all that work there seem to be very proud of the Hotel and the history.  My family and I look forward to making this our new home in NYC. Thanks again to everyone and see you next year!

title: Another exceptional stay at the Lotte palace
text: My wife and I celebrated our 50th wedding anniversary 8/16/2020 in the midst of the pandemic and found the accommodations and most important the staff to be beyond our greatest expectations. We needed to be in Manhattan again in March 2021 and decided to return to the palace but expecting that since it wasn’t a special occasion getting a standard room without the special attention we received on our anniversary. To our delight this occasion was equally fantastic with a room upgrade and unique special attention from the hotel staff.Miles Gomez the front office manager personally brought my wife hot tea to the room since COVID required a limited room service schedule.Jimm Kalinin made sure we were upgraded and granted a late checkout.Marie Rasamitch and Isabella the concierge arranged and helped us find everything we needed since COVID restrictions were very much in effect in NYC. We cannot wait to return to this really uniquely wonderful home in New York.

title: An experience I will never forget
text: On Thursday I got engaged to my girlfriend in the Jewel suit. I picked the room and hotel because of the spectacular city views and grand piano in the room, of which I used to propose. The piano and the room were above expectations, but what made my day go from special to spectacular was the service provided to me from Miles, Ahmed, and George. From the minute I contacted Miles, he told me he would take care of all the details, making sure all I had to do was show up and my dream proposal would be flawlessly executed. It was. Not only did Miles and Ahmed beautifully decorate the room with rose pedals and the works before I arrived, Miles played a pivotal role in unsuspectingly getting my girlfriend up to the "rooftop bar" and bringing her into the room before she was surprised and shocked at actually walking into the place of our engagement. George, the bellman, also played a huge role in seamlessly welcoming us to the hotel and ensuring we found our way to the "roof top bar." In all, from the minute I contacted Miles until the moment I left the hotel I was treated with the highest class, and I couldn't be happier with how the hotel took care of my every need, going the extra mile to make sure my day would be one I'd remember for my entire life. I would highly recommend a stay at the hotel, and, if you're really feeling good, the Jewel suit, to anyone looking for a well-executed retreat and wants to be treated with class and style. Thank you The Towers at Lotte New York Palace.

title: Impeccable Hotel
text: My mother just had a major back surgery in New York City, so we decided to stay at this hotel. We made the right choice. Best staff in the universe ! Kal and Emily were the best concierges. They answered all of our questions. They helped my mother and I so much, not to mention their generosity and kindness. They were so flexible. The whole staff treated us like family. In addition to this, the palace is COVID-19 friendly and super clean. Everyone follow protocols. If you are going to New York City, I recommend you stay here. In love with this hotel, and I cannot wait to return! 🤍

title: Birthday getaway
text: We had the most incredible experience at the Lotte Hotel with staff and service!  Traveling during COID times is not very easy, but the accommodations were absolutely phenomenal.  Concierge Isabella set up dinners, lunches and brunches around Manhattan at very unique and wonderful restaurants.  She was incredibly accommodative, friendly and professional.  We received text notifications for all restaurants that she reserved for us.  Great place!  Highly recommend for anyone looking to visit New York.

title: A Trip Worth Recounting
text: This past week I had the pleasure of staying at the Lotte with a group of friends of mine to celebrate my best friend's birthday.  I cannot praise enough the hotel staff enough for going above and beyond to make this trip so special. Ani and Diego were phenomenal at booking us dinner reservations to helping us choose places to eat at the last minute. Chris and Mark who were at the cafe were incredibly kind as they helped me place an order for a cake to be made for the birthday girl. Lastly, Maurice gave us a wonderful tour of the hotel and it was a great way to end our stay. This was a great first visit and I hope to return again soon for any occasion!

title: Another magical stay
text: We can’t say enough good things about this beautiful hotel.... the hotel is gorgeous, huge rooms with amazing views. My husband and I stayed for Valentines weekend and it was awesome. The staff are first class and go out of their way to make every visit unique and special, Nancy thank you again, Ani, Diego and Kal you are great, Miles you were so kind and helpful we really appreciated your personal attention, George, Eddie and Sameer wonderful service. We have been traveling to NYC for 10 + years and after finding this gem we will never stay anywhere else.

title: World Class Luxury!
text: Luxurious room! Friendly Staff! Hotel is centrally located in Midtown close to Rockefeller Plaza and shopping. We spent last New Year’’s eve at the hotel and it was an amazing experience. It was quite well sanitized which made us feel very safe during this pandemic.

title: The brightest spot at the beginning of a New Year
text: I came to The Palace to celebrate a birthday at the end of 2020 and had an amazing time. From the moment I walked through the doors it was clear they were taking all necessary precautions for pandemic and simultaneously managing to incorporate their world class service effortlessly into the new world we live in. Every employee was perfectly pleasant, well-mannered, respectful, and eager to ensure a solid experience would occur. Rooms and public areas were faultlessly spotless and more than comfortable. All assistance needed was handled timely and with the utmost care. 100/100 cannot WAIT to stay again!

title: Best stay ever!
text: This was our first time staying at the hotel, and everything from start to finish was truly luxurious. The view from the room was spectacular. The highlight of our stay was Kal from concierge. He was very helpful and had great tips on things to do in the area. He set up an in-room massage experience for us that was one of a kind. Thank you Kal for everything!

title: Magical
text:
Firstly, the staff were amazing : Ana the concierge was so awesome and thoughtful she went totally out of her way to make us feel comfortable and create the best experience her kindness was heartfelt, Salem gracious and sweet, Eddie so friendly and personable..... Nancy the manager was awesome! All the staff were great. 
We stay at this amazing hotel every year and it’s always great ..... but We have to say they totally made this years experience special and made up for all the COVID 19 restrictions and difficulties.
Hats off to a wonderful staff and beautiful hotel !

title: Amazing Customer Service
text: I would like to give a raving review of the lotte Palace hotel! My son got engaged recently in nyc   There were so many details from transportation to airports and proposal site, dinners etc and Kai said do not worry, he arranged everything even the room being decorated with rose petals and champagne.  Kai is top notch! Will always stay at this hotel and he is a big reason!

title: Le paradis amoureux
text: C’était génial la chambre était immense c’était très bien équipé ,de la haut en voyait tous New York c’était magique.Le staff très était très sympa ,j’ai aussi beaucoup aimais les repas celui du petit déjeuné c’était délicieux

title: Disorganised and over-priced
text:
We had three suites at the Towers over the Christmas period in 2019. The hotel was very disappointing. We were made to wait for 2 hours to check in. No one offeed us a drink or an apology - the most basic tenets of customer service are non-existent at the Towers. The staff were rude, dismissive and clueless. We spoke to numerous managers who palmed us off to other staff. 

When we finally got to our rooms, one had no running water. So we waited more hours for a different room. None of the rooms are very nice for the price - certainly not 5*. 

The location is good but so is any other hotel around midtown.

title: Spent our 50th wedding anniversary in a towers 1 bedroom suite with all the COVID restrictions and had a wonderful time
text: It was our 50th wedding anniversary.During COVID I didn’t have many options to celebrate. I called amex centurion and they said that the Lotte palace in NYC had just reopened and had a wonderful reputation so we decided to try it for 1 night. The room was a 1 bedroom in the towers that was enormous, elegantly decorated with every amenity you could ever want. The staff led by an assistant manager Miles Gomez and Mike the head bellman made us feel like royalty. THE ROOM SERVICE WAS LIMITED BY COVID BUT DID EVERYTHING TO MAKE US COMFORTABLE. THE RATES WERE REASONABLE FOR A 5 STAR NYC HOTEL. we will return soon.

title: NYC Dream
text:
We stayed in the Towers for our summer family vacation taking our kids to NYC for the first time. 
The one bedroom suite was bigger than many of our NYC friends’ apartments. It has one full and one half bath which is perfect for a family of four. 
I don’t think you can find a better location in the city and we were thrilled to be within walking distance of so many “must see” places. The history and architecture of the hotel also makes it very special.  
The Rarities Lounge was a reason to stay all on its own with an impressive collection of rare bourbons and other hard to find spirits.  The outdoor patio and bar was really nice for a drink as we got back from sightseeing.  
We had serious issues with construction noise going on everyday while my husband was trying to work from the room but the management was quick to respond and at least it was during hours most people wouldn’t be in their rooms. 
We hope to stay again sometime in December as it is the perfect location for seeing the tree at Rockefeller.

title: G-mas's review
text: We had a fantastic time and enjoyed our stay there very much!    My younger daughter booked this trip for the three of us, each celebrating a milestone ( 40th BD, 70th BD and Nursing graduation).  I loved the chocolates every day!!!!  Wish I could get them here!  All the staff were accommodating.  This was a once in a lifetime experience for me, and your hotel made it truly special.  Thank you.

title: Awesome Hotel
text: Great Service, Nice Rooms, Perfect Location! We went as a family and it was perfect.  The concierge helped with great dinner suggestions also.  Champagne upon arrival for the Towers!!!!  Very special trip!

title: Lotte New York Palace
text: Fantastic and Beautiful  hotel. great location, high quality rooms, Service was friendly, especially Jim Kali ,  Even before we arrived  he emailed to get ideas if we need something special ,or if we had any questions ,   Will stay here again in the future.  Thank you Jim

title: Best Everything
text: I’ve stayed at many hotels in NYC and this is my favorite by far.  The only thing better than the hotel is Jimm Kalinka at the front desk. He has made my every stay amazing from check in to check out.  He knows what I need before I do!! This hotel is modern with touches of old elegance.  It’s simply the best

title: Great experience...
text: Great hotel!  Jimm Kalinka was an amazing help with our Suite reservation.  He went above and beyond for us.  Jimm made our stay so great.  The suites are so spacious, clean and comfortable.  We will definitely be returning. Excellent service.

title: Great Experience
text: My friend and I planned a trip to New York at the end of February. I have stayed at Lotte New York Palace before, but not in the new towers. I arrived a day before my friend, and I checked us in. I was assisted by Rebecca Villasenor. She greeted me warmly and was so nice. She made sure that we would have a great view and told me that if I needed anything at all just to let her know. She was so friendly. I work with customers/clients on a daily basis and I always want them to feel that they are first class, and that’s exactly how Rebecca made me feel when I first got there. The hotel is beautiful, the rooms in the new towers are spacious, clean and comfortable. And all staff was great! Lotte New York Palace will definitely be place I choose to stay at every time I’m in NY. The location is great as well.

title: Kal is the King of the tower
text:
Another amazing stay at the tower.
Always great to see Kal who always help me with my family with all our needs.Room service were great and housekeepingtoo. A little disappointed that the Spa is still under construction.

title: Stunning room
text: I stayed for a night in the Corner King Suite, and it was one of the nicest rooms I have ever stayed in. Details include a gym inside the room, beautiful city views and motorized shades. It was very spacious and easily accommodated two adults and two children. In fact, it was probably large enough to fit more guests. On top of the amenities, the staff was excellent. Rebecca, Edmark, Angel, Kal, Wendy and Melody went above and beyond to make sure that we were taken care of. There was also a woman at reception who was working on the night of March 7th who had blond hair and glasses. She was very welcoming and got my daughters a teddy bear and tiara. I can’t recall her name but I also wanted to recognize her here. All of these individuals epitomize customer service, and I can’t wait to visit again.

title: Fabulous stay at The Towers at Lotte New York Palace
text: Firstly the concierge Kal Naim was absolutely outstanding.  He went out of his way to assist with Theatre and dinner reservations.  He made us feel as if we were his number one priority.  Room service and Housekeeping personnel were great too - efficient and friendly. In fact all the staff were helpful.  Our room was spacious and comfortable.  Would highly recommend.

title: We had a lovely stay at The The Towers
text: Clara Law at the Front Desk was of great assistance with recommendations and suggestions. She was very polite and a pleasure to talk with.  All of the employees have been courteous and friendly making us feel welcome during every interaction.

title: Neutral experience to below average
text:
Requested for firm mattress which was not Honored. The foam pillow is not firm enough. Room heating system very noisy this time. Worst is the hair dryer in the bathroom is old and filthy dirty , see photo attached. I reported this to housekeeping and they sent me a newer one. The old one was not even taken away during my entire stay. 

However, I must commend the door attendant George who is extremely friendly and helpful and also Clara Law at the Towers Front Desk .

title: Amazing 6 day stay at the Towers of New York Palace
text:
Stayed here in 2019. It was my first time to stay in the Towers and I was very pleasantly surprised.  I especially loved the separate entrance and the Champagne they give to The Towers guests in the afternoon. I really love the Palace Hotel and stay there whenever I visit in New York but this was my first time to try the towers.  I think I stayed over 20 days in the Palace last year, too bad they do not have a loyalty program.

The palace hotel has an amazing courtyard upfront, which they share with both the Palace Hotel and Towers.  The location is just great in midtown manhattan.  I get to got to mass almost daily at St. Patrick's across the street.  My first stay at the Towers was very memorable as the rooms are nicer and bathrooms look much newer than the ordinary Palace room. I would to commend Rebecca who convinced me to upgrade to the Tower room.  Would love to stay in the Towers again!

title: Go see Jose at the Gold Room!
text:
I regularly stay in New York for business and when asking for a recommendation a business friend say she had to take my family and I to see Jose at the Lotte New York Palace Gold Room for drink - for an unforgettable experience!
She was not kidding! Jose took time out of his service to give as a tour of the original spots of the hotel that belonged to the Villard Mansion. With every room he exuded such passion and explained the history with such detail. We were in awe at the level of service he provided and wanted to capture every moment. 
You truly got to experience real New York in a completely authentic way. Cant say enough go to the Gold Room and ask for Jose! He is truly incredible and if you get a chance to experience the tour you will see how special it is!This was a memory we will hold in our family forever. The bar and hotel itself was beautiful!

title: Long weekend in NYC
text: We had a wonderful stay at The Lotte New York Palace. Our tower king room was magnificent with an outstanding view of St. Patrick’s Cathedral. The room was huge, well equipped and spotless. We were hungry after our trip into the city so we ordered room service snacks right away.  The delicious snacks were brought up quickly by a very kind in room dining staff member. The concierge named Kal was very helpful in helping us plan our outings and with navigating the city. The housekeepers were so pleasant and would inquire about our needs whenever we passed them in the hallway.  We loved the coffee shop for delicious bagels and coffee. The hotel is in a perfect location with Rockefeller Center and Times Square an easy walk away. We also walked to Central Park and strolled 5th Avenue. We thoroughly enjoyed our weekend stay at The Palace and can’t wait to return!  Thank you to your staff for making us feel so comfortable and pampered!

title: Christmas in the city.
text: Our room overlooked the beautiful St. Patrick's Cathedral and the tree at Rockefeller Center.  The staff was exceptional and attentive and we truly felt welcomed.  Jimm was excellent and had many recommendations/suggestions for local things to see and do.  He helped make our trip perfect once again.

title: Review of Staff at NY Palace
text:
What can I say. This hotel is our home away from home. Every time we come to New York we stay at The Palace Towers.  From the moment we arrive we’re warmly greeted by Mike, Edmarck, Papa and George who happily escorts us into the lobby or on to the front desk, all the while asking about our travels and well-being. Jose and Angel are always more than willing to help us with any request. We truly missed being personally welcomed by our dear friend Susan at the front desk this time and she always saw to it that we were completely comfortable with our accommodations.  AnaMaria is always friendly and helpful with a pleasant smile. In the early mornings our longest and dearest friend Nana is always just a call away and we appreciate him dearly. David, Richard, Patsy and so many others in In-room Dining provide exceptional service and Milan is so warm and friendly they are like family. And we can’t forget Persaud in Laundry - ever ready to assist and Nancy in Housekeeping. Then there’s our friend Clara who is so warm and helpful. She provides exceptional concierge services - always seeking our precise needs and then exceeding them. Thank you Clara! Overall these are the persons and more that keep us coming back to the Palace each and every time. Sorry to anyone we may have inadvertently not named but you are no less special.  Thank you to Becky who always leaves a note and welcome fruit bowl upon our arrival too. 
-#favyanksguests

title: Mixed Feelings - Not Really Sure
text:
After staying at The Towers at Lotte New York Palace, I have mixed feelings (which is why I delayed my review). The hotel is an architectural attraction and the staff are wonderful, especially Clara and Kevin. Clara was always helpful and Kevin simply 
did whatever he could to ensure you enjoyed New York. My concern was really with amenities and the nightly price (for me) ranging from $695 - $720. There wasn't anything inside the hotel to enjoy as a family. Also, you had to work around the many tourist who visited the hotel daily. I'm simply not sure.

title: Could not have stayed at a nicer place!
text: Wonderful experience dealing with the front desk when I had some issues with my room.They rectified the issues.....warm, welcoming and determined to rectify the issue. EVERYONE of the staff with which I dealt were warm and exemplified 5 star customer service. I would/will definitely stay at this hotel again. They Made my daughter's Sweet Sixteen a memorable event that will last a lifetime! Absolutely love this hotel!

title: Best trip yet
text:
I recently stayed at the Palace for my regular trip with my mum as we visit the city from London a lot but this trip was so much better! We usually stay at the Plaza but the last few times is has not been as good as it used to be so we decided to stay at the Palace after hearing many good things. I was a little apprehensive to change but the minute we walked up to the check in desk at the towers and met Rebecca I knew I had made the right choice! 

Rebecca was so warm and friendly and made our stay really special. We had booked a tower suite but she made sure we got one with a beautiful view of the cathedral and 5th. After going up to our suite she called to make sure we were settled and over the duration of our stay she really became a friend. She checked on us daily to see if there was anything more we needed and if we were happy. 

All of the staff at the Palace are wonderful, they recognised my mother and I everyday and were constantly helpful and a joy to interact with. 
Rebecca became a friend who we always shared our adventures of the day with and I will definitely be choosing the Palace for my next stay in NYC!

title: Great hotel & views
text: We recently stayed on the 47th floor and had a large spacious room with great views of the city.  The room was comfortable and clean with plenty of wardrobe space, although think it would be nice to have tea/coffee making facility in the room (I understand you can request this but feel it should be standard) We had WiFi included with our room but feel this should be a secured rather than an unsecured network. The hotel is conveniently located for many of the sights and shops to visit in the city. We found all the staff were friendly and helpful.

title: Great NY Hotel
text: We had the pleasure of staying in The Towers at the Lotte Palace hotel and the experience was wonderful. The staff was extremely helpful, the room was beautiful and luxurious. The location can't be beat. This has become my NY hotel of choice and I will be staying here on my future visits. Thank you to Ashleen and Inthira for a lovely stay.

title: Third year in a row
text: This was our family's third stay at The Towers in as many years. The staff (especially Clara Law) is what keeps bringing us back. Clara spoils our daughters-she brought teddy bears up one night, treats another night, she stocked our room with water bottles and she procured a late check out for us. I can not say enough about the service Clara (and the rest of the staff) provides. We look forward to returning!

title: Service Rockstar for the save
text: This hotel has its ups and downs. The staff is what holds this business afloat. I checked in and received a bad vibe as if the employee didn’t want to be at work. Went up to the room and it was just so loud due to the big exhaust outside the room. I called down and it was the same lady. She changed my room but I had to run so never checked the second room. I returned back around 10pm and picked up keys for the new room. It was two floors up from the original room. At this point I was so furious. I came back down and this time I knew let me try someone else. A young man Daniel welcomed me with a much better approach. He asked how may he be of service. I informed him of what transpired. He was very apologetic and told me I would love the next room. He gave me an upgrade to the towers for my one night. The room decor is night and day. My next stay will definitely be a towers room. He was so graceful that I honestly didn’t care to speak with a manager. Thank you and kudos to whom ever trained him. Great service mind.

title: The Epitome of Amazing Customer service
text: If you would like to experience luxury at its finest you must book your stay at The Towers Lotte NY Palace. Im not only speaking of the brick & mortar..Im mainly speaking about where it all begins, which is with the PEOPLE. The ones that run the day to day to ensure that you're treated as royalty. It doesn't matter to them your profession, gender, race or status...You will be presented with exemplary customer service. Starting with reservations, I called in with about a million request for a client and I swear I felt a virtual smile from Deidre Blanding as she calmly worked thru, noted and handled all of them for me. I don't care what kind of day you're having, I promise you one conversation with her and you'll hang up feeling like you just spoke to an angel....NO JOKE. Now, fast forward to the day of check in an man oh man I had some unrealistic request that I needed completed to ensure a flawless check in for my client and long behold Miles Gomez (Front desk manager) came to my rescue, let me just tell you this man is the EPITOME of amazing customer service!! He and his staff pulled off some miracles for me to ensure that all I needed was taken care of without one hiccup! I was blown away!! He also did something that is almost unheard of in the hospitality world (only because its fast paced) but he followed up with a phone call to recap and reassure that everything was done beyond my expectations!! I say all this to say....if you're looking to be treated like a million bucks go see Miles at Tower Lotte, I promise you will not be disappointed!!! The hotel being amazing is a plus, but it's because of people like Deidre and Miles that ensures not only will Towers Lotte be my go to hotel but all my clients as well. Thank you guys and please keep up the amazing work!!!!

title: Consistently Excellent
text: This was our third stay at the Towers at Lotte and this hotel consistently delivers the luxury experience we want.  We were greeted with a smooth Towers check-in by Jim at Reception.  We had arrived early, and decided to get a drink.  We recommend you try the cocktails at the bar in The Gold Room (a breathe-taking atmosphere).  Our bartender, Rigo, made an excellent Dry Martini and Cosmopolitan.  When our room was ready, they brought the room key to us at the bar!  This was a very personal touch that made us feel special.  The room was stunning, clean and top notch.  Comfy bedding and amenities.  We had an amazing view of Saint Patrick's Cathedral.  The complimentary shoe shine is an awesome touch too.  We enjoyed breakfast at The Villard, which is convenient.  So much so, that we went twice.  Our servers, Melissa and Shoyeb, made each breakfast a treat that satisfies.

title: Worst 5 star luxury hotel stay ever!
text:
We booked a six night stay at the Lotte Towers Palace Hotel for our 25th anniversary in September of 2019. We had booked a Tower room at the hotel twice before, and enjoyed our stays. However, this last visit in September was a nightmare! 

We did not know that the UN Security Council was in session the week we were booked to arrive. (The hotel should have informed "regular" guests that the Security Council was in session and that delegates would be staying at the hotel.)

We arrived at the hotel, and were not allowed to enter the front entrance, instead we were told to enter through a side entrance and required to go through a security check and body scan (each time we entered the hotel). Our visit continued to get even worse, as the hotel was crowded with security and delegates, with areas of the hotel closed off to non delegate guests. Check in was long and tedious as was the wait for the elevators.
Our assigned room was dated, with mold in the bathroom. We know there are newer "renovated" rooms, as we had enjoyed these accommodations during prior stays. Some hotel services were cancelled due to the number of delegates and security at the hotel. We were not allowed access to restaurants and bar areas during most of our visit, and could not enjoy any of lobby areas due to the crush of security and delegates. 

We asked the manager for some form of compensation, for the inconvenience. He offered us a $50.00 hotel credit, and nothing more. I refused, as we had spent over $5,000.00 for this "luxury" Tower stay. Beware if you plan on booking this property.
We will never book this hotel again!

title: Even better
text: It’s been a year that we don’t go to Lotte NY Towers and the hotel has gotten even better! We can’t avoid being pampered by the towers staff (it’s their duty to make you feel comfortable) since the time we arrive until we leave. I’ve gotta thank especially Clara, Melody(from Towers) and Ray (at the entrance). Can’t wait to see those guys again!

title: Lotte New York Palace
text: On the first minute of arrival at the Lotte New York Palace Towers, I conjure up the wonderful memory of last year's stay.  Lotte NY Palace lives up to its name, again! The experience is much like you would expected in a palace although we don't really come to recognize or define until we stay there...at the Palace, from hotel check in (Clara Law) and Jimm  Kalinka, we know our stay would be exceptional at the 41 floor suite with corner view.

title: Top Shelf that does not disappoint!
text: This very elegant hotel is fabulous and our new favorite in NYC (although the Ritz-Carlton at Central Park still holds a place in our hearts). The rooms are immaculate, super comfortable and the hotel staff were very friendly. Since the Towers starts on the 40+ floor it is also very quite and private. Highly recommended for a luxurious stay in the City!

title: We had a fantastic time at the Palace Hotel.
text: This is my go to hotel because of the people....in particular Kal Naim. Kal is a concierge in the tower section.  He took care of every detail and truly made our visit so fantastic.  Thank you Kal for making our visit so very special

title: The reviews are right - an amazing hotel
text: My partner and I have stayed at many 5 Star hotels around the world and the Lotte Towers in NY is definitely up there with the best!  I normally don't write reviews but I felt the Lotte Towers was an exception.  I surprised my partner with a surprise trip to NY and proposal.  I wanted a hotel that was going to compliment our stay but also be memorable for the occasion.  After great search I came across the Towers at the Lotte, the hotel does not come up on every hotel search site but I am glad I came across it on Tripadvisor. The location is spot on, the hotel is beautiful & enchanting, the hospitality is warm & inviting and; the service is impeccable.  The hotel met my pre arrival requests without any hassle & issue and organised for a Nespresso coffee machine to be in our room when we arrived.  We stayed on the 47th floor looking over the cathedral and the spectacular NY skyline.  The inroom automation system was the best I have used and I compliment the hotel for keeping up with the times.  Special mention to their staff as they were all amazing but in particular Ani and Rene in concierge for their great knowledge of NY and giving us great advice which allowed us to see NY away from the crowds.  Jose at the front for his warm and kind hospitality every day we saw him and Rafik in the lobby lounge for being very accommodating and providing exceptional customer service. If you are travelling to NY and want to spoil yourself do yourself a favour and stay at the Towers at the Lotte.

title: Thank you Ani!
text:
For going out of your way to help a sister out trying to find mani/pedi place that served wine during my only window of relaxation!We stayed at the Palace this time but at The Towers a couple of years ago.
Continue your outstanding service for all

title: Five star service
text:
We checked into the hotel this morning and we were Escorted to our room by the bellman. Upon arrival to our suite, we were shocked when we entered to find the room was Occupied. We immediately return to the lobby and was greeted by a Page at the front desk, Ms.Clara Law..
I own a few hotels in the western New York area and would be fortunate to have an associate such as Ms. Law. Her professionalism, her attention to detail and her kindness are beyond compare; she is the type of person that would be an asset for any hotel owner...
Thank you Ms.Law!!!!

title: Best Christmas present
text:
I was very grateful and appreciative of the best Christmas gift 🎁 . Have stayed at this ICONIC property. The ambiance is very grandiose, very festive and beautiful Christmas decor 🎄🎄, especially the courtyard with its pretty Christmas trees 🎄, The check in was quite delayed due to the influx of overwhelming guests. Clara was very nice and accommodating. She was very kind and courteous. Her assistance during our stay was excellent. Thank you Ms Clara 🙏♥️ the bellman George was very helpful. Receptionist AnneMarie tried her best to accommodate my request. I booked the corner suite, and we were assigned at the 49th floor at The Towers . It was very big and spacious. with sweeping views of the East side . I love the pantry/ kitchen amenities. Open concept to dining and living room. It’s very nice to entertain family and friends. It has a powder room for guests. The main bedroom suite and bathroom were very spacious. Had luxurious bathroom amenities. Very big Cal king bed . Comfortable and crisps white linens. Room service were excellent by Chris , Angel and David. They served us more plates , cutlery and wine glasses for my visitors. Clara brought us holiday decorated sweets and Lotte Teddy Bears for my kids. It was very memorable experience. It’s very convenient location near St Patrick’s cathedral, Saks Fifth shopping and especially the holidays famous Rockefeller Center Christmas 🎄 tree 🌲 Also I have met Victor, Director of the towers , Melody as well from the reception. received welcome greeting cards and sweet amenities from the general manager delivered to our suite. It’s very nice gesture and personalized. I felt royalty welcome 🙏 I am very thankful for $300 credit amazing Christmas present 🎁 Thank you 
I am already planning to spend time with family and friends for my birthday 🎂 
I was very grateful from the Conceirge who helped for lunch reservation at the Villard’s. 
Thank you very much for all of your excellent hospitality.

title: Excellent Service, Location, and Room
text: I had the pleasure of staying at The Towers at Lotte New York Palace this past weekend.  It was relaxing, peaceful, and the room was spacious.  The Towers are a beautiful setting for stays.  Service was outstanding, and a special mention to Clara Law who quickly helped me when I was in a tight spot.  Thank you, Clara.  Fantastic stay.

title: Best hotel in the City !
text: On a recent holiday trip to NYC I returned to the  LOTTE NY Palace. The hotel was beautifully decorated for the Christmas season with all the decorations and the cafe outside . The hotel’s location is fabulous in the heart of the City with easy access anywhere . Clara Law from the Towers was extremely helpful in finding me Availability during the busy holiday season and an excellent room ! She went out of her way to make sure my needs were taken care of such as delicious chocolates and checking up on my dog to make sure he was ok . Samir was also helpful . The hotel is beautiful and the staff is amazing and that’s why I stay at the Palace!

title: Xmas!
text:
It’s not a secret at this point that the Towers is our second home from home. Once more the hotel looked fabulous with all the Xmas decorations ! This time I found the hotel to be extremely busy... more than usual at this time of the year... which I believe affected the staff. Victor was amazing!! Miles is a gem ! Like I said before in other reviews he is the future of this Hotel.. he is excellent !!! Then we have Clara who is always helpful, Ned always so polite, Kal always funny and so knowledgeable, Marco❤️, Rene, Ani, Diego always the best of the best, Julieta we love you, Lorena, Joseph ... Samir you are so great we don’t have words to describe you❤️❤️ you guys are the reason we come back! We truly appreciate all of you❤️❤️Becky thank you so much for the treats in the room... Lucas loved them!!
If you are looking for location this is the place to be.. it’s close to every single thing you want to visit in NYC. The rooms are great and spacious. We tried to stay two nights at The Ritz on Central Park but we came back the first night thanks to Victor who was able to get us our rooms back!! There is no comparison not even with the Ritz.. thank you all again and see you soon!!

title: 3rd year in a row
text: My husband & I surprised our girls for the 3rd year in a row and went to NYC Jan 1-4, 2020 for one of their big Christmas presents.  We stayed at The Towers at Lotte New York Palace for the third time.  What a magical hotel.  The staff is amazing, in particular Clara Law.  She is one of the reasons we continue to come back!  She spoils our girls each time we come - they look forward to seeing her.  This time we went with my mother/father-in-law, sister-in-law and 2 nieces.  Clara went out of her way to make all 10 of us feel welcomed and special.  From check in (Anne Marie?) to the bell men (Thomas), everyone at the Lotte goes above and beyond.  We won't stay anywhere else - thank you Clara!!

title: My Favorite Hotel!
text:
This is by far my favorite hotel in NYC! I have been to NYC at least 10 times, 5 of which were with my young daughter. This is the best place to stay! My most recent trip in January was my 3rd stay at the Towers. The location is unbeatable and the service is top notch! 
We were checked in by Jimm who was so hospitable and escorted us up to our room. 
Room service is quick and delicious! 
I love this hotel in the winter because of the iconic Christmas decor but I equally love it in the summer for its outside bar & patio!
I cannot recommend this hotel enough! Book it! ❤️

title: My Favorite Place To Stay in NYC!
text:
My daughter (7) and I just got back from our 5th trip to NYC together and our third time staying at Lotte in the Towers. I am hooked! It is my very favorite hotel to stay at. The location is unrivaled, close enough to walk to Rockefeller Center and Times Square. The service is amazing as well. Jimm, who checked us in, was awesome and surprised us with a room upgrade. He even escorted us to our room and gave us the full tour. 
Everyone is friendly and welcoming. The room service is quick and efficient. 
I absolutely love going in the summer, too as they have an amazing patio with a bar outside and it is absolutely delightful! 
I cannot recommend this hotel enough! 
Jenny S

title: Amazing stay & amazing experience.
text:
Second to NONE! Experience, space, and personal touches await you as soon as you reach the door!

As soon as you walk in your are whisked away to the Towers entry - a private area away from the hustle & bustle of the lobby. You are greeted with champagne as the staff finalizes the details of your stay, really cementing that you are in for a lovely vacation and a luxurious stay. A quick ride in the gilded elevators, and you are on your floor. 

We stayed in the Towers Two Bedroom Corner Suite on the 52nd floor.The room was breathtaking, with unobstructed views over St. Patrick's Cathedral, Rockefeller Center, Radio City Music Hall, Midtown, views of Central Park, and even the George Washington Bridge if you look far enough! 

The space is stunning as soon as you walk in, with a wonderful entry way lit by a chandelier, large coat closet, and powder room. You walk from the entry into a massive dining and living area. The views are stellar as noted above, but even nicer is the sheer amount of space, the modern design of the furniture, and the thoughtfulness of the curation of the space. The bedrooms are very large as are the bathrooms which made our stay that much more comfier. There is a kitchen complete with a minibar and wine fridge, and unexpected but lovely addition!

We utilized many of the services available to guests; to name a couple, shoe shine and pressing (completed within an hour!) and room service. Upon arrival we were greeted with a bottle of champagne and small snacks from the lovely Sales Manager, Dan Nelson. He truly took wonderful care of us and the thought to have these items waiting upon our arrival truly was the cherry on top of a fantastic stay.

I will recommend the Towers to anyone visiting or planning a stay-cation!

title: Amazing stay in a truly Beautiful Hotel
text:
I’ve just recently returned from a 7 day city break in New York. When I was searching for a hotel I wanted to stay in a good hotel in a good location but not in Times Square. I was also travelling with someone who suffered with anxiety and I needed to make sure all our needs were catered for. 

After searching for suitable hotels, I narrowed my selection down to a handful of hotels. I then read the reviews for each one. I wanted a hotel just outside Times Square so not to be on top of the noise and busy streets, but I still wanted to be quite central to everything. 

The hotel that had the best reviews was Lotte New York Palace Hotel. I don’t think there was one bad review. I then contacted the hotel to explain my needs and was put in touch with Bella Estrella, The Hotel Guest Experience Coordinator. I can’t praise this woman enough. She assured me that our needs would be met and they were. We communicated regularly and my questions were answered promptly and reassuringly. Bella kept me up to date for when she was available and if she wasn’t, she let me know who was this being Renee M Carbone, Executive Officer Manager, and Daniel on the front desk, who helped us with directions and subway. 

On arrival at the Hotel, we was greeted by friendly, approachable and professional staff and was shown to our room. Our room being in The Towers. I don’t know where to start with how amazing The Towers are. There is a separate entrance with its own front desk and concierge. 

Our room was on the 44th floor overlooking St Patrick’s Church and The Rockefeller Center where the world’s most famous Christmas Tree is. 

I liked the idea of the rooms having black out blinds, but I never used them, as I was 44 floors up, the noise of the busy streets below wasn’t a concern and I couldn’t stop admiring the view from the window.  I had a good nights sleep every night. The beds are very comfortable and the rooms are spotlessly clean. 

The room has a door bell and a portable control panel which controls the lights, room temperature and window blinds. The bathroom has a large shower and a vanity area with complimentary Molton Brown products.  

The location of the hotel is excellent with not being in the middle of a very busy Times Square but still accessible to all other locations. On leaving the hotel within a couple of minutes you arrive at SAKS, Fifth Avenue, and the main entrance to St Patrick’s Church. From Fifth Avenue, Central Park is a 5 minute walk, passing all the luxury shops, Trump Tower, Tiffanys and SJP. Also from Fifth Avenue, within minutes you arrive at The Rockefeller Center. The Rockefeller Center has a lot to offer, not just the amazing Christmas Tree, but the NBC Studios, Top Of The Rock, Rainbow Rooms, Bar Sixty Five, Radio City Music Hall and the Rockettes, Ice Skating, access to the Subway and a wide selection of shops, dining areas and coffee shops. 

The Lotte Hotel offers a fabulous room service. I had a lovely New Year’s Day breakfast brought to my room. There is also a breakfast area, if you don’t want to eat in your room, and a bakery located on the ground floor if you need to grab a drink and pasty on the go. 

Being in The Towers, besides having a separate entrance, reception and concierge, and amazing views, they also have complimentary water, a car service and umbrellas for rainy days. Newspapers and fresh fruit is available daily. 

I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at New York, but what made my holiday extra special was my stay at Lotte Hotel. I have not one fault, everything I have to say is fantastic. 

The only problem is now, I can’t stay anywhere else after staying there. It is worth every penny. I’m already looking forward to my next trip to New York and Lotte Palace Hotel. 

I would like to thank everyone here at this hotel, the maids, concierge, door and baggage staff, Daniel and Renee,  but especially one truly amazing person, Bella. Thank you, you made a stay in New York and at Lotte Hotel truly amazing.

Knowing that we had assistance 24 hours, it made my sisters anxiety less of a problem and made the trip very relaxed and enjoyable. I look forward to my next stay.
