title: Beautiful Hotel!
text: Our room was on the 51st floor in the Tower section with a view of St. Pat's Cathedral. Very nice room, large marble bath with a comfortable bed and pillows. Being on the 51st floor the room was very quiet!! Timm checked us in and was mindful of my requests which was nice. We are Preferred Hotel and Resorts members but did not receive an upgrade. The only reason this review was not 5 stars is that the dining options for dinner are very limited. In fact the evening we wanted to dine in the Gold Room they were closed due to an event with no advance warning. We did enjoy grabbing coffee and breakfast sandwiches in their small bakery!

title: What a letdown
text: I was very hyped about my stay at the Towers and got my family excited about the heritage, the service and the amenities offered as well. The plethora of outstanding reviews online gave me confidence that it will be a great experience. Unfortunately, the hotel turned out to be such a letdown and I wish I had booked elsewhere for our family holiday. The hotel is beautiful, I'll give you that. But the service, oh goodness the service. Coffee and tea refills take 45 mins to arrive; the right number of cups / towels / glasses is never provided despite our repeat reminder of there being 4 room guests; there is supposedly complimentary Mercedes or Mayback rides but funnily there are either no drivers after 8pm or worse, no service on a Tuesday (whatever that means, since nothing is mentioned in the guest services brochure). We told the housekeeping staff that we will be checking out at 1pm on our last day and they came around at 1:05pm and started complaining because we asked for 5 mins more to wheel our luggage out, literally chasing us to leave. The final shock was getting slapped with a bill of $120+ for coffee refills and teabags (2 coffee satchets and 4 teabags to be exact) over 4 days, although no pricing was ever provided, no bill was ever signed nor an itemized invoice ever provided, even at check-out. I didn't want to quibble over the cost or the charge, but rest assured that we will never stay again at this hotel. Also as a warning to all others: always ask if there is a price because never assume with this hotel.

title: The Towers at Lotte New York Palace
text: I found this hotel to be very accommodating and is located close to Rockefeller Centre. The hotel is very clean and all staff are very pleasant and helpful, especially when you need information on places to visit, and the directions given are always clear and accurate.  Isabella, the concierge was extremely helpful. I would also say the doormen were fantastic, especially my favourite doorman George (the Greek). Thanks for making our stay a wonderful experience.

title: Beautiful hotel
text: My daughters and granddaughters stayed on the 52nd floor in a beaurtiful suite. Both bedrooms were lovely and they had the rollaways all set up when we arrived. They bent over backwards trying to find us an appropriate stroller. Everything was clean and enjoyable. Will stay again!

title: Our 2019 Christmas stay at The Lotte Towers
text: We stayed here for 9 nights over Christmas in a one bedroom executive suite. We loved our stay. We were on the 49th floor overlooking the Rockefella Center and St Patricks Cathedral. The views are fantastic! The suite is lovely. A hallway with a coat closet, good sized living room and bedroom and a large bathroom. Some have said the bathrooms are a little old fashioned but they are very clean and very big with a separate shower and bath. Housekeeping were fantastic. Friendly and efficient. We didn't use the font desk much but were friendly when we did. On the first few nights of the stay there was complimentary champagne and drinks when you entered the Towers foyer which was a nice touch. We used the complementary Maybach once which was very nice. We had drinks at Rarities once which was lovely, overlooking the large Christmas Tree at the entrance. We never ate at the restaurant but did use Pomme Palais which was nice but expensive. The hotel has fantastic Christmas decorations and is just steps away form Saks and Fifth Avenue. It is pricey and if the price was right would happily stay again especially at Christmas.

title: Worst NYC experience
text:
Pulled up to the front of the hotel and no one was available to help with the bags. Booked a tower corner suite. Hotel check in is 3pm showed up at 11am room wasn't ready. Dissappointing but it happens. However at 3:45pm my room was still unavailable. When I remarked that this has never happened to me in the dozens of times I've stayed in NYC and this would probably be my first and last at the property the response from the front desk person was "fantastic". Finally got admitted to the room only to discover a foul odour (like sweaty feet) turns out it was the living room couch. Smells like someone died in here. 

Other reviews are overwhelmingly positive, really can't understand that.

title: Outstanding Customer Service!
text:
I just completed my third Christmas Holiday stay at The Towers at Lotte New York Palace and once again found this beautiful hotel and superior staff quite impressive and  memorable.  My end to end hotel experience was wonderful.  The hotel's customer service was superior to any I have recently experienced at any other hotel. 

While all of the employees I encountered were exceptional, Clara Law was absolutely amazing.   I felt her presence and attentive care throughout my entire stay.  She seemed to anticipate and respond to my questions and needs before I could properly formulate them.  Clara is the Crown Jewel at the Towers and I am so thankful she is there.   

I ate a delicious breakfast at the hotel each of the three mornings I was there.  After being seated in Melissa's section the first morning, I requested her each morning thereafter.  Although the restaurant was extremely busy, she was personable and attentive and remembered my unique requests each morning without being prompted.  

I love this hotel and its employees!  I personally look forward to my next stay and highly recommend this hotel to others.

title: Honeymoon Visit
text: I can’t say enough about how wonderful Clara Law and Nancy Liang were in assisting me with honeymoon arrangements for my niece and her new husband!  They had champagne and chocolate-covered strawberries waiting for them in their room!  They also helped with a last-minute request to extend their stay!  This hotel is outstanding in every way!

title: New York City at Christmas time
text: Such a beautiful place to stay during Christmas! Everything was perfect. Great service. Beautiful decorations. One of the best places to stay in the city. A great location to walk to so many places. Thankful for the umbrellas during the rainy days.

title: Love The Towers at the Lotte!
text: Love everything about the hotel and the location. My one caveat is the elevator situation. Two elevators to use for floors 41- top can produce a lengthy wait. But that said, the experience is well worth a potential wait at the elevator.

title: Service Excellence
text:
My wife and I are from Florida.  We recently spent a weekend in New York during the Christmas holiday with family from New Jersey.   With all that is happening in this great city, especially in Mid-Town at this time of year, it may sound strange to include the hotel (Lotte Palace) on a list of memorable experiences. The restaurants, museums, and Broadway, and of course quality family time, all of which were wonderful, may have been less memorable had it not been for the excellent accommodations and service at the Palace Towers.  After all, it's your home away from home for a few days.  Be that as it may, I want to single out two individuals, who by any measure would be an asset to any organization. At the front desk - Anna Marie.  Courteous, friendly, professional and full attention to the customer before her.  She was delightful despite being in the midst of a sea of humanity.  People everywhere.  House keeping - a Palace veteran, Afredita.
Seldom, if ever, have we experienced the attention to detail and guest needs shown by Afredita.  Kudos to management for retaining staff who represent your brand at such a high level.

title: ANOTHER AMAZING STAY AT THE TOWERS AT LOTTE NY PALACE!!!
text:
For the 3rd year straight, the Lotte Palace Towers has exceeded expectations!! I arrived early morning and was warmly greeted and welcomed back by Ray who seems to never forget a name! I knew the room would likely not be ready due to my early morning arrival, but Papa was there to take care of the luggage and delivered it promptly. Melody and Jim worked to ensure we each had just the view we were wanting and Clara Law always takes care of every little detail that makes the stay so special! Each time I return I look for a different view or experience because I never want this trip to become routine. This time Clara showed me the corner suite - which I loved!  I have already booked the room for my next visit! There are many fabulous hotels in NYC, but it is the staff and level of service that make the difference here. Yohanna, Samir, Lorena, Ani - these are just a few of the names I recall and want to also recognize. No matter what I needed as I came by the desk, I was always made to feel that it was their pleasure to be of service. They represent your team so well!!!

Housekeeping always does an outstanding job of working around my schedule. And I have been spoiled by Melissa and the great food at the Villard!

The Lotte Palace Towers has a very special team. And as usual, I have already made reservations to return next year!

See you soon

title: Unforgettable Christmas
text: We are very sadly checking out today after the most amazing week at this fabulous hotel. We loved our huge suite so much it was difficult to drag ourselves out!! We looked directly over st Patrick’s cathedral, with great views of the Rockefeller centre too. The hotel is wonderfully situated two minutes from saks and easy walking distance to many of the major attractions. The Christmas decorations were utterly amazing, both in the hotel and the courtyard. Just beautiful! Our bed was Sooo comfortable and housekeeping kept the suite beautifully. An incredible stay that will be really hard to beat!

title: Holidays in NYC with the Family
text:
Great stay at Lotte Palace Towers. Room was awesome. Staff was very friendly and helpful md the overall Service was excellent. Great location. Outstanding breakfast. 

We would definitely recommend The Towers.

title: Great New York Stay!
text: This was a great stay for business in early December. Rooms are spacious and towels are amazing. Only drawback is the two elevators that serve all the floors—during peak times you will wait several minutes for a free elevator so choose a lower floor.

title: Love!
text: Perfect for a family Christmas trip to NYC! The corner suites are very spacious and the way the hotel is decorated is magical. Loved being walking distance to everything we wanted to do. Wonderful overall!

title: Christmas time
text:
Beautiful hotel with absolutely stunning views ... especially at sunrise! 

There’s a lovely Christmas atmosphere with the best outdoor Christmas tree & gorgeous gingerbread version of the hotel on display.

title: Perfection
text: We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite for four nights close to the Christmas holiday. The suite was more like a luxury apartment with a full kitchen. Amazing space. All of it useful.  The hotel is decorated like it's at the North Pole including its own Santa...who was there twice. The service was amazing. Our rate included breakfast at Villard that was top notch. Finally the location cannot be beat. Right behind St. Patrick's....so you are right at the Tree at Rockefeller Center. Close to everything!!! Definitely 5 stars.

title: Excellent Experience
text:
Service was Grand..Location is Perfect..Facility is simply the Palace on Madison Avenue 
The Quality of facility and staff was experienced from the doorman upon arrival until the doorman on our departure.
We will not hesitate to insure our future home while in New Your is in the Tower’s

title: Almost 5 Stars
text: We enjoyed the Palace in early December - choosing the hotel for the location and the beautiful Christmas decorations we hear about.  Our trip was solely to enjoy some Christmas shopping and the atmosphere in NYC so the hotel was perfect for that.  Location is ideal to all the sights and shopping in Midtown.  Hotel was almost 5 stars.  The reason it wasn't?  Housekeeping was sloppy, little touches you expect in a 5 star hotel were just not quite there. I don't expect to get a letter under my door at 8:15 that housekeeping attempted to clean and if I want a clean, I have to call down...  at 4pm yes, but not at 8:15 in the morning! Sat in the lounge and watched a server see us sit down, but clearly we were not "his" table.  He let us wait 15 minutes before the proper server was able to attend to us.  That just isn't 5 star service.If you are paying over $1000 a night you expect everything to be "just so" We stayed at the Four Seasons in September and the Palace just didn't match Four Seasons service and attention to detail.  It was good - just not perfect.  Hotel rooms are quite tired - need a refresh for sure.  The decor was delightful, and the doormen were great as well.

title: Best Trip Ever
text: Customer Service! Customer Service! Did I say customer service.... Everyone went above and beyond to ensure my family had a great stay. After learning it was my sons first time to NYC they brought him milk and cookies to the room at night...

title: Outstanding Staff, Service, and Hotel
text:
I have travelled and stayed in hotels from Beijing to the West Coast, and this weekend’s stay exceeded all expectations at the Lotte Towers. It all started with our check-in with Jimm Kalinka. Jimm’s bright, kind, and above and beyond demeanor left us feeling as if we were royalty. He continually checked in on us every time we would pass by to make sure all our needs were taken care of.

Our suite on the 53rd floor also exceeded expectations.We had an incredible view of Burberry Haus, St. Patrick’s Cathedral, and the Rockefeller tree. The room was spotless, and all the toiletries were first class.

We enjoyed our room service as well—the food was better than most of our meals throughout the city.

The Christmas decor was also stunning, and definitely got my mother and I in the Christmas spirit.

Thank you Lotte Staff, and Jimm for giving us an incredible stay we will not soon forget!

title: Magnificent hotel -- for business and for pleasure
text: The Lotte feels like it's in the center of everything -- and it is! Always bustling and vibrant, the Lotte is also elegant, beautiful and impeccable. If you are lucky enough to be staying in the Towers, you'll feel like kings (and queens) of New York: the views from every Towers room are spectacular and both the rooms and the suites are extremely spacious, modern and well-appointed. Even the Palace rooms (at least the ones we've stayed in) have been large (especially by NY standards) and lovely, with beautiful views of St. Patrick's Cathedral. And we're always impressed that, for such a big hotel, every member of the staff works to give each guest a positive, and personal, experience. Definitely one of the very best hotels of NY.

title: Thanksgiving at the Lotte Palace
text: This hotel is very well situated in the city for a tourist visit. Parking is expensive but if you can handle a walk of a few blocks, parking becomes more reasonable. Breakfast room a little undersized for the hotel but the food is good value. The hotel was busy as it was Thanksgiving week but we received a wonderful room upgrade. Probably the best accomodation we have ever had in the city. Night views were stunning. We attended the magic show and found it excellent.

title: Holiday girls weekend
text: The hotel, staff, and amenities were excellent.  We very much enjoyed our stay.  The hotel spared no expense on holiday decorations.  The location is perfect, next to St. Patrick's Cathedral and Rockefeller Center.  Also close to Central Park.  The views go on forever.  The traditional details of the architecture and design were breathtaking.  I plan to return to this hotel in the future.

title: Christmas TIme at the Lotte
text:
The hotel is beautiful and in a great location. Check in on Sunday, December 8 was horrible. 
There was about 500 people checking out and not enough staff to check the new arrivals in. We were in the Towers and had to wait very long to check in. They didn't have any water or anything and the concierge people were standing behind the concierge desk and were not able to assist. Why not train them to do check in? The next day we saw plenty  of water bottles in the Tower check in because I am sure other people complained. Other than that crazy day everything else was great.

title: Best kept secret in Midtown
text:
My wife found this hotel years ago.  200 words really isn’t enough to describe what could possibly be the best running hotel in New York.

They have consistently outperformed themselves each time I’ve stayed there or when my wife has “girls” trips. 

The staff is very outgoing. Once a bellman went to the corner, got in a cab and directed the cab to us.  (One example of many)

We wouldn’t consider staying anywhere else.

title: Fantastic stay!
text: Love this hotel! I have stayed in New York City several times, but this was my first time staying at this hotel, and I don’t want to stay anywhere else in the future. Fabulous location, gorgeous lobby and room, and lovely service. We’ll be back!

title: Favorite Place to Stay in NYC
text: I have been staying at the Towers at Lotte NY Palace for years now. Each time I enter the hotel, I am warmly greeted by a variety of staff members who have been there over time. When staying in the Towers, guests are directed to check in at a small private front desk rather than in the main lobby. Water and fresh apples are often set out for guests to take up to their rooms. On this visit, I was upgraded from a king room to a stunning and spacious king suite. Everything thing about this room was perfect! Housekeeping was excellent, as was room service, and bellman assistance. Complimentary daily shoe shine service, robes, slippers, and great bathroom products are also wonderful perks. During my stay, I needed some advice about things going on in the city. There are two people who always go above and beyond.....I would like to recognize George at the front door and Susan Jordan at the Towers front desk. These two staff members are amazing and are very special gems that I seek to see each time I stay at the Towers at the Lotte NY Palace!!! They, among others, draw me back again and again and make the Towers continually feel like a home away from home!

title: Magnificent!
text: My suite on the 47th floor was truly luxurious, comfortable and quiet.  Reception was courteous and helpful not only on arrival but throughout the 2 days I was there.  I would only recommend that it would be helfpul for such a suite to have its own ice machine or at least ice cube trays, unless hygiene concerns indicate otherwise.  ALso, being old-fashioned, I recommend large bars of bath soap.

title: Our home away from home
text: This is our favorite hotel in NYC. We always feel welcome by the staff who have gotten to know us over the years.   Anne Marie is the best!!!!  Always goes above and beyond to make us feel special. Like coming home to family!

title: Thanksgiving at the Lotte Towers
text: We went to New York City for Thanksgiving.  We brought my parents with my family (2 teenagers).  We were supposed to stay in a 2 bedroom corner suite.  When we arrived, we were told we had been upgraded.  We were given a 2 bedroom penthouse suite with split floors (it had a terrace on the 3rd floor accessible only from its private elevator!!!).  It was stunning!  It was beautifully appointed with a perfect location and views.  The hotels service was top notch.  We absolutely loved it and will be back!  Yes, it’s an expensive hotel, but everything in that area is.  Know that going in.  I read the reviews before our trip.  One review talked about the coffee shop inside the hotel being overpriced.  Yes, some gifty things are expensive, but coffee’s and pastries were comparable to Starbucks.  Gorgeous hotel in a Perfect location!

title: Kal Naim (the concierge) is superb !
text:
The Lotte Palace is neat and clean and the staff is always helpful and friendly. The standout above all, and the person who made our trip superb was the concierge, Kal Naim. Kal made a daily effort to coordinate shows with nearby theaters and his recommendations were always spot-on. He made sure we knew how to get where we were going and when necessary secured transportation. Kal took a personal interest in seeing we thoroughly enjoyed NYC in the busy holiday season.

The only negative comment we have about the hotel is the Crestron electrical system. It failed to work a couple of times. On one instance we had to have the hotel electrician in our room at 1AM just so we could get the lights to turn off. On another instance, our room was not cleaned. When I questioned one of the maids, she said she could not enter the room because the Crestron "Do not disturb" light was on. She was correct, because the Crestron system had an indistinguishable button on the light switch that got turned on with the lights by mistake. 
When the system did work, it was not intuitive and not at all user friendly. This system needs to be replaced.

title: Highs and lows.....
text:
HIGH: The high point was Kal, the concierge. He is fabulous..... he recommended theater (which we loved), and booked us in great restaurants. He seemed to have a great sense of who we are and what we would like. A REAL professional, who made the trip a great one..
LOW: We arrived at 3:30pm, the room wasn't ready and they couldn't tell us when it would be!?! We did get into our room at 4:30- and it was discounted for that night (smart move)
HIGH: nice, large room in the Towers, with a fabulous view down 50th, Radio City etc. Very clean, comfortable bed, nice amenities.
LOW: the lighting system in the room- done through a computer system, which meant I had to get out of bed to go turn off the light (no manual switches....). Then, one night when we came in late, we couldn't turn off ANY of the lights in the room. The electrician DID show up promptly, and by 1am we were able to turn out the lights. 
HIGH: very pleasant and accommodating staff in general.... and a great location.

title: Thanksgiving review
text:
Wonderful suite, great service. Best location! Staff was wonderful and very helpful. This was my second visit at the Lotte and I will def be back.
Only negative is that the Tower elevators are very slow to come and go. Usually had to wait as several stops on our floor would be filled to capacity.

title: Son’s 10th Birthday
text: Amazing trip. Can’t say enough good things about the hotel. Delivered balloons and cake on day of my son’s birthday. All of the staff were top notch. Wonderful service. Rooms were clean, spacious and comfortable.

title: Excellent location for tourism and value for money!
text:
The room we were given had an excellent view of the Manhattan skyline!  The room was very clean and spacious.
The hotel as a whole is traditional, but modern amenities, very comfortable ambience with friendly and eager to assist staff members..  I will definitely come back next year!

title: Great location . Room  with a view !!  Wonderful night in the  city !
text: We got an upgrade . The suite was amazing !! Our view was Perfect !  Location is the best ! Wow wow wow . Kids were in awe . Will rebook for another night . The pastry shop was good . Parking fee a bit pricey

title: The perfect stay in Manhattan
text:
An amazing view on Manhattan and the St Patrick Cathedral from the 44th floor from a suite where we were 3 old friends for the Thanksgiving week end. The service is Perfect! Not only the property but the comfort of the room, a big bathroom with shower, bath tub, bidet, magnifing mirror, high quality cosmetics, everything you may need is offered. 
Perfectly located in the middle of Manhattan! High quality room service as we chosed to have breakfast upstairs in order to catch up. I don’t know what can one want more. Thank you!

title: Breakfast at the Palace (NYC)
text: Stayed at the Palace the weekend before Thanksgiving. Great and spacious room in the Towers. The check in went smoothly and service throughout the stay was top notch The best experience was breakfast by far. The Vaillard Room is large and so well decorated. The waitstaff and the seating staff were friendly, polite and gracious. It did not hurt that there was a credit for the morning meal as well. The food was fresh and savory, especially the pastry and breads. Nobody hurried us to finish. Great way to start a New York City Day (and night.....saw Wicked at the Gershwin!!)

title: Palace Towers Stay - November 2019
text: I got engaged at the Palace in November of 2019. Kasja From Guest Experience helped my fiancé plan everything — it was the most amazing, unforgettable weekend of my life! Everyone at the Palace treated us like royalty and our Towers room was spectacular. Thank you to everyone who made it so special!

title: Superb Hotel
text: My partner and I spent Thanksgiving at this exquisite hotel. From the moment we walked in the service was impeccable...from the doorman to the lady at the front desk (Anne-Marie) to the bellhop. Every step of the way was wonderful. When we walked through the private Towers entrance to check in, Anne Marie greeting us with a warm smile and kind disposition. That set the tone for the entire weekend. She helped us get accommodated in our suite and had us on our way. Our suite was beautiful and large with everything we could possibly need. Beds were comfy and the bathroom amenities were excellent...I'm already a Molton Brown fan but I tried the Lip Balm and have already ordered it online. The location was perfect for us as we pretty much walked everywhere we needed to be. You can see Radio City Music Hall from the hotel's side entrance and of course Rockefeller Center is across the street. We went shopping on 5th Ave and Thanksgiving dinner at The Grill inside the Seagram building...both of which are just a 5 minute walk. Room service was spot on! Even with the Thanksgiving rush, we had our room service meals delivered in less than 30 minutes. The staff really goes out of their way to make you feel welcome. Our go-to hotel has been the Waldorf Astoria but since that has been closed for renovations for a couple of years now, we have tried other hotels....none that we truly enjoyed. We no longer need to look and try other properties as we have found our new go-to. They have a happy new guest for life... Just wanted to say Thank You to the entire staff as every single person, including housekeepers, bartenders and wait staff, made our trip truly memorable and special.

title: Thanksgiving at the New York Palace
text: We’ve been coming to the New York Palace every Thanksgiving for years with our family. This year was the best. You can’t beat the location, room size and quality of staff that attends to your very need. Fitness center has all new equipment and brand new spa being built. Anna-Maria and Jorge made sure we were well taken care of and we look forward to coming back next year.

title: Lotte New York Palace Towers Hotel
text: The hotel was wonderful. From the minute I checked in until checkout everyone at the hotel went above and beyond to make it a great experience. The location is superb. It will be my go to hotel anytime I am in NY again.

title: The Towers is the best place to stay in NYC!!!
text:
My trip got off to a rocky start but Miles Gomez (one of the front desk managers) saved the day!  He completely turned my vacation around and thanks to him I had the best stay and highly recommend the Towers!  It was a very busy time at the hotel due to Thanksgiving and the hotel was completely full.  Yet somehow Miles was able to upgrade my room to the most amazing suite with views of the Cathedral and even had its own exercise room with a Life Fitness exercise bike!  He also had a complimentary plate of cookies and candy delivered to the room for my daughter.  Beyond the amazing suite and treats, it’s the fact that he cared enough to take the time and make the effort to make sure that I had a good experience at the Towers when he easily could have said sorry but the hotel is full...which it was.  I travel a lot and this was the best customer service ever.

The suite was beautiful with huge floor to ceiling windows with an amazing view.  The bed was so comfortable that it was difficult to get out of it each morning.  Turn down service, free wifi, morning papers etc.  Breakfast at the Villard was delicious especially the avocado toast.  

Employees who recognized us from last year (like Maurice and our funny waiter whose name escapes me) were so welcoming.

I wouldn’t stay anywhere else in NYC!

And again thanks to Miles for making us feel like you really cared about our vacation and for making it so great for us.

title: Another great stay at the Palace Towers
text: Great room, location, service and hospitality, consistently delivered. We travel often to NYC and The Towers is our favorite hotel.  Booking through American Express’s fine hotels provides upgrades, late check outs and complementary breakfast.

title: Chevere!
text: No se como los habitaciones en el palacio son pero los torre son algo si de lujo. Estuvimos en una junior suite gracias a Daniel por hacerlo possible. Los toques finales si son de lujo. Mucho espacio en la habitación. Usamos varios días el servicio de carro gratis ese toque era perfecto. Todo estaba muy muy bien. Hasta la próxima.

title: Fantastic hotel!
text:
We stayed at The Lotte New York Palace, The Towers for Thanksgiving week and loved it! 
The location is ideal; the hotel is gorgeous, rooms are large, service is fantastic. 
We loved the proximity to all in NYC, and the many offerings at the hotel (lounge, coffee bar, restaurant, etc.) 
The Christmas tree in the courtyard and all the festive decor was gorgeous.
Our room was wonderful and we had an amazing view from the 50th floor! 
We can’t wait to come back!

title: Family fun visit
text:
Jim at the front desk was outstanding and eager to please us. All staff very personable and engaging with us. We stayed during the housewives group. Fun to watch the scenes. Lol 
 Rooms very clean.  Room service was substandard. Very long time to get coffee and they forgot to bring. To change 14.00 for a bagel is insane. We ordered twice. Not up to other areas.

title: Great location and spacious rooms with excellent food and a beautiful bar
text: We stayed for several nights with our grandchildren. We had two suites and a king room on the 51st floor. The hotel made a special effort to put us all close to each other. As part of our trip included taking the grandchildren to the Radio City Christmas Show, this hotel is in a perfect location as it is two blocks away. There is a cafe in the hotel which makes fantastic coffee and excellent pastries. When we checked in, the doormen brought stuffed bears and tiaras up to the room for our grandchildren. That was a big hit. The Villard Bar in the hotel is a beautiful room and a very relaxing place to have a drink.

title: Location Luxury and more...
text: We stayed for a weekend prior to the holidays and very much enjoyed the Towers.  The views from the rooms facing St. Patricks are outstanding and we could see the Hudson River in the distance.  Rooms are comfortable and well maintained...good lighting and amenities. Personally I would expect a coffee machine of some sort ,but that is the only thing lacking. Quiet and very large room that is great for sleeping with the total blackout shades.  We also enjoyed breakfast in the Villard Room and the old world opulence of the lobby and public areas takes one back to another era. Location is excellent. Concierge and front desk staff on the Towers side are  efficient. As we saw the long check out lines for the main hotel we made a note to return to the Towers!! Since it is a bit pre-holiday we really appreciated the stunning Christmas Tree and other decor...just beautiful. Recommend this hotel for your stay in NYC.

text:
