very helpful and love the smile
We wanted GRAB BARs iour room bathroom drain slow
beautiful loation beauiful views aand great Service       The room service was so much fun and we loved the restaurant was beautiful  and food delicious

title: Excellent
text: The service is professional and premium from beginning to end. the rooms are very spacious and comfortable. The proximity to a number of relevant amenities makes the location very convenient. I like the fact that St Patrick's Cathedral is just across the street.

title: Best rooms and location in the city!
text: I was over joyed with my choice to stay at the Towers in Lotte Palace NYC. My kind room was so spacious and completely unexpected for the heart of NYC. The check in process was the friendliest I've experienced and the hotel was super modern and inviting. I can't wait for my next stay!

title: Always fabulous
text: Isabel and Ani the best concierge ever. As a senior woman travelling alone, I get safe and secure and treated beautify. Central location.. Great view of St. Pat's cathedral. Close to 5 th ave. Will always stay there.

title: My favourite hotel in NY
text:
I stayed at Lotte Palace for the weekend. Loved the location. My favourite was their AMAZING service. Spacious rooms. Lovely views of Manhattan. The bar was great too. 

Loved this place. Would definitely go back!!

title: Excellent Hotel and Peaceful room
text: Excellent service from front desk to housekeeping . I had a room on the 43rd floor that had a wonderful view and was very quiet . The Palace is my favorite business hotel in NYC and I plan to stay there as often as I visit NYC

title: 5 Star Amenities Made Better by Unsurpassed Staff and Management
text:
I have stayed in many high end hotels in New York City, but the Lotte Palace is the only one I will stay with in all of my future travels to the City.  
I have had the opportunity to experience several room configurations, and all were spacious, up to date and meticulously maintained.  The room amenities, including high speed internet, well stocked and maintained bar and water service as well as all of the services you would expect from an extremely high end hotel are here and meet the highest standards.  The Palace also has several beautifully appointed lounges, bars and restaurants that harken back to the tradition of lavish but classic styling that can only be found in the best New York City establishments.  The food, including room service, is excellent, at least as good as you would expect from any excellent New York restaurant.  But the real story behind my commitment to the Lotte Palace the only hotel  is the people who make everything perfect for every guest of the hotel.
From the moment that you check in and meet with Susan or Roxanna at the front desk, it becomes immediately apparent that it is their mission to make sure that your experience at the hotel is as perfect as can be from your very first encounter.  Stepping over to the concierge desk, Diego and Ani ensure that you are confident that there is nothing that they cannot accomplish for you and that they make it their mission to make your stay, not only at the hotel, but in New York City and beyond, the best experience possible.  These are not just hollow platitudes.  It is obvious from the baristas at Pomme to the room service and housekeepers that the people that "work" at the Palace love what they do, and that comes through in their commitment to guests of the hotel.  This isn't conjecture; I had the opportunity to speak with many of the staff about their passion for the hotel and their positions, including a barista who did not want to move on to a potentially "better" job because she loves the people she works with and the guests that she encounters every day. Management and guest services must be at the top of their games because it shows with every encounter.
It is trite to say that if you do what you love, you will never work a day in your life.  I don't know how true that maxim is, but the commitment of the Palace employees to their daily routine makes for an unparalleled stay for the guests of the hotel.  It is hard to appreciate how much of a difference the consideration and kindness of the people around you while you are traveling makes to success and enjoyment of your day, until you experience it.  If you are going to stay in luxury, be sure it is elevated by the people who go the extra mile to make your visit that much better.  
Lastly, the location is hard to beat.  Perfect for getting to business meetings, blocks from Rockefeller Center and the best shopping steps away.

title: Jbh
text:
Had the pleasure of staying at the Lotte New York Palace with my family and guests for my son’s wedding weekend.
Everyone and everything was wonderful.
The staff was fully attentive and accommodating in every aspect and the room was immaculate. Wonderful bed, sheets , thirsty towels and lovely Molten Brown toiletries.
Special thanks to Kristen Seaman and Dan Nelson!

title: Great trip!
text: Love, love, love this hotel!  Great location, outstanding service, beautiful room!  The hotel was busy because of the NY marathon. They immediately upgraded my room (I did not have to ask). Always professional.

title: Love the location
text: We have stayed at the Palace three times. But the first time in the towers. The room was huge!  Housekeeping staff did an amazing job. All staff were helpful and welcoming. We will stay here again!  The room was well appointed.

title: Excellent stay
text: Staff was excellent from arrival to check-out. Room was immaculate and bathroom amenities were high quality. Event manager who booked my stay was friendly and attentive, making restaurant and theater reservations for me. Will definitely stay again.

title: Great Birthday Trip
text: Traveling with my daughters and mom to celebrate her 80th birthday. We only heard great things from friends who have stayed here from back home in Ireland. We booked a superior room with 2 beds. We had the pleasure of checking in with a young man that was kind to us on check in. Daniel was such a nice person. He gave us a larger room with two queen beds in the towers. It was such a beautiful touch. We are so thankful. We come from a very simple way of life so this went such a long way for my mom. Glad to experience such an amazing hotel. Plus there is no place back home with 46 floors so that was really exciting.

title: Nice Room and wonderful bell staff
text:
Pros- The room was very spacious, very clean and comfortable. Molton Brown amenities and thick robes/slippers. Water bottles in room and they left a small delicious chocolate cake for me as it was my birthday. Wonderful and friendly bell staff.
Cons- outdated toilets that run a spray with ice cold water, no water or coffee at the Towers front desk area (or champagne if arriving late) on the weekends and a front desk staff that never greets customers coming in or out of the space and is generally surly.

title: Marathon Weekend
text: Very nice hotel with a great location.  Staff was very professional, room was comfortable and quiet.  My only criticism is that we stayed in a corner suite without the decor:  No flowers, table decorations/ books and the kitchen was not usable.

title: Amazing Room, View and Customer Service
text: Absolutely beautiful room overlooking St. Patrick's cathedral ~ amazing amenities and customer services.  Isabel Choi went above and beyond to make our stay a memorable one and will continue to bring us back to the Palace.

title: Zero Faults
text: Stayed two nights in the Towers.  Check-in is fast, the room is large, the blinds are full blackout, and the decor tasteful.  Very centrally located in Midtown.  The Towers room are a bit nicer than the remaining rooms.

title: Gorgeous views, exemplary staff
text: Six of us went to the Lotte New York Palace and stayed in the Towers for my dear friend’s birthday.  We were treated like royalty.  Perfect staff placement; concierge service.  An amazing and terrific stay. The rooms were beautiful as were the views!  Courtyard across from the church.   I would go back and stay!

title: NYC Visit
text: Our stay at the NYC palace was first class. We enjoyed excellent food, ambiance and great service. Our room in the Towers was very spacious which is unusual for NYC. There is a very large gym and the gift shop / longe was very handy for having a casual breakfast

title: 재방문! 최고!
text: 예전에 한번 이용했다가 너무 마음에 들어가지고 이번에 또 이용했습니다. 역시 두번을 이용해도 좋았습니다. 직원분들 진짜 친절하시고 서비스는 말할것도 없고 진짜 굿. 위치적으로도 마음에 들었습니다. 먼지 알러지가 있어서 룸선택하는데 꽤 힘든데 먼지가 전혀 없었는지 콧물 한번 재채기 한번 안났습니다. 진짜 굿. 룸 상태는 진짜 좋았고 조식이 최고였습니다. 다음에도 이곳에서 머물 예정입니다. 최고!

title: Beautiful Hotel - Great service
text: Loved the hotel and the room. It's an excellent, central location. We stayed in the Towers and the room was fantastic. The staff were attentive and helpful. Loved the gym. Will definitely stay there again!

title: Beautiful hotel/ F on service
text: The service was horrible.  We asked for ice to our > $1000/ night room and the answer we received was we will see.  Took almost an hour to receive the ice.  No icemaker were available for us to just help ourselves

title: Best Hotel Stay Ever
text: The group sales department lead Kristen and were fantastic.  We had over 85 Rooms for a wedding block.  The professionalism and service was spectacular.  The rooms, especially the bridal and groom suite were huge and perfect for the occasion.  Thanks Kristen Seaman & Daniel Nelson for making the weekend beyond fantastic

title: Very nice. Fit for a king
text: Would stay here in the future.  Location cannot be beat.   Rooms are way above average.   Service is excellent.  Room service was quick and food was above average.  Totally five stars at this hotel. Or should I say palace

title: Impeccable service and a gorgeous hotel!
text:
This was our first stay at The Lotte New York Palace Hotel & The Towers. We were in the city to celebrate my birthday and our 20th wedding anniversary.

The Towers has a separate entrance off of the main hotel lobby with their own front desk, concierge and 2 elevators. We arrived into the city at 11:30am l and hoped to get an early check-in, but one wasn’t available. We requested a room with a view overlooking St. Patrick’s Cathedral and Jim made that request happen! (Thank you Jim!) Our room was available around 30 minutes after regular check-in time (which is 3:00), but we were offered a $100 credit towards incidentals to make up for it. Melody and Clara provided amazing service to us at the front desk as well.

Our room (4616) was spacious and clean with a gorgeous view. It had two large closets, one with a safe and a large bathroom. We loved the touch-screen next to the bed that allowed you to control the lights and window shades.

The concierge team that we communicated prior to arrival (Diego & Rene) were friendly and efficient and helped line up dinner reservations to celebrate our anniversary. 

The guest services team surprised us in our room with a delicious tray of chocolate covered strawberries and a sweet note. This was such a thoughtful gesture to return back to our room and find. They made us feel like honored guests.

The hotel grounds are stunning and the courtyard provides the perfect location for your morning coffee.

I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone coming to the city, especially if you are celebrating a special event.

title: Amazing
text:
Excellent Hotel We have been coming here for over 30 years... it is SPECTACULAR... we stay in the Towers and love every minute of it...
The staff go over and above!!! The location is beyond wonderful.., the place is gorgeous and so beautiful

title: The Towers at Lotte NY Palace
text: This was our 4th stay at this property and was definitely the worst. We have chosen the Towers over the years because it is a part of the American Express Platinum program and we receive amenities for staying (for example, early check-in, late check-out, spa credit, room upgrade, etc.). On this visit, in late October 2019, the hotel was visibly run-down. Our room had thin sheets and bedding, the carpeting was worn and even the bathrobes were frayed. The spa was CLOSED for renovation despite being given an Am Ex amenity for $100 for use in the spa. Many phone calls later and we were able to confirm a spa service to be given in a vacant guest room. It was awkward and not relaxing. Our toilet ran continuously the first night and engineering had to come to repair it the next day. One elevator did not work well and required hitting the button multiple times until it buzzed and then worked. The staff was not as professional and attentive as usual. Our room service breakfast of bagels and LOX was not cleared for an entire day. We returned to our room at 4 pm and the breakfast was still sitting on the table despite the room being made up by housekeeping. The entire room smelled like fish. This hotel did not feel like a "Fine Hotel"  that is a part of the Am Ex program. The nightly price to stay in the "Towers" did not feel like a worthwhile expense. It is unlikely that we will return.

title: Our first visit to NY
text:
Very friendly staff. Hotel perfectly situated. The only criticism I have is that the lift to the Towers is extremely slow. During busy times, we had a long wait.
But overall a beautiful hotel, with old world charm and state of the art facilities.
We’ll be back.

title: Great Stay
text: The Lotte was a gracious hotel stay. The room was very large with all of the accommodation. Service was excellent. Fitness center has a large offering.  Location was super convenient to rock center. Would stay again!

title: always fabulous
text: Spent a fabulous week in the Towers....always superb....from the front desk, concierge, housekeeping....all wonderful.....extraordinarily helpful always!......if you have a chance, visit Rafael in Rarities....a great way to begin an evening...or finish

title: Outstanding Midtown Hotel
text: The Towers are a five start gem in a perfect location: Midtown Madison at 50th. With views of St. Patrick's Cathedral or the East River. Room are well appointed and large. Only drawback is somewhat slow elevator service, but alas worth putting up with.

title: excellent
text: This was a excellent stay.  Nice location and the service and room were wonderful. We were only here for one night but we really enjoyed.  The staff was pleasant and made certain all of our needs were accomodated.

title: A wonderful and memorable visit
text:
We stayed for 5 nights as a family of four in the Lotte Palace in a Luxury Tower Room with two Queen Beds.  This was a special occasion trip to mark a 25th wedding anniversary, a 21st birthday and an 18th birthday. 

Booked directly with the hotel via their website.  

Shortly before the trip we received an introductory email from the guest services team introducing the hotel and its services.  We used them to book a private transfer both from and to JFK and also to book a number of restaurants for meals.  A particular mention has to go to Diego on the concierge team who provided a number of recommendations and then booked everything for us.

On arrival the check in was swift as the Towers check in is separate from the main Palace and we were taken to our room on the 50th floor.  On entering the room 5005 the view across the east of Manhattan was breath taking.  Room was fully equipped as you would expect for a 5 star hotel, clean and spacious.

On all but one morning we ate breakfast in the Villard Restaurant and the breakfasts were great.  One slight issue was the warmth of the food on one morning, which was due to the stone cold plates it was served on.  It is clear the restaurant is used for many early morning business meetings and the pace is fast with lots of energy.  The American breakfast option was good, but also tried the pancakes and the Eggs Benedict.

We only used the hotel as a base to get a good breakfast at the start of the day and then return in the evening.  We used the Gold bar once for a couple of cocktails and that we very relaxing.

All the restaurants Diego recommended were within walking distance and all were great.  Each with different character just as we had requested.

The hotel is located conveniently for the subway on 51st street/Lexington and from there we could get anywhere we wanted to on our visit.

Value wise, yes it was expensive, but this was a special trip and the hotel acknowledged this with an unexpected bottle of champagne and cake when we returned to our room one evening.  But overall, what really made it special was the staff.  Everyone was friendly and helpful and seemed genuinely interested in what you had been doing or were going to do.  Even the porter who offered to take a photo of us outside with my daughters camera, only to find he had taken a cheeky selfie of himself as well when he handed the camera back.

All memories and you can’t put a price on that.  So thank you to the Lotte Palace team.

We hope to return one day.

title: Hard Mattress
text: Wife told Check-In Clerk she needed a soft mattress due to an orthopedic problem. "All our mattresses are soft" said the Clerk. Ours wasn't. So a toss-and-turn night. What the Clerk had neglected to tell us was that the Towers had had soft mattress overlays available for customers who requested them, the Towers informed us the next morning. No offer of an adjustment off the hefty price per night.

title: A pretty and historic building, great view
text: The staff were courteous and the room was very pretty with a great view. The bed, extremely comfortable! Concierge provided wonderful restaurant suggestions.  We stayed for three days and have no complaints. The location was great for walking places as well. It would be nice to have had the cocktail bar open on weekends instead of just weekdays but I'm sure there is a reason for that--not enough demand maybe? The food (breakfast/ brunch) was out of this world!

title: Always fabulous
text: The Towers never disappoint.   The service, cleanliness and hospitality is always top notch.  We have stayed here probably two dozen times in the past 5 years and this remains our favorite NYC property.  It is a bit pricey but well worth the views of Manhattan, the great room service and exceptional attitude of all service staff.

title: A Wonderful Stay!!
text: Our room was spotless and very comfortable.  The view from the 46th floor was amazing!!  Employees were very helpful and polite.  The concierge recommended a restaurant which was a gem.  Our stay at Lotte Palace was relaxing and fun.

title: Home away from home
text: Ive stayed at Lotte before and I always come back when in NYC. The facility is well located, the rooms are spacious, and the staff is very helpful. Whether I stay in a single room or a 2B/R corner suite the Lotte is my first choice in hotels and is my NYC home away from home.

title: Reservation hangup
text: Don’t go during the week of meetings st the UN! We had to drag our luggage a cross the street to get to the front door, could only enter and exit certain doors which changed throughout the stay. It took 30 minutes and much consultation for the check in receptionist to find our reservation while we sat in the small Towers lobby.

title: A beautiful property
text: My wife and I spent 3 nights at The Towers recently.  It was our first stay but will definitely not be our last. The Towers is a hotel within a hotel at the New York Palace with its own reception and concierge and rooms on the top 20 or so floors of the hotel. We stayed in a regular room and it was very large and well appointed, with a view of St. Patricks Cathedral. The furniture was very good quality and the bedding some of the best we have experienced. Yes, it was a splurge (anniversary celebration) but we will certainly return.

title: Never Disappoints
text: Amazing hotel that keeps us coming back. I think we love it so much is the service. Any hotel can provide a clean room and a bed. But great hotels put the focus on the details. To me the Palace does this the best. This stay on business with my wife the front desk agent was kind enough to upgrade us to a Junior Suite in the towers as they had low inventory. Daniel was so nice about it and made me felt like I was truly valued for being a frequent guest. Will be back again!!!!

title: Amazing Event
text: I do events at hotels around the country and this venue surpassed my expectations. What made it really special was our catering manager Rachel Wolf who worked closely to have everything organized. However, our guests and my expectations could not have been met and 1,000 % surpassed without the amazing effort and professionalism of Steve Kunz, Senior Banquet Manager Whether you stay, eat or have an event here, its our new to go to destination in NY.Thanks Steve!!

title: Great place to stay!
text: What a beautiful property! It was so convenient. It rained one day of our 5 day trip and the staff were so kind to provide umbrellas. This hotel is top notch in every way. My wife and I were very interested in Rarities (their very nice bar area) but were travelling with kids and couldn't make that work. When we checked in the lady paid extra attention to my kids and gave them both a stuffed bear. They will not forget this hotel any time soon. The view of St. Patrick's and the city was beautiful.

title: A Hidden Gem in NYC
text: The Towers is truly a hidden gem within NYC. Stepping into the lobby, you immediately feel relaxed, welcomed, and at home- a rarity when traveling. Staying in The Towers was the highlight of our trip.

title: Best Hotel in NYC
text: Stayed a night in NYC on business and wow what a beautiful hotel. The entrance is grand and the decor is very bright. The rooms are very spacious. But have to say a special thank you to the front desk agent Daniel. He was such a polite and friendly young man. He was able to get me an upgraded room into the towers. So spacious. Such beautiful room. Will definitely be back for the next business outing.

title: Pamper yourself in New York
text: The room was very comfortable with an outstanding view.  All the employees in the hotel were friendly and helpful.  This place is a classic with all the architecture details that you will not find in today's modern hotels.  The furnishings in our room were well appointed and comfortable.  The hotel location is near an underground station and within walking distance of shopping and Times Square.  They also provide a theater district shuttle on the hour.  It was raining so the driver took us right up to the front door.  A great service.

title: A Lovely Experience In An Incredible Place
text: The Gold Room inside of the Lotte NY Palace was an amazing experience. Dropped in for a quick drink to celebrate my girlfriend's birthday and received an incredible experience. From the get go we were greeted by the in room dining manager Natassja in the hotel lobby who very warmly acknowledged us. We were a little lost but Natassja kindly walked us over to the bar. From here our waiter Hector took our order and provided some great drink recommendations. His service was impeccable as he was friendly, funny and courteous. After enjoying a quick bite (sliders and truffle fries that were amazing) we were surprised by the chef Allison who brought my girlfriend a small birthday cake and some delicious churros as a nice surprise. This made my girlfriend's night, thank you Allison! What was going to be a quick drink, turned into an unforgettable experience! I could never thank Natassja, Hector and Allison enough! Would 100% recommend, and will be back soon!

title: Nice place to stay, but..
text: The hotel lobby and restaurant were excellent. Service very good. However the room was very noisy. The bed was not very comfortable. My wife ended up with a killing back pain. Regarding the noise in the room engineering told us that it was related to utilities that were located in the floor below us and that there was not much that they could do.

title: Best Hotel in New York
text:
My husband and I love the Lotte Palace.
We always stay in the towers.
The rooms are bright, spacious and well appointed.
It's location is also our favorite.
The service of their long standing employees can not be beat. 
They are superb at what they do and make you feel totally at home.
We strongly recommend this hotel!

title: Great location and service
text: Had a lovely stay with our 5 year old for a long weekend.  The hotel is close to Times Square and the American Girl Doll store.  Also, an easy walk to Central Park.  Our one bedroom suite was nice and had a wonderful view.  I do wish that they had more dining options at the hotel.

title: Love this hotel!
text: I stay here every time I come to NYC!  The staff is so accommodating...they go out of their way to help you with anything you need. The rooms are great too. Such a beautiful old world hotel. I’ve stayed at other hotels but always come back to the Palace!

title: Towers is doing Great
text: No flaws.  Room Service came when they said they would.  I ordered exactly what I wanted and all food and drink was accurately delivered.  Room was clean, as always.  Front Desk is excellent and a pleasure to communicate with.  All doormen were friendly and excellent.  Bags delivered quickly to the room.  Wifi was without errors or downtime.

title: Great Stay in the Towers
text: The hotel is in a great location--close to shows, shopping, etc. but without all of crowds closer to Times Square.  The rooms are nice, including the cathedral views, and housekeeping did an excellent job.  Did not dine in the hotel, but had a nice drink in the Gold Room.

title: very bad service
text: TV's in both room problem with reception, always run out of bathroom products, bill at the end of stay was incorrect, we were over charged by 600 dollars, which we had to fight are case in reception for half an hour

title: Great Location for a Quick NYC getaway
text:
This was our first stay at the Palace and we were not disappointed.  The friendliness of the staff and the ir attention to every detail during our stay was amazing.
We will definitely stay there again when we next visit the Apple

title: Fabulous !!!!!
text: We went to the Towers at the New York Palace to spend our 30th Wedding Anniversary in June...and it was absolutely fabulous ! Stayed here for 5 nights....and from the minute we checked in...with Champagne at reception...to the minute we check out, we were extremely well looked after by Yohenny, the Towers Guest Service Agent.....who ensured our stay was more than perfect and listened to our every need. Such a pleasant lady who is so good at her job. Each day she would greet us at reception and has such a skill for remembering her guests and what they were doing  that day. Samir...on concierge was also wonderful...and ensured all our wishes were met during our stay....and he added those extra touches for us during this special time....I am extremely grateful to you both...and thank you for being so good at what you do....making each guest feel special is truly a gift. Our one bedroom suite overlooked St Patricks Cathedral and waking up to this view each morning was amazing....the electronic blinds which you could use from the bed was an added touch. The size of this suite was very spacious with separate bath tub and shower and I can not praise this enough. The hotel itself is lovely and the Gold Room  to have drinks is truly luxurious. Not eh cheapest hotel in New York....but certainly my recommendation for that special stay...and so much that we will be back. Can highly recommend for those who want top end luxury.

title: Wonderful staff and nice room - Loved Clara!
text:
Nice room and staff so nice and helpful  Especially Clara at the Towers.  She guided us to great restaurants and helped us get around everyday.
Room clean and the best view of NYC.  

Looking forward to coming back

title: Jimm Kalinka at the Lotte NY Palace
text: As always,I had a wonderful, luxurious stay at the Lotte NY Palace!  It is simply the best place to stay in NYC!  Great accommodations and an incredibly helpful staff see to your every need!  And Jimm Kalinka at the Towers desk went above and beyond as always. If we needed anything at all he made sure it got done and fast and with the utmost professionalism! Simply the best service and accommodations in town!  Highly recommend!!

title: Lotte New York Palace Hotel
text: We enjoyed another visit to the Lotte New York Palace Hotel for our annual Corporate Event. The Hotel property, Towers Suite and Staff are best in Class. We previously held the Event at the Waldorf-Astoria Hotel until it's closing and have found the Lotte New York Palace an even better replacement. The entire Staff is excellent including Tracy-Ann Hamilton, their Sales & Marketing Operations Manager, who manages preparations for the Event & our visit with perfection. No better place in NYC for Special Events or a comfortable stay.

title: Location and luxury are a nice mix
text:
The Palace lives up to it´s clippings and the reviews here on TA. A few notes of interest

1.	We booked under Amex Fine Resorts. Best way to go. Room upgrade, free breakfast, late checkout. 

2.	The bellmen and valets are seasoned vets, best of the best. They actually take time to spin the revolving door for you. 

3.	Rooms are outstanding. Hot/cold shower nozzle that is colored from shade of blue up to shade of dark red as you turn. Brilliant. Faucets, furniture, fixtures, touchscreens all high-end luxury. 

4.	Elevators are small and take a bit of time to get you up to the higher floors. No big deal. 

5.	Fitness center is excellent. Like a real gym. 

6.	Ordered hot water for my tea from room service. It came quick, with nice container and for NO charge. 

7.	One block from the middle of 5th Avenue, Rockefeller Center and Radio City Music Hall. 

8.	Restaurant, bar and lounge, elegant and staffed by adults.

title: Great Place To STay
text: I was booked at the Lotte New York Palace two years in a row to work at the US open. The rooms  are incredibly comfortable and the service and hospitality is amazing. I'm not sure I would book this on my own due to the price but I would definitely recommend some one to stay.

title: Very Comforrable
text:
I am coming here with friends during the weekend and i could that 100% satisfied with everything which so memorable.
The lady in reception is so nice but feel sorry bc i cant remember you name
Thanks guys your kindness and so helpful to us
Hope to back here soon.

title: Great visit!!
text: The staff was extremely responsive, professional and friendly. The accommodations were superb and the location was convenient to all of my meetings in Midtown. The lobby provided a fantastic setting to meet associates. The access to 5th Avenue, St Patrick’s and Central Park was a real plus.

title: City Gem
text: Great location, staff was attentive, professional, and very accommodating. The hotel is a fantastic venue that I would say rivals The Palace.  The in room dining, especially breakfast was magnificent. The room was spacious and clean. Access to downtown Manhattan was a breeze.  I would definitely stay here again without hesitation.

title: Excellent Service in a Crunch!
text: As a regular customer of my favorite New York hotel, the Lotte, I was distressed to learn that the hotel was sold out and that I would not be able to extend my stay when unexpected business demands forced me to change my travel plans.  Fortunately, that is where Brent and Jimm came to my rescue and secured an additional night for me even though the Lotte was sold out!  I can't thank them enough for their assistance, this is precisely why the Lotte is always my preferred destination on my many business trips to New York, thanks again guys!

title: Home!
text: What an amazing hotel! Starting with the tasteful interior, the bright ans spacious rooms and the great service, there is literally nothing to complain about! Being from NY, it is nice to see we can deliver and whilst a pit on the pricy side, worth every penny! Well done!

title: Absolutely Fabulous
text: I never get to travel for work, so I was thrilled to go to New York to help with a Conference.  Then I saw my room at the Palace.  Then I opened the shades and saw the night view.  Spectacular!!!  And then room service since I arrived late - thank you for the rose with my meal!

title: What amazing service!
text: The hotel is simply beautiful. It was so tough getting our luggage in from several street away as our transport couldn’t get close due to security clearances. You would think the president is staying. I was so flustered until I got to the front desk. Daniel was such a sweet young man. He explained everything so thoroughly and in such a calm manner that helped me feel better about the stressful experience. He explained everything regarding our cruise information and was just so kind and pleasant. He upgraded me to such a gorgeous room in the towers. I am so grateful. I just wanted a drink so he was kind enough to give me his business card that I could use for a glass of wine at the bar. Such a great front desk agent. You can tell he loves what he does. Hopefully we will be back next year at a different time of year though.

title: The best hotel in NYC
text: Everything was first class when we stayed at the Lotte New York Palace. We've never been so spoiled! Diego, the concierge, gave us great recommendations. We got broadway tickets and went to a great restaurants (Ardyn/Nerai). They had the best bed/sheets and turn down service. We will now only stay at this hotel.

title: Could be much better. A shame.
text: Decent size room. Bathroom was filthy with hair in the sink and used toilet paper in the bowl on arrival. It’s a good location and pleasant atmosphere but room can be tired and bathrooms not clean enough

title: Lotte Palace Towers is truly “Special” !
text: The Towers at the Lotte Palace hotel in NYC is one of the best, if not the best hotel in NYC, especially if your preference is mid-town Manhattan.  The rooms are quite large for NYC with great views on each side. The people at the registration desk are both very professional and always warm and friendly !   FIRST CLASS all the way !

title: Fantastic! Can't wait to return.
text: This was my first visit to the Lotte New York Palace. I could not have been happier.  Everything about this hotel was fabulous. The rooms were bright and inviting with great views, but more importantly, the staff was outstanding.  Every one went out of their way to make our stay memorable.

title: So utterly recommend to all to stay at this very fine NYC establishment
text: For me and my family, that is teenage daughter and wife, The Towers at Lotte New York Palace is the only hotel of choice we would stay at in NYC. Having so enjoyed our various times staying at this truly cossetingly comfortable {Tower rooms are large, beds you just want to keep lying in, Molton Brown toiletries}; so welcomely friendly {all the folks at the entrances, front desk, concierge, with special mention to Clara, Susan, Kai, The two Georges, they all really do know how to look after you}; idealy located luxury hotel {5 minutes walk to Rockefella Center, 10 minutes to Times Sq., next door to Saks 5th Av., 10 minutes to Ess-Bagel}. We certainly look forward to our next stay at this excellently splendid hotel when visiting the multi cultural metrolpolis, sprawling unique city that is New York. And the folks behind the bar definitely knows how to make a mean dry Vodka Martini with a twist! What’s not to like then!!!

title: Beautiful Hotel
text: Spent the weekend in NYC with friends and stayed in the Towers.  The checkin process was easy and our room was ready before the regular check in.  Lovely hotel and very friendly staff.  The rooms are spacious by NYC standards.  The Villard restaurant is a must for Sunday brunch.  Overall had a wonderful time and would stay here again.

title: Excellent
text:
Very luxuries reasonably priced in very good location. Room are spacious and comfortable.
I would advise to pay a little extra to stay in Towers where all rooms have been renovated to high standards.we have stayed in this hotel for the last four visits to New York and never been disappointed.

title: TRULY A PALACE
text: When the Waldorf closed I moved to The Lotte Palace Hotel and it is extraordinary The people, the beauty, the history and the perfection everywhere you look. Fantastic Staff who cannot do enough to make your stay memorable,

title: Excellent Hotel
text:
When I travel to New York I always stay at the Lotte New York Palace. Best place in town, near to 5th Avenue, near to Central Park, near to Times Square.
We enjoy this Hotel each time and will come back again that's sure

title: Awesome
text: My hotel stay was more than what I expected it to be. Very clean, comfortable & relaxing. Very update to date & tech savy for a hotel stay. It was better than most hotels I've ever stayed at. Will definitely stay again. Plan to bring my family for 2 nights.

title: Grandson Daniel’s Wedding
text: We loved the way in which Daniel Nelson and all the rest of the staff housekeepers, doormen, receptionists, security took such great care of us and our family. As grandparents, one who has to use a walker, we were made comfortable by everyone who not only took care of us but became our friends. Of course the hotel, the mansion the view were all great.

title: best location
text: Having the hotel just behind St. Patrick's Cathedral and near Rockefeller Center makes this hotel a real gem and the rooms and views are great as well.  Very well run hotel and beautiful restaurant also.

title: Amazingly Fabulous!
text: Daniel Nelson organized our wedding weekend stay at the Lotte with attention to detail allowing our guests to relax and enjoy a world class stay.  The rooms are elegant, beautiful, spacious and have all the modern conveniences!  You can control everything from the comfort of your bedside table!  The service and amenities are beyond compare.  Every request was immediately dealt with by a smiling helpful hotel staff member.  Highly recommend this beautiful hotel!

title: College Drop off
text: We stay at the Lotte every time we come to NY.  It's a special place!!!!   Our daughter has decided to go to college in NYC so it looks like we will be seeing a lot more of you in the future.  Your staff has always done a wonderful job!

title: Excelente hotel
text: Excelente room, very clean and comfortable.The bathroom and shower area were excelent . People who work at the hotel were very kind. Brian was very kind and helpful.The location is also great, as we were able to get to most places walking. Only the wi-fi aren't so good

title: Truly Elegant
text: Beautiful hotel located across from St. Patrick's Cathedral.  Started staying there after the Waldorf closed.  The Tower rooms and service are exceptional.  The main hotel is always bustling and the staff  is friendly and accommodating.  I come 6 or 7 times a year and my favorite time is Christmas.  The tree in the courtyard, the visit from Santa and Mass at St. Patrick's Cathedral are a perfect way for my family to celebrate the holiday.

title: Class Act!
text:
My wife and I have just returned from a 6 night stay at The Towers and can’t say enough good things about this hotel. On arrival we were immediately assisted with our luggage and taken to the separate Towers check in area where we were smoothly and quickly allocated our room. We also spoke to Clara Law, the welcoming Page, who was very sweet and courteous. We mentioned that we were celebrating our 35th wedding anniversary and no sooner had we settled into our room when there was a butler at our door with a bottle of champagne. A few minutes later Clara herself came to the room with some delicious treats from the onsite coffee and pastry shop. We felt totally pampered and it was a fantastic start to our vacation, thank you Clara!!
Our room was large and bright with superb views over St Patrick’s Cathedral and Rockefeller Centre. The bed was so comfortable and the bathroom was immaculate with a large walk in shower.
Whenever returning to the hotel we were always welcomed warmly by the reception staff and Clara who ensured we always had a bottle of water to combat the very hot weather outside. On some occasions there is also a glass of champagne in the reception to provide some nice refreshments.
We would not hesitate to recommend the Towers at Lotte Palace and we would not stay anywhere else on future visits to New York City.

title: Excellent hotel
text: Service was superb and very accommodating.  Very nice room with a great view of the New York skyline.  Great location with wonderful access to all of Manhattan.  Excellent concierge. Bathroom was a drawback because it was a little small, hot water pressure was low, and the lighting, while attractive, was difficult for make-up and shaving.  We were in a Tower room which was pricey but worth it.

title: Incredible Hotel! The Best!
text: First, I have stayed in many New York City hotels. The Lotte Palace is my favorite! Fantastic location and incredible staff!  From the doorman to the front desk and the concierge desk...very professional and helpful in every way. Megan Frost and Anna- Marie Rieber are some of the best people in the industry! Always on their game to make your stay magnificent! Extremely professional, and beyond helpful...I know i am repeating myself , but cant say it enough! Wont stay anywhere else! Feels like Home...

title: The Towers of New York Palace.
text: The New York Palace is a fantastic, iconic hotel located in Midtown East Manhattan.  It is situated across from St. Patrick's Cathedral and very close to Central Park and easy access to the Interstates by taxi/car.  The service and staff are outstanding from every vantage point.  The rooms are extremely large considering the price which is very reasonable.  Concierge and taxi service are  top of the line.  Excellent fitness center as well.

title: Lotte New York Palace!!! More than a dream!
text: Μοναδική εμπειρία! Εξαιρετική θέα από τον 48ο όροφο! Πρωινό που σίγουρα δεν θα ξεχάσεις! Εξυπηρέτηση υποδειγματική! Όλοι οι χώροι του ξενοδοχείου πολύ προσεγμένοι.Το Lotte New York Palace είναι παραπάνω από ένα όνειρο!!!

title: Never better at Lotte Palace
text: I've stayed several times at Lotte Palace, in both the standard hotel rooms and the Towers rooms. The Towers provides a very concierge experience, with separate check in and a dedicated staff to help with dinner, shows, etc. However all rooms are large and very well appointed. The restaurant is just wonderful - especially for brunch. You can't find a better, more centrally located hotel and one with a long history of elegance and luxury!

title: US Open 2019
text: Lotte is an elegant property, and the Towers are the best! Service was prompt, friendly and courteous. Loved the breakfasts on property.  Mid Town location is perfect for doing anything in NYC. Really nothing we didn't like and it is our hotel of choice in NYC.

title: Great Hotel
text: Lotte Palace is centrally located for exploring NYC, Service is excellent and staff super helpful. We have stayed there many times and really enjoy the surrounds. You can walk to Central Park, take a subway to lower Manhattan, etc.

title: ACHTUNG, kein Luxus Hotel!
text: Zimmer eher wie in einem 3 Sterne Hotel. Mussten erst Stunden warten, haben das Zimmer nicht akzeptiert und wollten es zurück geben. Das war überhaupt kein Problem, obwohl es schon bezahlt war. Offensichtlich muss dies öfters passieren. Sind dann ins Sofitel, welches exakt gleich viel gekostet hat und dann wirklich ein schönes Hotel mit entsprechendem Standard ist.

title: Amazing stay at The Towers!
text: My 2 boys and I had a brilliant time staying at the Towers! It is in the perfect location to get to anywhere in New York and it is a brilliant hotel. We had the holiday of a lifetime and will be coming back soon!

title: Fantastic!
text: We celebrated our sons 10th birthday and were blown away by the gracious hospitality of the Towers staff. Everyone went out of their way to celebrate the occasion. The location and views were amazing!

title: Palace Extraordinary
text: What a room and great view we had of St. Patrick's.  Location spectacular for all the activities we had planned. Staff incredibly helpful, especially Carla. Amenities like workout and restaurants/bars fantastic. Amazing architecture throughout. Street staff friendly, but not pushy.

title: AMAZING
text:
This is the place to be if you want to have the BEST experience in NYC. I've been to the city several times, but I stayed in this hotel last year for the US Open and, let me tell you, I will never stay in an other hotel again. 

The room service was amazing, there are so many little details that make all the difference with any other hotel. The service of everyone that works there is fantastic. I try the food and coffe frome the Pomme Palais. It's great. 

I'll be staying here next week for the US Open and I can't wait, this time I'll try the Gold Room and will have an update for you.

title: The Towers NY Palace
text:
I highly recommend this Hotel. It is excellent.  
The perfect place to enjoy NY city
The best relationship between price and value.
Concierge services are premium. You can obtain the best recommendations to enjoy the Big Apple

title: Book it Now - Perfect
text: If you are considering staying here go for it! Great hotel, great staff, and perfect location! We were upgraded to the Towers and it was phenomenal. Rooms are clean and very large. Ordered room service and it was there very quickly. The courtyard is the perfect place to get a cocktail and enjoy the ambience. Also walkable to restaurants, shopping, and central park. Lotte NY Palace does all the little things well.

title: Business Perfect
text: A repeat customer for almost 20 years. A nice welcoming upgrade to the Towers on arrival which have been updated both in comfort and tech. Many long term faces of recognition is always a quality of service to expect with the staff. See you soon.

title: Amazing Hotel
text: The Towers at Lotte Outstanding service! Amenities! and Service! I can't say enough about this hotel. From the excellent service when you pull up and the doormen take the stress of arrival and guide you along. Parking and unloading are very smooth. Check in is very easy with two different areas to check in. Our room was not ready for about 30 minutes so we were able to enjoy a cocktail in one of there many beautiful lounges. Each lounge had a totally different atmosphere. Our rooms were wonderful with very upscale amenities from the soap to fine linens.  The hotel was at capacity due to the US Open but it never affected the outstanding service we received. We had room service for breakfast each day and it was always on time, hot and delicious! The location is outstanding!! Right next to St Patrick's Cathedral. A very short walk to Radio city and a 10 minute walk the theatre district. This is a gorgeous glamorous hotel with warmth. It doesn't get any better than that!

title: Much more than expected
text: Having stayed in other hotels in NYC, I expected to be in a cramped small room.  Upon arriving early, they told us that the room will be ready at a certain time.  We checked our bags and enjoyed the sites nearby in Times Square.  When we returned at the time the room wasn't ready.  We understood and accepted but to have received $200 credit for incidentals was definitely going above and beyond.  Once we got the keys and opened the door to the suite, we were blown away!  We thought is this for real?!  The suite was humongous and the view was amazing!  Our stay at Lotte New York Palace was an experience we won't forget.  Up to the last day and hour of our stay where we dined for breakfast inside the hotel to use up our credits.  It must have been the best breakfast I ever had!  Even simple things were done to perfection.  I definitely recommend this place!

title: Great, friendly service, great location
text: The staff was especially kind and friendly to my granddaughter. The breakfast was excellent. We stayed on the 52nd floor and loved the view.The hotel is an easy walking distance from many of the New York sights.

title: Excellent Concierge Service!
text: My stay at the Towers started with an incredible experience checking in. Rebecca was super helpful and accommodating. She informed me of all of the aspects of the hotel that I should check out such as the courtyard and whiskey lounge. The stay itself was also phenomenal. The views of NYC were great and the hotel room was impressive. I will definitely be coming back to the Lotte for my next trip.

title: Spectacular hotel
text: I stayed in the Towers, got a room upgrade, and the place was flawless.  The owners really know how to keep the Palace perfect.  Friendly front desk, decor is so old school with a flair.  I midtown is where you need to be this is the perfect location.  Great sunlight in the room with such large expansive windows.

title: The best hotel
text: The best hotel I ever stayed at. The service was impeccable and they treated me and my family so wonderful. The best experience I have had at a hotel in New York. We have told all our friends and family about our experience there.

title: Exceptional hotel
text: I am admittedly a “travel snob” who always seek out the best accommodations. Lotte Towers delivered. I visited this weekend with my husband and 2 young kids and we were treated like royalty. Upon arrival we received a complimentary upgrade to one of the most gorgeous rooms we have ever seen. The staff was so friendly and on top of everything. No complaints here. We would highly recommend!

title: Great Hotel in New York
text: Hotel location is great and  all the staff are extremely helpful and accomodating. This is our prefered hotel to stay in when we visit New York. The rooms in the Towers are up to date and very comfortable.

title: Excellent hôtel bien situé
text:
Excellent hôtel, notre chambre au 51 étage avait une vue sur tous les buildings de New York et même une vue sur la hudson river. Chambre bien équipée, literie confortable, salle de bain complète, ligne de soin molton brown 
Manque juste une cafetière nespresso ou autre dans la chambre

title: great hotel and location
text: just stayed three nights at the towers at Lotte New York Palace . the front desk people were great especially Kal Naim .the hotel was clean and fresh. Our room was large and comfortable , the bathroom was a little on the small side for us, water pressure could be a little better . Great experience would definitely stay again.

title: Excellent, Friendly Service
text: The Towers staff was extremely helpful in making our stay as comfortable as possible. Our room was not completely ready for our party of three when we arrived (missing some toiletries). However, the moment it was mentioned, the staff enthusiastically took care to accommodate our needs quickly. Clara Law was especially warm-hearted and willing to help whenever we had any need regarding the hotel and the city. She is definitely one of the hotel’s star employees! The room itself is as spacious as described and shown on the website (surprising for New York!), which justified the price they charged. The housekeeping lady, Xing, always showed up with a smile on her face and a cheerful attitude, greeting us when we left our room. Her presence helped start each day off on such a positive note during our entire trip. She did an excellent job in keeping our room orderly and clean. Even with the higher price point, we would definitely consider coming back to The Towers again in the near future!

title: Refreshed and Re
text: Staff, especially Gladys, Ani, Kal, Melody & Somi, went over & above their jobs to ensure our stay was outstanding. We were upgraded to a breathtaking suite equipped with every amenity possible. Book it today! You won't be disappointed.

title: Clara Law
text: Clara always seems to have time for the individual needs of the guest.  Whether it's waiting with water upon my arrival, a glass of champagne or delivering a vase to the room for my flowers, Clara gives service with a smile and an "It's my pleasure" attitude!

title: Top-Notch Hotel, Amazing Service and Views
text:
I stayed at the New York Palace to attend a family wedding on the weekend of August 3, and I could not have asked for better accommodations, service, and overall experience. We loved our suite on the 32nd floor, which was the epitome of clean, spacious, and luxurious. The views of the Avenue and the cathedral were breathtaking, and it was a perfect place for the wedding party to gather before the ceremony to relax and get ready.

The best part about the New York Palace is the wonderful staff and service, who really made a difference in facilitating the hectic wedding weekend. Sandy and Dalmasi at the front desk were extremely helpful in helping my friends get a room upgrade to accommodate their family and small children. Some of the other front desk staff that made our weekend that much more enjoyable were Michael, Danielle, Paul, and Annamarie. 

I also want to acknowledge some of the other amazing staff at the New York Palace that made this stay so easy and enjoyable for all our family and wedding guests: John A, Soren, Omar, Henry, and Tom A from the Bellmen staff, and the doormen Clara, Louis, and Ray. 

Thank you, New York Palace, for making this special day possible. The quality of the staff and service here is what truly sets it apart from other hotels in NYC. I can't wait to stay here again.

title: Great service, perfect location
text: Beautiful courtyard to sit and relax and a great area to walk in.  Next to St Patrick’s Cathedral and close to Times Square. Service was excellent.  Everyone was very helpful and accommodating.Would go back in a heartbeat.

title: Nice experience
text: Stayed in the Lotte hotel (the Towers) for over two weeks, so we got to know about the hotel quite well. The last time we were in Manhattan we stayed at St Regis but I think Lotte is much better. The view of the cathedral was the best part. You can view the whole of the cathedral from the top. I had my coffee with this grand view every morning. The hotel housekeeping kept coming at odd hours but the concierge lady, Clara Law, made up for any shortcoming. She is very helpful. You can find her at the inside reception. Just let her know if you have any delivery or if you need something. She mostly knows about everything. My family was especially fond of Benjamin too. There is nothing he can’t provide you in terms of food. He was quite inventive at times and we loved it.

title: Best girls weekend!!
text: Myself and 5 GF’s; had not been to NYC for a girl’s w/e in over 6 yrs 🙄 Suite was spectacular; service even better! Cannot sing enough praises!! Will be back to this property the next time I am in Manhattan for business or pleasure!!

title: Beautiful View
text: I stayed on the 42nd of the Towers and had a breathtaking view at night.  The room was comfortable and the amenities were lovely.  My only negative was that since everything was automated (lights, shades, etc.), when I turned off the lights I turned off power for nearly all the outlets  Thus, I couldn't plug in my phone near my bed and had to move my computer to an outlet on the wall away from the desk.  I'm just glad I noticed before going to bed! Otherwise, it was a gorgeous facility and I would definitely recommend it.

title: Excellent location and service
text: This is an excellent hotel just one block from fifth Avenue. Great service, one day there was some construction noise over my room at 7 am , I called the front desk and they stopped. Everything else was great

title: Family vacation
text: Very well situated, walking distance to everywhere! We travelled with kids and we enjoyed the closeness to Rockefeller Center and Times Square. We would have liked a buffet for brunch on sunday but the food is pretty good.

title: I wouldn’t stay at any other hotel in NYC
text:
I want to particularly thank STEPHANIE SANSIVERI for taking care of us very efficiently and amiably. She’s terrific!

Thank You also to SUSAN and PETER at The Evening Reception Area. They couldn’t be more accommodating and gracious.

Thank You, also, to BRIAN McINERNEY, who waited with me until my Luggage was taken care of. ( Bellman at The Palace for 36 years )

Thank You to LOUIS TORRES for being one of the most congenial and helpful doorman who I ever encountered.

My stay was for 2 weeks with my children and grandchildren. For us the location is A+- We had a ball!

title: Excellent service and perfect location
text:
I cannot say enough amazing things about The Towers at Lotte New York Palace.  Stayed in the Towers for 2 nights. The service is impeccable, two particular employees in the Towers Reception area are extraordinary, Anne Marie and Clara, both personable, super helpful, diligent with some special requests and followed up with status until completed, can't wait to go back hoping to be greeted by them again. In fact all of the employees in the entire hotel were amazing, always friendly, met us with smiles.  
The rooms were beautiful, had a gorgeous view of St. Patrick's Cathedral, and very close to the best shopping New York has to offer.
If you want to treat yourself to the best of everything, you really need to stay at the The Towers.

title: WONDERFUL stay at the New York Palace again!
text: I had 2 rooms - one in the Palace for my daughter and her friends, and a room in the Towers. It was a wonderful trip. My birthday was over the 4 nights we stayed and I was treated like a queen. When we arrived, I was upgraded to a corner suite which really made our entire trip! I love the New York Palace and the Towers and I will be staying with you again next year!

title: Great stay
text: What a fantastic hotel. Cleanliness was exceptional and general appearance is fantastic. We had booked a family room for our stay but on arrival they were fully occupied, without any hesitation we received a complimentary room upgrade the staff were all very polite and helpful. We didn't really use the restaurant so can't comment on the food.

title: Really disappointing
text:
I had high expectations that we’d be splurging for ease and luxury. I was wrong. Between construction noise, the worst ‘suite’ layout, and a terrible check out experience, I’m disappointed. Read for more detail, but if you’re looking for best in class experience, look elsewhere.

My family and I booked a suite at the Towers for my sister’s wedding. It came with a big price tag, even with her room block rate, but I was willing to pay for convenience. 

We arrived before check in time with a sleeping baby and a tired toddler. The first thing the desk person told me curtly was ‘nothing’s ready’. Okay, I understand. My parents were already checked in, so we went up to let the kids nap in their room, but when we got up to the room, there was INSANELY LOUD construction, the baby woke up and toddler couldn’t sleep.

An hour or so later, we were told our room was ready. When we went up to our room on a different floor, still with the construction noise, it was not at all what we booked. It had the silliest layout. I was told by the booking agent at the time of booking that I had an executive suite with two queen beds. I was told that it had a sliding door divider between the bedroom and a sitting area- as the ‘executive’ suites have on their website. I had a whole conversation with the booking agent going through the options of adjoining rooms or suites that would allow us to have a sitter in one room and sleeping toddlers in another. We even had a full discussion about how she didn’t think that the crib wouldn’t fit in the side with the beds, which I was fine with. 

Instead, we arrived to a long open room, with no divider and two queen beds at one end, which wouldn’t work for the childcare I had set up. 

I ended up speaking to a manager who told me that he wouldn’t really even consider the room we had a suite. Yeah, me neither!!! And I’m playing a ridiculous amount for it- It was no where in the same neighborhood of niceness as my parent’s room with the same rate. 

Apparently, I booked a room class that doesn’t exist. Or there are only two of them that fit that description at the hotel. The story kept changing. I’m considering contesting a portion of the charge with my credit card- They should have this room type listed on their website - avoid the executive studio suites!!!

The manager told us that they had no other rooms that were either adjoining rooms or real suites. I would’ve been fine with an executive suite with one king bed, because the divider is really what we needed, and it is hard to believe that those were checked in full, because I should've been among the first to check in.

We ended up putting a cot and a crib in the walk in closet. They gave us a hotel credit as an inconvenience fee, but I paid $$$$ for my kids to sleep in a closet.

I asked to see if we could switch rooms the next day, but no one ever followed up with me. 

Then, on our final day, my sister hosted her day after brunch at the hotel. I asked for an extension on the room in the morning and they gave us until 1 which was great. At 1 we were all packed up, but my kids were still napping, and our car was arriving at 2, so I called the front desk to see if we could have a bit more time. An agent named Nancy said no, that she couldn't extend it any longer, and I kindly told her that I understood and we’d leave the room. I wanted to be respectful, so didn’t call up for a bellman- we just put the kids in the stroller and left.

As we were walking out, a housekeeping manager was coming to kick us out. It just seemed super off-putting for him to be hurrying us out when we had the room extended. I know everyone has a job to do, but I would’ve much preferred a phone call than an in-person confrontation over literally 5 minutes, especially when I had just spoken with the desk staff. I actually don’t mind being rushed, it was the way it was being done just rubbed us the wrong way.... We all know you still have hours before someone else is promised the availability of this room. 

Aside from the room, over the course of the weekend, we really enjoyed the downstairs coffee shop as well as the food and service at the wedding events. The bellman, Raymond was kind to us and our kids. Room service is pretty slow and super overpriced, but it is NYC. One plus was that the view from the room was incredible. 

My recommendation: stay at the Waldorf or the Four Seasons.

title: Good Location
text: As our first trip to New York and we were excited to be staying at the Towers at Lotte New York Palace. Check in was ok, however our room we were staying was disappointing. The blinds in the room were broken and there was a large patch of water in the middle of the floor. House-keeping dealt with the matter the following day, as this could not be dealt with on the day we checked in. Initial impressions were disappointing, as having stayed at other 5 star hotels, I was expecting more from an established hotel. In addition to this, I would say at times customer service at the reception desk was lacking. Breakfast at Villard Restaurant was lovely. Staff were very attentive and engaging, service was very good. We were located on the 53rd floor which had a good view, however I would have preferred a view over seeing the Cathedral, which is located on the other side of the 53rd floor. Location is good, but initial check-in could have been better. Check-out was no better as we were charged twice for our 4 night stay.

title: Had an amazing time
text:
The rooms and bed are extremely comfortable.  I tend to judge how well a stay will be is by the bath towels.  The Palace has probably the best towels in all of New York.  

The staff here is amazing. Need to give personal thanks to the people that took care of us during our time.  Dalmasi, Sandy, Michael, AnnaMarie.  These front desk staff took care of my family during check in and check out.  We arrived early and they tried to accommodate us, as they were fully sold out the night before. 

Clara and Samir from the towers made sure we had a greatstay and, Tom A, and Henry took care of our bags.  And Ray at the door always greeted us with a smile.  

Can't wait to stay here again

title: Lo tiene todo
text:
El New York Palace es un hotel muy grande que al inicio parece impersonal, pero su sección de The Towers es diferente. Tiene su propio lobby con atención muy personalizada. Los cuartos son realmente amplios (para la media de NY). La atención es excelente (recibo de correspondencia, room service, concierge).  El único contra: el gimnasio que está ubicado en el área del hotel principal y cómo está en remodelación no se puede acceder desde el ascensor de the towers. En el gimnasio solo hay una bicicleta de pelotón (bicicleta con clases de spinning virtuales) y es muy solicitada.
El precio es alto pero hay una excelente relación calidad precio.

title: Lotte New York Palace best place in Midtown NYC
text: This is our third Summer vacation in NYC and the Towers at the Palace once again was a fabulous experience. The customer service is impeccable and corner suites are perfect for families.  This is our go to place in NYC.  Customer Service is phenomenal at the Towers. Clara Law and Susan at the front desk always create an incredible experience for us each year.  Great job

title: The best reception staff (page - Clara Law) in town
text: I stayed in the hotel with my family of five for a whole month and the hotel staff was very kind. One person who went out of the way to make our stay comfortable was Clara Law at the reception. When she saw me carrying many bags after a whole day of shopping, she helped me carry my stuff to the suite when i was only expecting a sympathetic smile. She is quite knowledgeable and helpful.

title: Great Hotel, Better Service
text:
I've stayed at the hotel twice for extended periods (so take this as two reviews!!!).

Historical hotel in a great location for corporates and tourists alike. Stephanie STansiveri was of great help and provided great insight into all things the city has to offer - be sure to request a chat with her on your arrival!!!

title: Wonderful Staff
text: My husband and I recently got married in New York and had our room block at the Lotte. I worked closely with Dan Nelson & Mercy Lopez. They were absolutely delightful to work with and I cannot speak more highly of them. Dan and Mercy went above and beyond in making sure all of our needs were accommodated. Both were very responsive which made wedding planning a bit more bearable :) They helped me with coordinating the bridal suite, photos, last minute reservations and upgrades. All of our guests were very pleased with the hotel and the staff. Cathedral view rooms at the hotel were a huge plus! Our experience with the Lotte has been our best experience with any hotel we have ever stayed at.

title: Tower treatment review
text:
Anna-Marie Rieber - Tower Guest Service Agent.  

She knows me by my first name since my very first visit.  She even remembers conversations we have and asks me about my nephew and and my dog showing she is both a good listener and cares about making me feel special and welcome. 
Recently I was in a jam because my flight home was cancelled at 5pm.  I called her directly in a panic.  Her response was, “ I’m not in the office right now but of course I’ll take care of this. It’s my pleasure.  You are always in good hands”.  Within 5 minutes the Lotte called with my new reservation.  I am so grateful for her.  Anna-Marie Rieber is a wonderful person and service provider all others should aspire to emulate. She is an important reason our business will continue to bring our travelers to the Lotte New York Palace Towers.  Thank You.

Abbie

title: Great hospitality by Rebecca Villasenor!
text:
Amazing staff! Starting with Rebecca, she is very welcoming, professional and always goes out of her way to make guests feel extra special! same with Ned (concierge) always very helpful and courteous!
We are always looking forward to returning to get treated extra special!
Thank you Rebecca & Ned!!!

title: We appreciate the service of Mrs. Clara Law.
text:
We do appreciate the service of Mrs. Law. She has always been very kind to us. Trying her best to accommodate our needs. All in alll, the hotel has outstanding standard of services and very friendly staff...;
we enjoyed our long stay in the hotel.

title: Great restaurant on the premises
text: The dinning experiment at the Lotte Crown Plaza was amazing. The selection and variety is amazing. We consumed everything from pancakes to shrimp and grits. Totally awesome! The towers are worth the extra money with breath taking views.

title: Horrendous! Unbelievably Loud construction in building
text: Terrible! Stay away! I have stayed at a variety of upscale hotels in the city and this is the *only* one I have ever given a 1-star review! Total nightmare. They were executing construction throughout the whole building and the sound was so loud from 7:15 am - 3:15 pm that even the housekeepers in the hallways were complaining. I called the front desk so many times to see if I can have my room moved and she just kept saying that the manager was in a meeting and then finally they just stopped answering the front desk phone. Unbelievable, considering we were Paying $3,099/night for our accommodations...

title: Glorious Stay at the Lotte New York Palace!
text:
Absolutely top notch, Second stay here from Colorado and my husband and I were just amazed on how  nice, professional, kind and sincere the entire staff is. Do not stay anywhere else if you want beauty, fun, with the NYC BUZZ and ENERGY all around you... It feels like a Palace and my favorite area was the garden area on outside on the main entry level facing the St Patricks Cathedral. Sip on a drink, sight see and people watch. 

The standouts of the Hotel Is MR Daniel Arias ( front desk) who booked us on the 52nd suite that was stunning and the prettiest Hotel Room Ive ever stayed in.  Daniel has kind customer service skills, and listens to everyone's needs with top notch professionalism, Which is what you need when your done traveling.. 
Bell Man: I think his name is Saren? He went out of his way to make sure my husbands laptop backpack was in great care... He kept an eye on us while we were leaving our luggage at the hotel , Once we walked back in, he gave us our luggage back and again carefully and gently handed it over. Saren is ON it... and loves what he does. 

If you need amazing Concierge help, someone who is also fun, kind an loves his job call Mr Joseph Gairo, as he KNOWS everything about NYC, the Hotel, the property and anything else you can think of. You automatically feel comfortable asking questions and guidance about NYC. 

Our room the view, our housekeeping staff, Entire Staff, Location to Rockafeller,, The beauty and character of this Hotel again were GLORIOUS... 

Thank you Lotte NYC you made my dreams come true.... Staying there. Ill be back for a 3rd stay in the near future. 
Aimee Quaratino (Colorado)

title: City visit
text:
Hotel hit all the right buttons, food,service,cleanliness were all on the money.  Definitely would return.
If you drive into the city there is a parking garage adjacent with a direct entrance into the hotel.  It’s a little expensive, but extremely convenient

title: Great place to stay in Manhattan
text: The hotel is close to everything either by walking or subway or Uber etc. we always stay at the towers. The towers has its own check in and concierge service. This is our 4th time staying at the hotel. Nice rooms, comfortable beds and excellent service. The only thing I’d like to see in the room is a espresso type coffee machine.

title: Clara Law at the Towers
text: She was very helpful and always greeting with a smile and volunteering her services which made our stay very enjoyable. The hotel is very convenient and it helps to have good services besides the fact that the hotel location is great.

title: An amazing hotel!
text:
We stayed at this hotel based on a recommendation from a close friend. We wanted special hotel to stay at to celebrate my wife birthday.  the hotel exceeded all of our expectations. 
From an early check in until our departure, everything was perfect and everyone we encountered was friendly and efficient.  The rooms are spacious and the views are amazing.  I can not say enough about how nice this hotel is.

title: best staff
text:

she is good quality services and never met before
