title: Awesome Stay in a near Perfect Hotel
text: What a great time we had in NYC our first trip there and felt like we really scored on the Hotel. Great staff, great location central to everything!!! Easy walk to subway and short taxi rides to a lot of places as well as being able to walk almost any where if you want to!!! Can’t wait to go back to stay during the holidays!!!! Housekeeping was a awesome!!! I know seems weird to say, but it is never easy cleaning up after others, and Anna Marie left us the nicest note upon our departure!!! We loved the hotel!!!! Only slight critique is the upper floors elevators were tiny but was only a slight nuance far out done by the Awesome staff, room, amenities and great hospitality!!!!

title: The Best Hotel
text: This hotel is incredible I love staying here with my family. The staff is incredible. I can't say enough about the hotel. The beds are vert comfortable so conducive to sleep. The only negative was we did not understand excelsior so the first night we froze. After that I got it and we were great.

title: Amazing Palace - Perfect Location
text: Very nice Hotel- nice rooms with amazing views from the towers. Great Breakfast. Melissa (the waiter) was such a sweetheart and took care of us in such a nice way. Location is perfect. The patio is very beautiful!

title: Family Holiday in New York
text:
We spent a wonderful 8 nights and 9 days in New York at the Lotte New York Palace for a family holiday. The service and welcome was absolutely excellent. Easily one of the best hotels we have ever stayed at. All staff were extremely helpful and the rooms were beautiful and always extremely clean.
I stayed with my husband and our two children (18 y/o and 8 y/o) in The Towers and we all had an amazing time. We enjoyed breathtaking city views from our room. Apart from the beautiful interior and exterior of the hotel, it is also in a prime location, just a few minutes walk from places like Times Square, Rockefeller Centre, St Patrick's Cathedral and plenty of restaurants and shops. Furthermore, attractions such as the Empire State Building and Central Park are only a 15 min drive or a 20-ish min walk if you're up for it. 
Notable mentions include some lovely staff members at the hotel. Papa, who welcomed us and helped us with our luggage who was particularly kind to my son. George, who is positioned at the door and is extremely friendly and ready to offer any travel advice you may need. Cesar who is a lovely person and even brought some crowns and teddies for my son and my friends' children who visited us to their surprise. Lastly, Melody who works at The Towers Reception who is extremely helpful. After some noise from construction in the next-door room, she spoke to the manager who then facillitated an upgrade because of the inconvenience. 
Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in Midtown Manhattan.

title: Superior concierge
text: We just celebrated our honeymoon and my birthday at The Towers at Lotte New York Palace. Isabella was incredibly friendly and knowledgeable! She saved us so much time by giving us the best ways to maximize our days! Every recommendation she gave us was exactly what we were looking for! Thank you to our new friend!

title: Good Experience
text: I stayed in the tower and overall i was pleased with my experience.  My room was extremely larger and the view of the city  from my room was breathtaking. In terms of what could be better is I feel that the rooms could be updated a bit and the construction that was going on on the 8th floor was a little frustrating.

title: Very happy, but a little unhappy
text: The hotel was beautiful, the rooms were great and the staff was phenomenal. The hotel upgraded us upon check in to a beautiful suite overlooking the city. The issue was that the room's electrical panel went bust on the 2nd day of our visit and we were unable to turn down the shades, turn off the lights and use other features inside the room. The hotel staff informed us that they wouldn't be able to fix the issue until we departed. They instructed us to unplug the lights or unscrew the light bulbs to turn off the lights prior to going to bed. That crummy. The living room area got in excess of 90 plus degrees because we were unable to lower the shades. The hotel staff sent a maintenance worker to our room who manually change the direction of the vents to cool the room. This was just really an inconvenience and unpleasant. The hotel staff was kind enough to offer us other accommodations, but our children and grandchildren were staying on the same floor and we wanted to be near them. Hopefully, next time we come visit we will get a room that won't have these complications.,

title: Stunning hotel
text: From the moment we arrived, we felt important, the staff were amazing. We were upgraded as we were celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary. The tower room was beautiful. It was impeccably clean, the bed was so comfortable, we didn’t want to get out of it! Slept really well. Room was quiet, had wonderful views over the cathedral, stunning. Bathroom was lovely, had all Molton brown products for us, every detail was thought of. The hotel was so stunning. We stayed four nights, can’t wait to stay there again.

title: New York Palace
text: My go to Hotel in New York always a pleasure! It's a perfect location with an outstanding staff. Every-time I go some where else I'm disappointed. Rooms are top quality. Great for business and family .....Thanks NYP always a pleasure. See you soon

title: NYC favorite
text: The hotel is beautiful and the suite we stayed in was exquisite. Rooms were very large and the master bathroom was massive for a hotel. The service was exceptional. We had some trouble cooking the room and maintenance was up in less than 30 minutes. Changed the filter and all better. Will definitely be back.

title: hotel is incredible. The rooms are wonderful and the people here go way out of their way to take care of their guest
text:
the staff are  nice in this hotel especially  Clara Law , in tower Reception area , she is always smile , Greet with a smile and say:” Good morning/afternoon/evening (according to the right time of the day) 
When see the arrival guest coming in, open the main entrance  and when leaving too.

title: First time in the Apple
text: This is our first trip to New York and I was blown away. This hotel exceeded all of my expectations. I know I paid more, but the Towers suite we had was breathtaking. Would not do it any other way. The only "issue" I had was one of the concierge was not very helpful, but the others were. Still 5 stars in my book.

title: Our BOD Meeting at the Lotte
text: We had our BOD and Committee Meetings at the Lotte.  Everything was perfect from beginning to end.  Daniel Nelson and Isabel Choi were exceptional to work with.  Rooms in the Towers were amazing, Meeting Space was perfect and all the food was delicious.  Shouts out to Elizabeth Mundy, Clive Ashe and banquet staff Herman, Andres and Moni.  I would highly recommend the Lotte - your guests will love the experience.  I know that mine did.

title: First time at the Lotte but not the last!
text:
This hotel is incredible. The rooms are wonderful and the people here go way out of their way to take care of their guests. The Maitre d’Etage, Samir Saleh was the highlight of our trip. We met him
our first day and talked to him every day. Delightful!! We stayed for 4 nights for a long weekend and it was our best NY trip yet. I would highly recommend this property to anyone looking for an upscale experience in the city.

title: Great stay
text: This friendly hotel was perfect for me and my friend .Not far to walk to  the famous attractions and pick up the tour buses .When we got back from a day of sightseeing and shopping the room was refreshed and comfortable .We also had a great view of the skyline !

title: Hands Down The Best Hotel in NYC!
text: The Towers at Lotte New York Palace is my new go to hotel in all of New York. It’s a beautiful hotel, with a top notch hotel staff top to bottom, very well located and overall was just a wonderful experience. The rooms were spacious and immaculate with very high end amenities. The room service was excellent. Maid staff was on point and did a great job cleaning. And the overall customer service was off the charts. I recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a place in NY and I look forward to coming back and visiting soon.

title: Sooo Overpriced
text: Through my credit company, I had 100$ credit for breakfast everyday.....with the prices and upcharges, my daughter and I were never able to purchase breakfast for that much and we did NOT indulge.  I am talking a coffee, oatmeal, omelette and a juice.  It was crazy expensive at this hotel.  Room was large but otherwise just "okay"....no working desk and no bathtub.  They had given us a handicap room so that we had a wheel in shower.   The closet was super small and had only a few hangers, nor was there much space in the dresser.  My bill was incorrect and reflected none of the credits I had arranged through my credit card compamy.  There are much better hotels you can stay in around the area for this price!

title: Amazing place to stay in NYC!
text: Stayed here during world pride. Impeccable service and beautiful views to match. If I’m Manhattan, this is the place to be. Centrally located and within walking distance to stores and services . I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Amazing night at the Palace
text: We had the pleasure of staying at the Lotte New York Palace. Our room was located in the Towers. It was the most amazing experience. The room was spectacular with an awesome view of the city. When you walked out of the courtyard, you were at St. Patrick's Cathedral. The room was furnished beautifully, spacious and very comfortable. The staff was amazing. Thank you to Ray, Fran, Eddie, Cal, Denise, and especially Anna Marie. This truly was a night in a Palace!! I highly recommend to all.

title: Perfect Location
text: We spent 8 nights here and enjoyed every day. The service was fantastic the location was perfect and would have loved to stay longer. The hassle and bustle of NY was on your doorstep while the sanctuary everyone seeks was on offer. We where first time visitors to the Big Apple and would plan to return and stay at the Towers. All staff are super friendly and customer service was 10/10.

title: The Palace Hotel NEVER disappoints!
text: I was tasked to organize a very large event in NYC and to book my guests at the Palace Hotel.  The whole staff from the GM down are an amazing group of people that helped me tremendously.  No matter what request I had, Isabel Choi and Elizabeth Mundy, did not hesitate for one minute to take care of the guests.  From the constant room changes to food requests, the team of Isabel and Elizabeth where right on top of things.  Couldn't have asked for a better team and hotel.  They allowed me to take care of the other aspects of the week of events I had to oversee as I did not have to worry about the Palace Hotel.  Complete confidence of them.  I look forward to the next one!

title: Highly recommend
text: Outstanding hotel first class all the way.  Highly recommend.  We stayed in the corner two bedroom suite on the 49th floor, fantatic accomandations.  From the moment you chech into the tower portion of the hotel, you coluld tell you were in for a treat.

title: My daughters wedding 6-29-19
text:
My daughter was married at St Patricks Cathedral and we had the reception at
The Lotte New York Palace. It was beyond beautiful and the service at the Palace was
outstanding!! Jessica Merk, Dan Nelson and Katrina Lee were there  for me every step of the way. We had a room block of 100 rooms and there was nothing but praise for the
staff and their hospitality from our guests. . I can't thank the Palace enough for making 
it such a spectacular weekend!!!

title: Phenomenal Stay at the Towers
text:
I've just returned home after an amazing three night stay at the Towers. From the very moment we checked in until we headed out to the airport, we were greeted with friendly and welcoming smiles and accommodating staff. 

The room was spacious, beds comfortable and the water pressure was perfect. The view of St. Patrick's cathedral was out of this world.

The gym was great too -- water, fruit and towels were provided. Very impressed at the fact that they have a squat rack! 

To top it all off, the hotel kindly provided us with a cheese board and a bottle of wine to help us celebrate our mum's 60th birthday. A beautiful touch. It's personal touches like this that sets this hotel apart from other hotels I've stayed at in NY. 

I'll definitively be back again soon! 

Thanks to the team for looking after us and making our stay so very memorable! :)

title: Outstanding
text:
From the time of checking every thing was outstanding, the service desk, housekeeping, front desk  all the employees do a lot to make you feel comfortable 
The room was perfect, the Little coffee shop at the hotel very appreciated.

title: Loved it - really large room and great bathroom
text:
We stayed last time we visited. It is by far my favourite hotel in New York. 

Absolutely loved everything about it, check in was a dream, staff incredibly friendly, helpful and courteous.

The room was on the 50something floor with great views.  The size was great - really big by New York standards and it is the first bathroom I’ve liked in New York (I’m very fussy about bathrooms) - it really was great in that it was large and nicely decorated. 

We will definitely return to the Towers on our next trip.

title: My children were away and so I celebrated Father's Day at the hotel.
text: Susan was working the reception desk at the Towers and she couldn't have made me feel more welcome.  I stay there frequently and Susan seems to be tirelessly working the desk whenever I do.  This particular night Susan gave me a Father's day greeting upon my arrival.  I needed a vase and some other particulars for the room and Susan not only ordered them immediately, they were delivered very promptly.  It's nice to have someone as steady as Susan that is always there to make guests such as myself feel at home.

title: Luxurious stay !
text:
My family's stay was we will all never forget.
Our room was magnificent, with a lovely view of the city.
All our expectations were exceeded. We are recommending this establishment to all our friends.
We are looking  forward to our  next stay there

title: Excellent New York Hotel
text: Great value, great location, large rooms, easy check in process, helpful bellmen.  I would recommend to anyone who wants to be in a good midtown location—close to theater, MOMA, Rockefeller Center, shopping, restaurants and more.

title: Fantastic New York City Hotel...
text:
Great location; Excellent Service; Fantastic Room Amenities and Overall Class and Luxury.

the Lotte New York Palace is formerly the Helmsley Palace.  Our family of five had an excellent two bedroom suite in the Towers section of the property for one night before we headed to Africa.  It ooozed luxury and we had a fantastic stay.  The location was easy to restaurants and shopping and the hotel itself had some excellent dining and bar options.

We would surely come back and visit again.

title: 5 days in New York City
text: Our first trip to New York, we picked the hotel and location after comparing a few websites. We could not have been happier with our choice. Far exceeded our expectations for room size, amenities, views. Staff were super friendly and helpful, everything worked as it should, very central to everything. Next trip to New York will definitely see us return to this hotel.

title: Excellent accomodations in the heart of Manhattan
text: Beautiful compfortable accomodations with superb views of Manhattan and St Patricks Cathedal.  Very centrally located near Rockerfeller Center, Saks and great shopping. Great in house bars and restaurants and very near great restaurants.

title: Fantastic Lotte
text: Wonderful stay, Susan at the front desk is amazingly and a pleasure to deal with, she made the stay amazing. The service was excellent in every way. I couldn’t imagine staying anywhere else. The bar and restaurant were excellent.

title: Off to a bad start
text:
Check In was supposed to be 3pm, but housekeeping forgot to clean the room due to a late check out, so we have to wait until five, then rush- without a chance to rest- too make our dinner reservations. Definitely not the kind if reception I was expecting. Luckily my daughter has a room so I can hang out there 
Hopefully, the rest of the stay will improve

title: Execellent hotel. Wonderful location.
text: Wonderful hotel - The Towers-  inside a hotel - New York Palace. The location couldn't be better, neighbor to St Patrick Catedral. You have your own reception, concierge, etc. Very big room, with everything you need, 2 queen beds, lots of space, classic furniture, marble bathroom, bottles of water, Nespresso machine, macarons... A brasilian Concierge clef d'Or Lorena Ringoot, help us in every need. Restaurants, stores etc. Top 10.

title: NYC..
text:
Fantastic Hotel in NYC.. My only issue was the Maid service was very slow.. Other than that..a perfect
stay.
I will always stay at this hotel while in NYC.. I wish they had a restaurant open for dinner..

title: Tired, tired, tired
text:
Booked room in this “luxury” hotel as part of a very special trip.
Arrived tired after a transatlantic journey, to a tired room, dated and scruffy.
No bath tub in spite of booking this room for this specific facility.
Could not change until next day, offered food and drink credit.
Later on discovered room not properly cleaned, no functioning tv and some power points and lamps not working, and worst of all, toilet flush not working. Spent the evening and night removing the cistern lid to flush.
Went to reception in this “hotel within a hotel” at 6am to find it is not staffed 24 hours, was assisted by a charming young man in the main hotel who arranged for a room change but not until 3pm which meant that fir the first day we had no room to return to.
New room four floors up was marginally better in that it had a bath tub, not the deep soaking one stated on my booking confirmation from hotels,com but a ridiculously shallow one, same standard of fixtures and fittings and cleanliness and two truly dreadfully uncomfortable beds. Did not bother complaining about the second room as did not want to spend entire trip dealing with stuff like this, supposed to be relaxing, and besides no one came back to us after email complaint, nor to check if we were happy with room change, so essentially no one was interested.
So disappointed.
Only positive is that the staff are mostly pleasant.

title: Not a great experience at all
text:
This was meant to be a celebration trip, me:celebrating a big birthday and my mum: celebrating surviving breast cancer. I have stayed in many fabulous hotels in New York and stupidly decided to try something different for this trip.

We booked a 'luxury double towers room'. This room promised a 'deep soaking bath' which was one of the main reasons we had booked it. 

When we arrived to the room it had a shower, no bath. The bathroom was really dirty and also dirt in the grout etc. The TV didn't work, the bedside lamp wouldn't turn off. When we looked behind the TV to try and work out what was wrong there was so much dust that i started choking. We rang reception re the bath issue and they advised there were no rooms that evening with baths, we didn't feel like we could be bothered moving the next day so accepted a credit for food and beverages. Later on we discovered that the power sockets beside the bed didn't work. The toilet wouldn't flush properly, we had to open the cistern to flush it during the night. Around the TV area was the most dirty, ring stains from glasses and other stains. Luckily we had some anti bacterial wipes with us and had to give the place a good clean. I sent an email early evening saying how dissatisfied we were and that we were going to bed early due to jet lag. Then we discovered that the beds had stained linen although were quite comfortable.

My mum had to go down in the morning to complain as my email had not been answered, although she spoke to a very helpful man who promised to have our room changed later that day(most of the staff are very pleasant) . 

When we returned that afternoon we were allocated a new room four floors higher. It does have a bath. Unfortunately it is not what is promised ie "deep soaking", it could perhaps be described as deep soaking if you were about two foot in height.

The beds in this room are dreadful, the mattresses are sagging so much that they are really hard to lie on. Absolutely awful! There was a pubic hair on the window sill. And a thick layer of dust. The glass table is covered in stains. Also there are stains all over the TV unit (which we have cleaned ourselves with wipes) strange stains on the bedside table. I could go on and on. We didn't bother to complain as this is meant to be an enjoyable trip, and no one actually called us to check that our room change was ok. 

In summary, this hotel is old and dated. The decor in the bedrooms and the design of the bathrooms is very 80s. The cushions in the room are revolting. The toilet is so low on the floor that it is really hard to use. 

Maybe some of the rooms are better than this, but 4410 and 4810 are just tired and dirty. I cannot understand other reviews that are remarking on the great standards of cleanliness . Very strange indeed. I feel totally cheated :(

For £495 a night I expected much more. I've paid less in other five stars in this city and had an absolutely fabulous luxury experience. I would avoid this hotel at all costs. I can't actually believe they have five stars.

title: Terrific Hotel
text: Have stayed at the Lotte New York Palace several times and it has never let us down.  Staff is very professional and friendly.  Rooms are great.  Very spacious and quiet.  Hotel has many good amenities such as restaurant and bars on the property.

title: New York getaway
text: Planned this trip for our daughter after she finished her GCSE’s. Chose the Lotte Towers because of a recommendation from a friend. Booked a corner suite and was upgraded to the Metropolitan Suite upon check in!  Taken up to the 43rd floor and absolutely stunned by the space this suite afforded, 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, kitchen, library etc and views to absolutely die for. A wonderful surprise that made our trip to New York magical. Thank you Lotte, we will be back. Some of the nicest, friendliest staff who are an absolute credit to the hotel.

title: The New York Palace is America's Palace
text: After 2 decades of staying at the Waldorf Astoria until it closed, this has become our New York home.  The bars, public spaces, and the rooms in the Towers are all exceptional, only outdone by the attentiveness and cordiality of the entire staff.  We always look forward to coming back.

title: Another fabulous weekend at the beautiful Lotte NY Palace
text: The Palace never disappoints, especially the continued service of Tamara Purdy, the best in hospitality! We can't say enough of the amazing accommodations in the Towers, not to mention the view. One of the best in NYC, certainly best location!

title: Great location!
text: Stayed here for work and loved being so close to all the subways, easy walking to my meetings and of course all the great shopping and restaurants in the area!  Great service in all areas of the hotel and even got a lovely welcome amenity from Dan Muney and Inthira who helped set up my reservation!  I'll definitely be back.

title: Finest hotel with best service in Manhattan
text: My wife and I simply love the Towers at Lotte New York Palace.  Great, warm welcome; friendly and witty doormen; large rooms; great room service; and the list goes on.  Location just north of midtown is great for restaurants, and near enough to Central Park for good, long walks there daily.  Hard for us to imagine staying anywhere else in NY.

title: Really nice stay at The Lotte New York Palce
text:
Very professional accommodating staff- comfortable clean room- great central location-wonderful dining options-  Very cool history of The Lotte New York Palace!!!
The lobby is beautiful- hope to return very soon*****

title: My visit to Lotte Palace in New York was an outstanding experience!
text: Our stay in the towers was wonderful. The staff could not have been nicer and more friendly. My two sisters and I were traveling with our Mom who is 93 years old. Everyone went overboard to greet us and help at every step. We had a view from our 53rd floor room that is incomparable anywhere in the city! Security, under the expert direction of Mr James Byrne, was visible and responsive in a highly professional manner. No wonder dignitaries and heads of state stay there! We were central to many attractions such as st. Patrick’s, Rockefeller center, theaters, radio city, nbc, Fox News, shopping areas and more! The room was beautiful and spacious with comfortable beds and clean, well equipped bathroom. I will definitely be back for another memorable trip!

title: Beautiful, organized, helpful
text: We absolutely loved the towers! The whole experience of this hotel was wonderful! The cleaning service was above anything else we have experienced, the staff was helpful and friendly, the food was delicious!

title: Birthday weekend celebration
text:
Bring comfortable shoes. The hotel is in a fabulous location that is within walking distance to many great attractions and restaurants. 

For those who like a daily workout, the hotel gym is great and has plenty of equipment-more than most.

title: Amazing hotel
text: Love this hotel! Great location, friendly staff and has a great gym! Love the little coffee/pastry shop inside hotel - perfect way to start the day. Would recommend this hotel to anyone and we will definitely be back.

title: Return to New York
text: Grand but not pretentious- comfortable and relaxing - mix coffee shop breakfasts with an occasional and more formal breakfast at Villard - a drink in Trouble’s Trust takes you away from the busy New York to a mellow atmosphere

title: Wedding Night Bliss
text: My husband and I could not have asked for more on our wedding night! Our suite was an absolute dream. Everyone at the Palace made us feel so special. In particular, Eliza Pezzullo really went above and beyond by personally taking care of us during our stay--a true hospitality professional. She, and the rest of the staff who assisted us (including Primavera), made our wedding truly unforgettable. We knew we were in great hands from the moment we stepped into the lobby. Thank you and we hope to be back soon!

title: Looks Are Deceiving
text:
The hotel lobby, bars and terrace are luxurious, the rooms not so much. Our mattress sagged in the middle, tp was thin and room was lacking a coffee maker. Most of the staff were very accommodating but I found it odd that the doormen watched us struggle with luggage and did not attempt to help by simply opening a door for us.
We will not be staying here again simply because other hotels are better for a similar price.

title: Best Hotel ever
text: Great staff, walking distance to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Central Park, and tons of high end stores. Regular room was very large, was put in a suite my last night, incredibly nice. So glad we decided to splurge a little to make our NYC experience more relaxed, we were well taken care of from arrival to departure.

title: Another great experience at The Palace
text: We enjoyed another great weekend at the Lotte Palace and introduced our friends to this wonderful hotel. Although I’ve stayed in both areas of the hotel, the Towers is a special experience. I always receive attentive support with making my reservation ( thanks to Brian Becker) and the concierge recommendations and assistance with dinner plans has always been excellent. The rooms are very spacious, full closet space and the bathrooms roomy ( by NYC standards) and well appointed. Dining at the hotel is special as well. You can’t beat the location- easy walk to Central Park, shopping, and Broadway. The Lotte Palace is perfect in every way. Ive stayed in hotels all over the city- this is the best. Keep up the great work!

title: Bridal Suite
text: Beautiful Bridal Suite Room with gorgeous view overlooking St Patrick's Cathedral and all the way to the river on the west side. Plenty of space for bridal party to get ready with hair and make up and kitchen and serving area with frig and wine frig. Sales Manager, Dan Nelson was so kind and  accommodating and arranged for full length mirrors, stools, steamer, whatever we needed! Hotel staff was also very friendly, helpful and attentive. Decor elegant and crisp, perfect place for beautiful photos inside and outside in the courtyard. Perfect for a NYC wedding!!

title: SPOILED ROTTEN!!!
text: Don't stay here, unless you're ready to be completely unsatisfied with any other place you'll ever stay. The rooms are large, clean and beautiful. The staff bends over backward to anticipate your needs and treats you respectfully, whether you're in blue jeans or formal attire. We will never stay

title: Sleep in the sky!
text: We were upgraded to a tower room and became the people in the consumer photos, sitting on the window ledge and staring at the view. It was captivating! Decided to splurge for last night in Ny and arranged a large bedroom with two double beds.  Yards and yards of fine sheets and mushy pillows, quiet rooms, great people spotting in the lobby and well located for Bloomies, St. Patties and all points from midtown.   Our teenagers had seen the bar featured on a series so that was an extra...

title: Business travel
text:
My first time at the hotel, it will not be last!
The best staff in any hotel I have stayed in America.
Beautiful hotel and location 
The suite was wonderful and bright, decor was elegant.
Breakfast was great and the cocktails in the evening were sublime!

title: Tower Suite
text: We stayed in the Tower Suite on the 41st floor for our wedding and it was absolutely incredible. Like a 1 bedroom apartment in NYC. Incredible views and added a special wedding extra bonus. Thank you Dan Nelson, Rachel Wolff, & Elaina Gabb for making our amazing day that much more amazing.

title: Beyond amazing experience
text:
. My 13 and 11-year-old lovely  granddaughters to have a magical New York experience .I had just sold our condo on Central park so I wanted to create new memories. the Palace is the magnificent Villard mansion with brilliant architecture and European flavor,  a single block from prime 5th Ave., Rockefeller Center,etc .we were close the theatre too.  Yohanna at 
the front desk made it even more amazing by upgrading we birthday girls to a panoramic corner suite! Christopher the dining room manager, was delightful!  I know the girls and I will never ever forget this hotel, the enormous suite and the staff who indulged us! I hope you’ll be back soon ..

title: Good rooms, pleasent service
text:
As always i had a great time. As a business traveler i found the amenities working well, room service and general politeness and professional nature of staff
I will certanly use the hotel with family and friends

title: Beautiful Hotel
text: We had an amazing very of St Paul's Cathedral from the 44th floor. The room was spotless and the staff were wonderful.  The turn down service gave us more water bottles than we could drink and dark chocolates. The bath toiletries were Molton Brown brand.

title: I Found My NYC Hotel!
text: I was looking for a hotel with two queen size beds in NYC, and that’s no easy feat. I finally gave up and called an AX travel agent and hours later she called me back with 5 hotels, and this was one of them.   Now, it’s not cheap, but it is cheaper than two rooms in a 4star hotel. What a great surprise. The room was huge! The location at 50th and Madison is great and we were so high up the room was super quiet! Everyone was super nice. We had a couple of issues with our room, a loose faucet and some plugs that didn’t work, but they fixed it right away and discounted the first night! I was super impressed with the staff.  This hotel is beautiful.

title: Wonderful stay
text: We just had a fantastic stay at the Lotte Palace. Dan Nelson in Sales took fantastic care of us, ensuring the entire team made us feel very special upon our arrival and throughout the weekend. Beautiful hotel, centrally located, top notch service. Highly recommend.

title: Wonderful weekend !
text:
So I have been trying different hotels in NYC and The Palace Towers was definitely one of the best.  I was able to find a Summer promotion, ( prepay for discount) which afforded me the room with 2 queen beds on the highest floor in The Towers.  The room was huge ( for NYC standards).  My view was amazing.  I faced the river and it was just breathtaking on the high floor.  It started off all right.  At check in , The Towers has a separate area and separate check in desk ; where they offered me champagne and bottle water upon arrival.  The front desk employees were very friendly and handed me a tote as a gift as part of my check in promotion.  Not every day in nyc do you get gifts and champagne upon check in!!! 

Conciege was very helpful with restaurants, and the doorman was always able to find me a taxi Quickly. Although the location is centrally located , that we walked ever where. The beds were very comfortable.  We actually slept so late being on the high floor. We never heard the crazy traffic.  The location is really good too. It’s one block from 5th avenue with all the fancy shops ( and next to Saks ).  It’s actually easy to walk everywhere!!! Close to Central Park, Rockefeller center , and theatre district.  It’s really good central located.  

So , heads up though. The brunch on the 2nd floor restaurant is ridiculous expensive.  Just be ready if you eat at hotel !!! I would say skip the Restuarsnt and go enjoy local bagel place! Starbucks is across the street .

title: Exceeded expectations
text: The Lotte is our favorite New York hotel, the location is super convenient and the views are incredible. St Patrick’s Cathedral is next door and that’s my favorite view from the hotel but the other side has a great view the East River, Crysler Building and Empire State Building. We had an issue with the air conditioner the first night we were there and they promptly moved us to an even better room. Breakfast room service was some of the best we’ve experienced. The staff was all very happy and that made the stay even more enjoyable.

title: Wonderful property, excellent location, friendly staff
text:
Wonderful location, just east of St. Patrick’s Cathedral and a block from Rockefeller Center lies the Lotte New York Palace hotel.
Warm, friendly and helpful staff, including Louis (Doorman), Ned (a very knowledgeable concierge), Henry - excellent bellhop, and a very nice and insightful gentleman, Jimm K, who checked us into a beautiful, spacious and ultra clean room in the tower suites.

title: Vacation
text: I have been staying in the hotel over 3 months and my office is in the hotel. Every time when I pass the Towers section Clara Law is the first one to greet me with happy smiling. I love this hotel a lot because of the staff and also best location.

title: Great view
text: A beautiful hotel with a great view of St. Patrick's Cathedral. The room was spotless and the service was top notch. Very accommodating and friendly staff, from check in to bellman to concierge. Thank you Dan Nelson for a great room and for your warm hospitality.

title: We LOVE it here!
text: First, it’s just beautiful—elegant but not opulent. Classic with modern amenities. Rooms are spacious, quiet and comfortable. Bars and onsite restaurant are super cool. The gym was just renovated and is legit. The service team is friendly and responsive and room service great! Location is central to Broadway, shopping and restaurant.  We stay here whenever we can, and the value is worth every dollar.

title: BEST HOTEL IN NYC
text: We have stayed at this hotel for 5 years in a row and each time our experience is excellent. In fact we see the same staff at the door every year and behind the desk. Everyone at the hotel is professional, kind and helpful.

title: Oozes with class and professionalism
text: The Lotte and it’s staff ooze with class and professionalism! It is a one of  kind! Not a hair out of place! From ground staff to top management there is a joy to assist customers! Your stay will be memorable

title: The best hotel with the very best of the best people helping make NY better than the rest!
text:
We loved and will always be staying at the Lotte Towers New York.... but hotels.com (reported) the Langham  also was a nice place in NY ... NO NO NO.... 
We stay all over the wold and love the LOTTE Tower ...e asked for our money back from the LANGHAM....we were so disappointed... even in their corner suite . the Towers rose far above in every way!
Thank you Victor  C. and the young lady you asked to help make room for us Yohenny.
You saved our vacation... What a blessing you have been to our family.  Your people are the best of NY.

title: Midtown base for travel
text: Very nice place to stay. Large, comfortable rooms, courteous and professional staff, beautiful lobby. Access to shopping, transportation, restaurants, etc. Pomme Palais (in house coffee shop) is better than Starbucks. Say hi to Victor in the courtyard bar!

title: Customer Service Extraordinaire!!!!!
text: New York City is an annual trek, girls getaway!!!! We normally stay at the Park Hyatt but decided to try the Lotte New York Palace.  From the moment we arrived, we felt that we were on the “Red Carpet”...... That said, it wasn’t about pomp and circumstance but rather feeling like we mattered.  The door men were so personal and attentive. Not once did it feel like it was ever about the tip. They were genuine.... We stayed in the “Towers” and they have a dedicated check-in and concierge.  Champagne complimentary between 4 and 6...  Whether this is relevant or not, we checked in with American Express Centurion.  The reason I mention this is as such. We are entitled to an upgrade, if available.  I’ve made it my practice over the years never to ask because it has never panned out...... Here’s the game changer...... Enter “Yohenny Vasquez”..... (Tower Guest Service Agent). I can’t say enough about her!!!  She presented herself in a professional, yet personal manner.  She not only made us feel that we mattered and appreciated our choice in accommodations, she offered us an upgrade.  Worth noting, we arrived on a Friday....what are the chances.  We did arrive before check in and obviously they stored out luggage and true to her word, she texted us to let us know when our room was ready....... Or shall I say, “OUR SUITE”.  I can’t say enough about my experience at the Lotte New York Palace.  I will say this..... Location was the drive for our choice in accommodations, the staff will be my choice moving forward.  I don’t want to speak ill of the Park Hyatt but in my experience, they don’t hold a candle to the Lotte New York Palace.  Once again, my heart felt thanks to Yohenny Vasquez, Tower Guest Services...... and a Very Happy Birthday to her.

title: Just perfection
text:
We came for a four day trip to New York Theatres dining shopping this hotel has been the perfect place a great location for walk into all of the above
.We have a room in the towers section which allows us to have a suite with two rooms sliding doors sliding shades everything automated and simply beautiful.
 The service staff is not only helpful but complementary kind and always offering to assist everyone addresses us by name and the service and food in the dining room is terrific

title: Top-Notch
text: We were treated like royalty at The Palace!  This hotel is beautiful, stylish and perfectly located in Manhattan.  It seemed like everything we wanted to do in NYC was just a few steps away.  The staff here was so accommodating and attended quickly and efficiently to our every need and every question!  I can't wait to go back!

title: a really lovely place to stay in a wonderful location with helpful and professional staff
text:
the hotel was perfect for our trip. The room was larger than anticpated and had every facility that we could ask for. Our view of Saint Patrick's was a bonus and the high floor gave us a pleasant ,quiet, atmosphere.
If I had a minor complaint it would be that the bed was a little too firm for my liking.

title: Another wonderful stay in the best hotel in New York
text:
Once again, our stay in New York was made even better by the wonderful service we experienced at New York Palace. The staff in this hotel really go above and beyond to ensure guests have the best possible experience of American hospitality. We would like to thank Clara Law for always helping us with everything. We can't wait to come back again and the guest experience at the Palace is always an important reason for this.

To all at Lotte New York Palace,

Thank you

title: Wedding Anniversary celebration in NYC
text: We recently had the pleasure of spending a weekend at The Palace to celebrate our wedding anniversary!  We were warmly greeted at the door by Fran who directed us to the parking garage and met us there to help with our luggage. Yohenny checked us in and she was very welcoming and helpful. We found our room to be impeccably clean, comfortable and well equipped.  The size of the room was large, especially for NYC standards. The beautiful view of St. Patrick’s Cathedral was a bonus for sure!  All of the hotel staff that we encountered, from those in the lobby to the coffee shop to the housekeeping staff were friendly and ready to help us in any way.  The location of the hotel was perfect and made it easy for us to walk to a show on Broadway, Rockefeller Center and Times Square.  We highly recommend The Lotte New York Palace Hotel. We can’t wait to return!

title: The Perfect Getaway!
text: In an age when no one has any time to stop and write a review, I want to say that my recent stay at the Towers at Lotte New York Palace is well worth the time it takes to share my experience. I planned a last minute weekend trip to NYC with my mother that I had hoped would be a wonderful getaway for both of us, but mostly for my mom, who was LONG overdue for a relaxing break. After booking, I called the hotel and spoke to Rebecca Villasenor to ask if there was any way we could upgrade our room to one with a view. She advised me to ask for her once we got to the hotel and I have to say that she not only took exceptional care of us, but she made sure we stayed in a room that far exceeded our every expectation and provided customer service that was off that charts and so rare to find. I have been a longtime regular at The Peninsula, but I can say that thanks to the incredible staff at the Lotte New York Palace and the attention that Rebecca gave to my mom and me, we will undoubtedly be returning soon. To Management, thank you so much for not only selecting a staff that makes your hotel stand out from the rest but also for creating an experience for making memories that will last forever.

title: A PLACE TO CALL HOME
text:
When you're traveling for business or pleasure,the first steps are always stressful,dealingl with preparing luggage,getting on the plane on time,renting a car...so you have to focus on getting through all of it to finally be greeted at the door with smile and a welcome at check in,finding a peaceful room to spend your days by yourself or with your family,finally rest in a comfortable bed.This is what you find at Palace.
Not only the location in the city,which is a privilege on itself but specially because of the STAFF.
From the concierge with Diego,Julieta,Rene,Ani,Kal; front desk with Olga,Sandy,Lincy and Dalmasi to the bell service Brian,Matt and Lewis, Lorenzo.
At Towers:Susan,Melody,Lorena,Ned,always so caring,polite and resourceful.
What to say about Clara always ready to help,very creative and so connected to guests needs.She's an asset to the hotel.
The crew at Pomme Palais always so upbeat and friendly,special mention to Mark and Arleni.
The list extends to housekeeping: Kam,Gladys,Cristine and Galina so nice and efficients.
Thank you Miles! We miss Samir.
We had a very special dinner experience at Gold Room!Delicious food and great service with Hector and manager Alan Choi.
Thank you Becky(GM)for this special moment and for being always attentive and nice for all this years.
That's how a hotel should work making sure that you're important  when you're living to enjoy the city or when you're coming to rest in your room.You're greeted with "welcome back home"every time!

title: LOVE ,EAT ,SHARE ,LAUGH...
text:
The Palace is the best hotel in the City!
 Near to must to do,spacious rooms with best views including St.Patrick's Cathedral.
But the differential is the STAFF:people who care about you ,with dedication.
Be greeted by:friendly Clara,helpful,always making shore that we feel like home; Olga(sweet),Lincy(lovely),Sandy(kind),Thereza( smiling always),Dalmasi (spectacular),Melody( so sweet),
Yohenny(attentive)and Susan,special friend and"counselour"!
Concierge team impeccable:Diego,Rene,Julieta,(lovely)Karl,Joseph,Anne Marie,Ani,Lorena and Ned.
Always ready to help!
Breakfast at Pomme Palais is a special moment!The wonderful customer service with Arleni,special heart,
Laura( kind),Mark( kind and helpful,learned Spanish since last time),Cris( making jokes making me laugh)
Carlos(friendly and gentle),Veronica e Antonio.
Many thanks to Galina,Cristine,Kam and Gladys for taking care of our room.
Special thanks to the bell service guys:Brian,George,Tom R,Matt,Ray,Kingsley,Saleem.
Lewis and Lorenzo.
Our manager Miles:involved,confident and efficient!
Cormac,has hospitality in his"blood"!
The surprising part of this trip was Becky's invitation to the Gold Room,to celebrate our anniversary!
Wonderful place to EAT ,SHARE,LOVE,LAUGH...
Perfect food,beautiful drinks and great service with *Hector,Henry and Alan Choi,manager that surprise us with a delicious plate Jamón de Bellota UNMISSABLE!
Thank you Becky for always be ready to help and make our visits memorable!
PALACE IS THE ONE AND ONLY!

title: Room Block: Impeccable Service + Overall Seamless Experience
text:
Our company had a room block during one of the busiest times for the company and the hotel, and had the pleasure of working with Isabel Choi and Meghan Frost from the initial booking until the last member in our block checked out of the hotel. 

Although this was not the first time working with the hotel, working with Isabel this year made the entire process one of the easiest and most seamless experiences I have ever had. With any changes/ fires/ updates, Isabel was not only reachable but helped resolve any issues that came up. There were absolutely ZERO hiccups or errors (which speaks volumes considering we had room blocks for the entire week accommodating 20+ people), and truly cannot emphasize enough how fabulous everything went. She also continued to check in to make sure everything was all set - a small detail that did not go unnoticed and was incredibly appreciated! 

Both Isabel and Meghan are truly gems - if you ever have any sales/ booking needs, I highly recommend them both without a question. 

Thank you so much for a wonderful experience and I am looking forward to working together again in the future!

title: Celebratory Visit
text:

The room was over 1200 sq feet with views of the city, huge king bedroom and two baths . Peter arranged a rollaway for my daughter. A bottle of champagne and chocolates were waiting for us too. The huge bathroom had a rain bath Shower and Moulton Brown amenities . Privacy screens and shades provided darkness for good sleep with minimal noise from the streets or other rooms . The beds were comfortable and air con efficient but quiet.
Breakfast at Vilard was delicious and in a dignified old mansion setting
We were given a late checkout and provided frag fruit and water in the lobby The bell desk secured the luggage allowing us to shop before heading to the airport .
Wish we could have stayed longer but hope to return to truly a luxurious Manhattan gem.

title: wedding night at the towers

title: Not bad, but definitely past its prime...
text: The Towers at Lotte Palace is a nice hotel, which has clearly been upgraded, but it's not worth its price point. The rooms are well appointed and spacious, but the bathrooms are not what I'd expect from a 5-star at this level (the Langham, for example, blows this hotel away). The staff are very nice, but I found both room service and housekeeping bordering on incompetent. I ordered two fresh juices one morning, and after being told they were "coming right up in 15-20 minutes", waited almost 2 hours and had to call back twice. Housekeeping took a bathrobe I wanted refreshed and never replaced it, and took the large bathmat on the second day of my stay and never replaced that either. Room service selection was limited and not well executed. The actual staff you pass and interact with in the hotel were lovely though; very friendly and helpful when asked, so I am not sure where the disconnect is between attitude and execution, but at $900/night, there's no second chance for slip ups at this level of hotel. If you like the area and are considering a 5-star, I would recommend the Langham over The Towers at Lotte Palace any day.

title: Sublimely Swanky
text:
Everything about the Towers at the Lotte Palace Hotel is sublimely swanky.  And I mean that in the nicest way. From our reception by the doorman, to our reception inside when we went to the main desk and were told we were “special” and would need to check in at the separate and oh-so-beautiful reception area for The Towers and were escorted there, everything about the Palace is first class.  Once inside the reception area for The Towers, we knew we were in capable hands. We were warmly received. The reception area for The Towers  is complete with leopard settees, a scented candle-to-die-for, and elegant glasses of sparkling wine. Wow. 

Thanks to my SIL and her husband  (a lovely man, may he rest in peace) who have been staying at The Towers a decade or more for their annual trips to see theatre in Manhattan, I was introduced to Jimm Kalinka (mentioned in other TA reviews) who secured me an upgrade to a corner suite (sweet!) for Handsome Companion’s birthday. It was a spectacular corner suite on the 42nd floor, complete with a kitchen, a bath and a half, two closets, a dining table, a large living room and a magnificent bedroom.  The  smile on H.C.’s face as he walked into the sweet suite made it all worthwhile.  He sat in the corner of the huge sectional in the living room, just taking it all in. Eventually, we both realized that the view from the expansive  windows of our corner suite was of the building where we first met decades ago (a story for another day). His smile never faded the whole time we were there.

Now, the Palace Hotel, which comprises everything beneath the  41st floor, is probably best known for the magnificent building and central courtyard which faces Madison Avenue and the back of St. Patrick’s Cathedral.  The building is actually six former private brownstones around a central courtyard, once  a carriage entrance, modeled on the Palazzo Della Cancelleria in Rome, and designed by McKim, Mead  & White.   It was built in 1882 for Henry Villard, a railroad financier, for whom the high-ceilinged restaurant in the hotel was named.  Suffice it to say, this history is beautifully reflected inside the hotel.

Our room was magnificently appointed with plush towels, bathrobes, Molton Brown toiletries, and even umbrellas.  About five p.m., as we were just getting up from our nap, the phone rang. The Towers staff was sending up “a little something” for us. A few minutes later, we received a fancy, miniature chocolate mousse cake in honor of H.C.’s birthday. It came with plates, forks, knives and cloth napkins.  The timing of this delivery was so thoughtful. By bringing it before we left for our evening, we were able to pass on sweets after our dinner knowing we had a fabulous dessert waiting for us when we got back from our evening out.  And that is exactly what we did.  The cake was divine.

Sunday morning, we woke up around 7 a.m. All was quiet. In fact, we had heard no noise all night.  Apparently, no traffic noise is “permitted” around The Palace; as it should be. Because it was a cold, rainy and miserable morning, we opted to work out at the hotel gym. Though it will soon all be renovated, the gym is spacious and more than adequate. And how nice to work out overlooking St. Patrick’s Cathedral.   The gym staff was oh-so-solicitous and lovely.

There was nothing about The Towers that we did not like.  Now, having stayed here, how will we ever want to stay anywhere else when we stay in NYC?

title: A FLAWLESS HOTEL STAY FOR A NOTORIOUSLY "PICKY" GROUP
text:
I have had the unique  privilege of staying and hosting exhibitions at some of the finest hotels/resorts all over the world, and The Towers at Lotte New York Palace Hotel is no exception. This year we hosted our private showings for New York Bridal Fashion Week at The Towers at Lotte New York Palace.  The amazing staff, service and accommodations at The Palace were top notch.  So many noteworthy and special touches were afforded to us by our incomparable hotel contact  - Tracy Ann Hamilton whose patience, personal and attentive guidance made this one of the most unforgettable and best hotel/stay experiences in recent memory.  As a matter of fact, every staff member  (from the Housekeeping and the In-room Dining to the front desk, concierge and management were always professional and friendly to each of us throughout our entire stay.  Tracy Ann and the team always managed to make us feel that we were the most important guests on the property.  
We were on the verge of tears when it was time to leave. 

As a bonus, The St Patrick Cathedral views are inspiring, not to forget the jaw dropping panoramic views of New York City's sunrise and sunset.  The decor and layout of the corner suites are spacious and well appointed with a retro chic sensibility.  It was so much fun to check out all of the posh bars around the hotel, most notable was The Gold Bar reminiscent of Versailles -   the truffle fries were superb and the cocktails are beautiful, fresh and creative and the people watching was icing on the cake. 

It will be such a pleasure to return next time. We look forward to our next stay and are currently looking for excuses to take an in between trip soonest!  

Highly Recommend!

title: classic midtown stay
text:
I recently stayed 2 nights here with husband and daughter. I've stayed before, in the days when a stay at The Towers also included access to an elaborate lounge, but sadly this is long gone.
check in etc is still taking place in a separate reception area. I had booked a one-bedroom suite, but we got an upgrade to a corner suite with a fabulous view.
The look is still very classic - I prefer more modern/edgy, but the classic feel definitely has its charm and the suite was very spacious. A very large living room with a sofa bed for our daughter, a large bedroom with a king size bed, a bathroom with tub and shower, two walk-in closets, a kitchen area, a powder room and a hallway big enough to host an event. Good bed (sofa bed not so comfy), lovely bath products. Location is great for Central Park, 5th avenue shopping and of course St Patricks, which is just across the street from the main entrance.

So why not 5 stars? There were some minor kinks, so I would rate it 3,5, but because of the upgrade I've thrown in the last half star for good measure.

The kitchen area - it is always nice to be able to cook something or keep something in a fridge. This kitchen had lots of cupboards, but absolutely nothing in them. Only a wine fridge and an oven. No regular fridge, no glasses, cups, plates, utensils - not even a kettle to make a simple cup of tea. I don't really get why you'd use the space for a kitchen if you can't use it. One more really annoying thing: there's an air vent in the kitchen that is very loud and can't be switched off. No problem if you are closing all the doors to the bedroom, but since it is an open kitchen and since our daughter had the sofa bed it was really annoying. I asked in reception if anything could be done, but sadly not. 
We tried both mornings to get tables for breakfast, but the restaurant was fully booked. Not the hotel's fault - it was Easter weekend and everyone wants an Easter brunch - but when I called the designated Towers concierge he just said "sorry, it is fully booked" and hung up. No suggestions whatsoever to where we could go instead. Luckily, I work in food and wine and have a big interest in this and always have a long, obsessively researched list of places to go, so we went and had a delicious Easter brunch at Beekman Towers. 
Checking out was swift, but not every service is offered in the Towers reception - you check out, but if you want boarding passes printed or your luggage stored you have to do this at the main reception, so not quite sure why Palace Hotel keeps having a separate reception when they are not able to fulfil your needs at said reception.
Marjorie (not sure I got the right name) in Towers reception was so sweet and friendly so I would like to mention her. Thanks - also for the upgrade.
We really enjoyed our stay at the Towers - there's something special about staying on a high floor (we were on the 47th) and having that classic Midtown experience, but I am not sure that we'll stay again. It seems as if the hotel prides itself of some idea of old charm and luxury, but there are so many luxurious hotel experiences to be had in New York City, and to be honest, some do it way better than the Palace.

text: Just returned from a three night stay at Lotte NY Palace. We stayed in the Towers on floor 48 in a family room with two very comfy queen sized beds. title: Great Hotel, great location - service doesn't hit the spot
text: We spent 3 nights in the Towers in a king and queen/queen room. Checked in after a long and delayed flight from Vegas in the pouring rain and to be honest felt like we were interrupting the receptionist. She told us our room numbers and asked if we wanted a paper and that was it - didn't ask if we wanted dinner/drinks absolutely no information about the hotel at all - which was disappointing. The rooms are very large and well appointed. Beds very comfortable and cleaning of a high standard. We found all the concierge staff extremely helpful and the bell happy to flag down cabs. Service in the lobby bar was also hit and miss, we ordered an  expensive bottle of wine and had to ask for it to be put in an ice bucket as it was just opened and left on the table, we also had to ask for nuts after seeing them on other tables. Location of this hotel is perfect - it is an easy walk to all of the sites. With some tweaks in service this hotel could be perfect but our welcome (or lack of this)  left us wanting more..............

title: Great Location
text:
We stayed here for 4 nights last week.  

Pros: large suites and bathrooms, great views, great location, great staff in the Villard.  

Cons: A bad check-in set a bad tone.  We arrived early and our room, as we expected, was not ready. Jim checked us in and told us he would call when the room was ready.  I had to ask about our room upgrade that we were to have upon availability as we had booked with a Virtuoso adviser.  We left our luggage and went to lunch.  When we returned, my husband went to ask for a time estimate on the room and reported to me that Jim somewhat rudely told him "I said I'd call when it is ready".  We went out for a while and then decided to wait in the Tower check in area around 3:30.  None of the staff said a word to us or offered us a beverage.  At about 4, I went up to Jim and asked him if our room was ready.  He looked at me blankly and then asked "Are you from out there?" pointing to the main lobby.  No, you checked us in and said you would call.  He found the key at the desk and said the room had been ready for hours.  I asked why I wasn't called.  He said he didn't know what had happened but I was called. He then went on to say there was a computer issue and the main hotel guests were unable to be assigned rooms; he thought we were staying in the regular area and just came into the Tower's area to sit. When we got into the room, Jim called.  He stated his colleague had called us and left a message stating the room was ready. (I think he needs some remedial CS training.)  I then realized my apple watch was still set to airplane mode, which is why I didn't receive any notification.  My bad.  However, what upset me was his response to my husband (when the room was probably ready based on the timing of the phone call), and how we were ignored for 30 minutes because the staff thought we were in the main hotel.  No matter what part of the hotel someone is using, a true 5-star hotel would at least acknowledge them.  Shameful.  

The only other con was upon checkout.  Multiple incorrect charges and missing credits, although the woman at the desk remedied everything very quickly.

title: Amazing Experience

title: Great elegant midtown hotel
text:
The New York Palace Towers is a great high end option in midtown. The location is near St. Patricks Cathedral, and it has beautiful spacious rooms full description to follow. 

Rooms:
We stayed in 1 BR suite which is extremely spacious by NYC standards and is full updated with a comfortable bathroom. Also has kitchenette and you can request Nespresso coffee maker. The view was beautiful too. 

Service:
The concierge folks are great. Ana and Julieta were extremely helpful with all of our dining reservations and had useful last minute tips when these came up. The housekeeping service did a great job and were very flexible with turndown service. 

Food:
Only breakfast is served on the premises and it is delicious. The hotel has 3 bars but none of them have food- not even small appetizers/cheese trays. In my opinion one of the few drawbacks of the Towers. It does have next door a nice Italian/steakhouse with a bar that gets quite crowded. 

Overall, I would highly recommend the Towers because of its location, concierge and beautifully updated large rooms.

text: We’ve spent ~7 seperate nights over the past year and with each visit we have become more and more taken with the old world - yet luxurious - charm, authentic 5-star service and beautiful and comfortable accommodations. We stayed in a spacious room in the Towers, and enjoyed a lovely Saturday brunch at Villard. Oh and if you really want to splurge, inquire about the Katz Suite! 💎

title: Amazing, Excellent, Outstanding!!!
text:
We stayed here for 9 days and it was just amazing!  We had stayed at the other part of the hotel- the Lotte Palace for about a week  and we thought that was great that 6 months later we made another trip to New York.  Starting with the reservations- the staff were just lovely. I actually didn't know about the Towers but Roxanne who helped us with our reservation told us about it. She was wonderful in following up with us and helping us get our reservation sorted out.  We felt so welcome during check in and the room was breath taking.  We have considered staying at other well known top hotels in the city but I think the location here is second to none. You will never get bored of the view from the room. You can ask for a mini fridge or even a microwave to be brought to the room at no extra cost.  They weren't in the best of condition but they worked.   Housekeeping was wonderful and friendly.   The day we checked out, since our flight was a few hours later, they told us we could freshen up in the health club/gym.  I was so impressed at how friendly the staff there were. I mean if you think about it, we had actually checked out and no longer guests there but they were still so nice to us.  If I had to pick out the negatives -I do feel that  they could provide a coffee maker as part of the room facilities instead of us having to pay extra for it.  I've stayed in cheaper hotels with coffee makers in the room for no extra cost and daily replenishment.  Also, there is a car available (unto a limited distance) for guests to use on a first come first serve basis.  It was never available when we asked about it.  It would be helpful if there was a more systematic way to ensure guests can use this.  We also had problems with the wifi- they did try to sort it out though. Also there was one or two staff members who I feel were a bit unfriendly in contrast the overall welcoming attitude of the rest of the employees (not outwardly rude) and I hope I won't have to encounter them on our next visit. 
But this won't deter us from coming back. I think staying here is one of the reasons we try to plan holidays to the US.  We feel visiting New York won't be as memorable if we stayed anywhere else and we've been recommending the Towers to all our friends who are planning to travel to New York.

title: My Experience
text:
Convenient to all of Manhattan....parks, shopping, theatre, restaurants and sporting events.  There is also the subway nearby for those who do not want to take a cab or Uber.  There is also staff on duty to guide you.

Yohenny Vasquez, Jorge Cruz and Paul Vaynerman provided particularly good service!

title: 非常好的酒店
text: Clara 非常细心，把我们照顾很好，无论在酒店还是外出不购物的咨询，还给我们准备了热水壶，方便我们喝茶，因为Clara,我们特别喜欢这个酒店，下次来纽约，还要住这里。

title: Treated like royalty at the Palace
text:
Recently stayed at the Towers to celebrate my daughters birthdays (turning 7 & 5).  From the moment the staff knew it was their birthdays they were treated like true princesses.  A sparkly crown and teddy bear was gifted to them at check in.  We were escorted to a beautiful room with an incredible view.  The staff sent a cake, macaroons and balloons up to our room.  They even sent up American Girl doll beds after learning we were planning on visiting the store.  My daughters were so happy in the room they refused to go out to dinner - so we ordered room service (which was delicious) and just enjoyed the room!  
The location is perfect for anyone planning on visiting Rockefeller Center but also centrally located for any NYC activity.  Highly recommend.
We set the bar high for future birthday celebrations - may have to return next year and make our visit to "The Palace" a tradition for our princesses!

title: Sweet 16 Birthday Getaway
text: This hotel is amazing from the personal attention all the way to the cleanliness.  The concierge's Kal and Marco were above and beyond.  Both made sure to attend to our every need and exceeding our expectations.  The house keeping staff kept impeccable rooms.  We will be back soon!

title: The jewel crown in Midtown.
text:
This is one of the most amazing hotels in New York. 
Our room was located on the 49th floor which had the most incredible view, overlooking the St. Patrick’s Cathedral. 
The room itself was very spacious and just amazing. 
We loved the courtyard which gives a nice outdoor space to sit down. 
I could write a long story about how wonderful everything is but it wouldn’t to this hotel the justice. 
It is simply the best!
Love, love, love this hotel.

title: Our stay
text: Excellent place clean very friendly and attentive would highly recommend beautiful room fantastic views easy access to all hot spots and shopping...loved every minute being there ..all the staff were excellent very nice and helpful, can’t wait to our return visit

title: Elegance
text:
This was our first visit to The Towers at Lotte New York Palace. The service was impeccable. When we first arrived in the room, we found a problem with the automation system for the room which controlled the lighting, climate and window blinds. A quick call to the front desk resulted in a speedy response to our room from a member of the maintenance team. He was knowledgeable about the system and quickly troubleshot the problem and resolved it with little disturbance. We enjoyed a beautiful view of the skyline, both morning and night. We arrived one evening to find champagne being served in the lobby which was delightful. 
The hotel offers a complementary shoe shine service which requires you to have your shoes out by midnight. I arrived shortly after 1 am one evening and the team at the hotel were still able to have them completed by 7 am. I have stayed at many hotels and this one ranks in the top three.

title: A night in the city
text: My wife and I stayed here overnight on a trip to New York City. It is a very nice hotel with beautiful architecture. Everybody is attentive. The room was quite nice and the view is spectacular, We overlooked St. Patrick’s Cathedral. I would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Weekend in NYC
text: Spent the weekend in the Towers at the Lotte NY Palace and it was such a wonderful experience from the time we booked until the time we left. We had the pleasure of working with Rachel Greenwald who was wonderful to work with and is a great representative of the hotel. We checked in and Susan was so pleasant and welcoming. The room was absolutely beautiful and the hotel is in a great location, walked to a broadway show. A completely wonderful experience that I highly recommend.

title: Best Hotel
text: The Towers at the New York Palace is the best 5 star hotel in NYC. We stayed in the corner suit that was so spacious and comfortable it felt like home. The bathroom is well supplied with Molton Brown products which are fantastic. The bed and furniture are comfortable and the view is absolutely spectacular from every room. The staff is warm and helpful and the location could not be better for midtown. We have stayed here on 3 separate occasions and have always been thrilled with the experience.

title: Brilliant
text: I want to begin by mentioning how nice it is to write a positive review on here. Generally, I write on here to complain about poor service or a property that isn't well taken care of. This is the first hotel room in years where everything actually works (lightbulbs, tv, fixtures, etc). The room is fully stocked with enough tissue boxes, water bottles, a razor kit, slippers, among others. I thought these kind of pre-thought amenities were long gone in U.S hotels! Many fine hotels have stopped giving these amenities all together and I strongly believe that small touches make all the difference. Secondly, I want to mention that you can tell people enjoy working here and have worked here for years. This is a sign of a place that is well-managed and employees are proud to work. I want to give a special shout out to Clara who served us in the lobby and even visited us in our room with a gift. She is so amiable, personal, and helpful - the Lotte is really lucky to have her. She really exemplifies a kind of service that feels luxurious without the stuffy/robotic feel that many 5 star properties lack. We have stayed everywhere from the W to the Omni to the Pierre to the St. Regis to the Plaza to the Towers at the Waldorf Astoria. I think this property by far is the nicest. Really, do book a room at the Towers!

title: Fantastic Stary
text:
Amazing location.. Outstanding staff great concierge and Jimmy at front desk in the towers could not have been friendlier and more helpful.... Highly recommend this hotel
... Lobby is a bit of a railway station though

title: TheTowers at Lotte NY Palace
text:
We traveled to NY and met another couple for a long weekend of fun. We stayed in the Towers, and our friends stayed in the standard hotel rooms. We were there for five days, so we experienced the hotel both on weekdays and on weekends.  Everything was excellent.  

The hotel itself is a great location in NYC.  It’s easy access to many of the city’s attractions.  

The rooms were clean, well furnished, and comfortable. Beds and pillows made for good sleeping. Noise levels were not excessive.  

The best thing about the hotel, though, was the service. It was genuinely friendly, not the “let me do something for you so I can earn a tip” friendly.  Staff anticipated our needs, asked great questions so they could direct us to restaurants and attractions, and they went out of their way to make sure we had all that we needed.  

We mostly ate breakfast in the hotel, but the food was good and the prices were reasonable.  All in all, it was a very good experience, and one that I’d love to repeat soon.

title: Beautiful, reasonably priced hotel in a central location!
text: Our group was part of a wedding block of rooms and we could not have been happier with the hotel, especially for the price!  The bride had her own suite in the towers where we got ready, and I had a beautiful king room.  Staff was friendly and helpful, the room was clean and well decorated, the sheets were great, the bed was on the very firm side, and the room service I had the next morning was truly delicious! Special thanks to Dan Nelson & Mercy Lopez for facilitating everything!

title: Wedding Room Block
text:
My fiance and I live in Manhattan and were searching for a hotel to create wedding room block for our out of town guests, and came across The Palace. Not only is the location amazing, but the rooms are spacious, clean, and beautiful, and the views were stunning! We worked closely with Dan Nelson and Mercy Lopez on all the logistics and details, and they were super flexible, helpful, and easy to work with. 

When I checked in to my Tower Corner Suite, the views of St. Patrick's Cathedral and the city were breathtaking. It was twice the size of my apartment, and a perfect place to have our guests come hang with us throughout the weekend.

Dan and Mercy (without me asking) had placed 2 full length mirrors in the living room space knowing that my bridesmaids and I would be getting ready there. They also put in beautiful flower arrangements for us, an "emergency" bridal kit, and the most adorable bride and groom cake pops!

The attention to detail was amazing, and everything ran smoothly for our guests.

I'm so grateful this worked out, and I'm looking forward to going back on our anniversary!!

title: Wedding Weekend Room Block
text:
