I'm so grateful this worked out, and I'm looking forward to going back on our anniversary!!

title: Favorite place to stay
text: Excellent amenities and convenient location in midtown. Received room upgrade which was much appreciated. Ordered room service twice and food was hot and timely. Being in the suite allowed my husband to be up early and doing work, while allowing me to sleep.

title: Amazing Experience!
text: When getting to the hotel Yohenny at the front desk was super friendly and helpful. She made sure we had everything we needed and went above and beyond. The room was beautiful with an amazing view! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone if they are in the city.

title: Beautiful hotel, amazing service.
text: I had an absolutely wonderful experience in my recent stay at Lotte New York. Johenny Vazquez was exceptionally helpful, kind, and cared to all of my need-- she went above and beyond to make sure this was a one of a kind experience. I would most definitely recommend staying here, make sure to ask for Johenny if you want the best service!! Beautiful hotel, clean room, great views, perfect service. 5 stars for sure!!

title: Wedding Night
text:
The palace was amazing ! I loved my stay I highly recommend this hotel as the place to stay! 
Staff and service made my stay truly memorable.
My husband and I loved this hotel and would be our first pick to book again when we are in the city !
Thank you !

title: Love this place!
text: Excellent location. Excellent welcoming and service. Loved everyone in this place, smiling everywhere. Great room, bathroom. Room service food is great and very quick service, they are 24 hours open. Loved everything in here.

title: Felt like royalty!   The Towers ,Isabel Choi and staff  are on top of every detail!
text:
I stayed at the Towers again this past weekend for an annual event and I am still in awe of the beauty of this hotel and  the way everyone made us  feel so special! 
I have been staying here for a number of years and each year as our event in NYC grows, friends and family flock to the Palace! They now know that THE place to stay in NYC is The Towers . . I leave feeling like this is family! The impeccable service, the beauty of the rooms/views, the fabulous food and drinks all combine to make this more than a five star experience.  I have stayed at many wonderful hotels in NYC. This is simply THE best!  Thank you Isabel, Taylor, everyone who went above and beyond!

title: Best in NYC
text: My wife and I stayed in this beautiful right after getting married in city hall. Amazing hotel. Amazing staff. Amazing stay. Food is top of the line. Would definitely recommend staying here. Best hotel in NYC.

title: Best NYC Hotel
text: I stay in NYC often and this hotel tops them all. Incredible amenities, world class staff who meet your every need. Perfect hotel for a upscale girls weekend, family weekend, or romantic stay. Beyond impressed.

title: Amazing hotel
text: The Lotte New York Palace exceeds all expectations. The location, rooms, views, and staff are all exceptional. We were fortunate to stay in a tower suite for our stay. It was unbelievable. Guests truly receive the royal treatment in this hotel. The Palace hotel is definitely aptly named. I highly recommend staying here.

title: One of my favorite hotels in the world!
text:
I had originally stayed at this hotel last year in the Executive Corner Suite and had promised myself I would return. I highly recommend joining their email list as they often email about special rates. I stayed here again over Valentine’s Day in the same room and it was just as good as I remembered.

The room is enormous, with spectacular views of the city. There is a kitchen, dining room table, and full living room with wrap around windows. There are two bathrooms, and a separate bedroom. You do need to request a coffee machine to be sent up if you do want an espresso machine in the room. 

The amenities are Molton Brown, and there is a nice separate soaking tub from the shower. 

The customer service is excellent as well. This hotel remains one of my favorites in the world.

title: What a great palace
text: Several couples stayed here for a nearby wedding.  We had a less expensive room in the main building and several others had suites in the Tower.  Our room and bathroom were very large and there was plenty of closet space and drawers. The view of St, Patricks cathedral was awesome. The parents of the bride and groom both had suites in the Tower.  We we blown away by the size. Service was amazing.

title: terrific experience!
text: There is only one thing preventing me from giving the full five stars, which is that our room did not have a coffee/tea maker.  We could have paid for one for $20 the first day and then $15/day thereafter.  And there is a bakery on the first floor where one can purchase coffee.

title: Great experience
text: We booked a block of rooms at the Palace for guests traveling to NYC for our wedding weekend. Dan Nelson in group sales was extremely helpful and made the whole process seamless. Rooms are spacious and service was great.

title: Vacation
text:
The employee Clara Law was exceptional!  She made our stay very pleasant! The Hotel is very well located and the service is very good. 
The rooms are spacious and clean. 
 I would stay here again when I come to NY.

title: look no further!
text: Stop!  Search no further!  The Palace is just that, a palace!  We were promptly met by an attentive and courteous doorman, a treat after a long day of travel.  However, it was when we met Susan at registration that we knew our stay at the Lotte New York Palace was going to be exceptional.  She greeted us by name with a genuine warmth and interest, a rarity in the hotel industry today.  We found this guest concentric attitude contagious throughout the staff.  Our stay combined business and pleasure and we found the Madison Avenue midtown location to be perfect.  We walked easily to chic restaurants, the theater and our Monday AM business meeting.  The $140 million renovation was expertly executed restoring the grandeur of old in public areas while creating luxurious rooms with every modern appointment. Our suite in the Towers on the 53rd floor was stunning with sweeping breathtaking views of the city.  We have traveled to NYC numerous times and stayed in many splendid hotels, none as lovely as our new favorite, the Towers at the Lotte Palace.

title: Perfect Location!!
text: Loved staying at the Lotte Palace.  Ideal location...it is within walking distance to most everything and a very easy commute to places like the 9/11 Memorial.  Great staff and wonderful amenities.  Highly recommend.

title: Suites are great
text: Stayed in a Tower Suite over my wedding weekend. The room was incredible and the staff was so helpful. Dan Nelson in group sales did a fantastic job coordinating the room block for our guests. Great experience working with him and the Towers.

title: Stay in the Tower
text: The Tower room was very nice, comfortable, clean and spacious. First we were in a regular room and it was old, no view, run down, and small. Make sure you ask for a Tower room, worth the upgrade cost.

title: Excellent Property
text: We stayed for the weak there and everything is grate, we even got a room upgrade, all the people are extremely nice, and the place is in a grate location, you can walk to 5th for shopping and also to central park, very nice place most certainly will stay there every time we go to New York.

title: Love this Hotel!
text: By far, one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. So there are two options - The Palace or The Towers.  We stayed in Towers and boy were we pleased!  This reservation came with a private set of elevators separate from the main lobby and access to a very fancy house car for drop off transportation within 20 blocks.  From arrival, we were greeted with warm smiles and a great deal of attention. Check-in was quick and our room exceeded our expectations. It was advertised as being slightly over 460 feet however it felt much bigger than that.  It was well prepared and stocked with snacks & drinks.  The bathroom was spacious and there was a separate coat closet and lots of drawers if there was a need to unpack for a few days. All in all, I give this hotel 5 Stars and look forward to staying here on my next return to NY.  There is lots of shopping close by and it’s not too far from TS and the theatre district. There is a Starbucks across the street but where isn’t one when in NYC. Love this place!

title: Best stay ever!!!!!
text: From the moment of check in to check out the stay was phenomenal. Warm welcome upon check and super friendly and courteous housekeeping to bellman. The suite we stayed in was so lovely and the cleanest by far compared to any other top notch hotel in the city. Trust me I have stayed in plenty. We also must say the linens smelled so fresh and the floors were so clean you could literally eat off of them. This is a must stay destination for anyone coming for leisure or business. The restaurant was amazing as well , order the French toast best one of your life , lol. The Willard I believe was the name. Also houskeeping was so amazing and fast for turndown service in this hotel 5 star and two thumbs up. I will be back very soon.

title: Fabulous Time
text:
The service was exceptional and it was an all around first class experience.
We Also enjoyed hearing the history of the hotel from the gentleman attending the upstairs private club room.  
The room service breakfast was excellent.  The eggs were perfect, fruit selection beautiful, and the most delicious bananas foster French toast we’ve ever had.  
It is a wonderful hotel with warm and friendly staff!!

title: Wow. Fabulous hotel.
text: The staff were extremely professional but at the same time friendly. Nothing was too much trouble and the location was excellent . The corner suite had amazing views and the attention to detail in the room was appreciated.

title: Fun in the city
text: Outstanding service. 2nd visit and will be back again. Great service and location. Love the restaurant and food was outstanding. Always friendly service. I recommend this place for families and romantic getaways.

title: Lotte review
text: Hotel is in a great location and the service and staff are first rate.  The hotel is our favorite hotel in New York.  They have reopened their restaurant and it serves great breakfast and lunch and the hotel has a great coffee shop in the lobby.

title: Outstanding in Every Way
text: From it’s location across Madison Ave. from St. Patrick’s to the elegance of the Rarities Bar, this hotel is as perfect as hotels can be. I stayed in the Towers and the room was modern, well appointed with everything you would expect, and had one of the most comfortable beds I have slept in. If you can get tickets to see Steve Cohen’s Chamber Magic. Great show in a very special room. Very attentive staff.

title: A stunning stay in Nyc
text: I rent a corner suite for some meeting. View was stunning over St Patrick Cathedral. Service very good. We had a memorable stay. Bed linen and bed are overly confortable and cocooning. We asked for coffee maaker fridge and we had everything in time

title: Mixed Feelings but want to love it!
text: This hotel is beautiful and the service is remarkable. Susan at the front desk of The Towers is sharp, articulate and welcoming, and meeting her was a wonderful start to our stay. We had a gorgeous corner suite with windows along two sides and a lovely view. After two nights, things changed. At 11:00pm, we heard loud music which we thought was a noisy neighbor on our floor. Upon calling the front desk, we were informed that the music was coming from the Penthouse one floor above and was a "private event" that would be ending at 1:00am. At 1:30 we could still hear and feel the music, and were then told it would be over at 2:00. Four more phone calls and the music finally ended at 3:20am. We were appalled that this event was obviously scheduled and allowed, and located where and when other guests would be disturbed. Four hours of noise and we could do nothing about it. The hotel did cut one night's stay in half as an attempt to make it up to us. I'm just not sure I would ever stay here again if this is typically allowed, which is a shame because the hotel and staff are amazing.

title: Great location, great view, great lobby facilities.
text: The Lotte is a beautiful hotel ideally located for the mid Manhattan scene. The rooms on the 45th and above floors in the Towers are nice, functional and spacious. The view on St. Patrick's Cathedral and surrounding buildings is breathtaking. The lobby/groundfloor has very cozy bars for a relaxing drink. The only significant improvement area is the long waiting time for the elevator! It can take up to 5 minutes in peak hours.

title: I just LOVE the Lotte New York Palace
text: As a travel professional, I have been to the most discerning hotels in the world and the Lotte New York Palace is at the top of the list.  The location,  ambiance, and service is exquisite and Tower brings a small feel to a New York icon.

title: Big rooms, fantastic location, and great service
text: Over the last few  years, my wife and I have stayed at quite a few of NYC's top-rated hotels and The Towers at the Palace is now our favorite.  The rooms are large, the location is great, and the service is terrific. We will be back soon.

title: Comfort and Convenience in Midtown!
text: I brought my daughter to NYC for her birthday, and we stayed in a Tower's king room on the 47th floor facing St. Patrick's Cathedral during MLK weekend. Loved the convenience of the separate space for check-in off the main lobby even though our room wasn't ready for quite a few hours.  A complimentary glass of champagne made any frustration disappear, however.  The room was quite spacious and clean (although I did find a few dust bunnies), the bed was super comfortable.  The TV remote didn't work, and, within minutes, a new one was delivered.  The gym was well appointed and monitored.   Would love an in-room Keurig just to get the day started or, better yet, B & B deals to have a full breakfast at Villard would be great.  We've stayed at Lotte New York Palace many times and cannot see staying anywhere else...the location, service, and comfort are terrific.  Have recommended the Palace to many friends.

title: Nice hotel, terrible elevators
text: The views overlooking St Patrick's Cathedral are second to none, the staff very helpful and the location excellent. But I got stuck in the elevator for 15 minutes - not an experience I would wish to repeat. Help came quickly, but I would advise the claustrophobic to stay elsewhere.

title: Shuford
text: We had a great time. The staff was amazing, the upgrade was a nice surprise, the service was impecable. The location was perfect for what we came to the city ,Broadway was an easy walk as well. Did not know that this was originally the Hemsley Palace which I stayed at many years ago. The update looks great. Cant wait to come back!

title: Sensational Experience
text: I stayed this past weekend at the Lotte New York Palace and this hotel exceeded all my expectations! I booked our room with Dan Nelson, Group Sales Manager. Dan was amazing answering all my questions about the amenities in the hotel, what theaters were walking distance from the hotel, as well as making suggestions of places we should see as this was my first trip to NYC. Melody greeted me at the registration desk and to my amazement our room was ready. Mind you I had been up since 4am and arrived by train so I was very pleased to know I could drop my bags and get exploring. Up the elevator we soared and upon entering my room I was very pleasantly surprised to see a bucket of champagne and charcuterie tray awaiting me! What a welcome! I was beaming! I had casually told Dan Nelson that the reason for this mini sojourn was to celebrate a milestone birthday. Little did I realize that Dan would remember this brief conversation and arrange for these treats upon our arrival. There was a very nice hand written note from Dan welcoming us and wishing us a happy stay in NYC. How special did I feel! My friends and I went exploring, saw a wonderful theater production then returned to the hotel only to be surprised again with chocolates by our pillows from turn down service! What customer service! Sunday dawned and we were up for more exploring. We grabbed a quick cup of coffee, bagel, and yogurt from the hotel coffee shop. The service was quick, efficient, and friendly. Our stay at the Lotte was definitely a five (5) star experience. The checkout process was seamless. The doormen were helpful with all our questions trying to get around the city. Every person we had contact with was professional, friendly, and welcoming. Thank you everyone at the Lotte for making my first experience to NYC a beautiful lasting memory.

title: Second excellent visit
text:
Fabulous hotel. I have not find fault in the Towers*. Very spacious and well appointed room with controls via a touch screen. Molton Brown toiletries. Turn down service. Great in-house cafe. Excellent location 3 mins walk from 5 Ave and 53rd subway. Well equipped gym which I made full use of after a run in nearby Central Park. Exercise with a full range of machines and weights whilst looking at the great view of St Patrick's Cathedral.

*The only minor issue is the lack of breakfast area. Breakfast needs to be ordered to the room. Unless you make use of the cafe and sit in the bar area. Plenty of places to eat nearby though. A shot walk to Starbucks, Pret A Manger and Uncle Gussy food truck.

title: Good location and great view of Manhattan
text: Nearly located to many places and really enjoyed the great view of Manhattan.Spacious room and cozy bed.Nice staffs and servicesI hope to stay next time and recommend  my family and friends for this hotel.

title: Tourists ....Enjoying Our Hometown!!
text:
Well,we finally booked a couple of rooms at the Lotte Palace and enjoyed a weekend in our wonderful city. The staff was gracious and kind.  We were celebrating my mother’s 84th birthday and she was thrilled to arrive to her room to find a birthday card and cake.  
While checking in to the towers,we sipped a glass of champagne and “Susie” took great care of us...later sending a bottle of champagne and 4 flutes to our room for a family toast. The rooms were spacious,clean and had a wonderful view of St Pat’s and Rockefeller Center.  Breakfast at Villards was charming,but costly.   Cocktails each evening in the lounge was quintessential NY.  Oh, the hot chocolate at the shop was just was we needed after a walk along 5th on a cold winter’s day.  Thank you so much for creating such a special, memorable weekend for our family. My mother has already said we will be back again next year.

title: One-of-a Kind Stay!
text:
I simply cannot say enough to properly convey the treatment that we receive every time we stay at The Towers Lotte New York Palace!  
From the very start, Tamara Purdy makes reserving our room simple, and makes sure every detail is taken care of throughout our stay.  
Driving up to the entrance to see George's smiling face is the warmest welcome we could imagine. He goes over and above each time we visit, and always makes my whole family feel very special! 
Tamara, George, and the whole staff has become a very beautiful part of our Christmas tradition, and we look forward to it every year.

title: A visit to NYC at The Towers at The Lotte New York Palace Hotel
text: Once again the staff at The Towers at Lotte New York Palace truly made everything perfect. From Jimm, Susan, Anna Marie and Clara, every wish was handled perfectly and we were made to feel like royalty. From curbside to window side in the room, everyone had a smile and a warm welcome as if you were coming home to family.  If the best of what the City has to offer is on your list then The Palace is the place for you.

title: Our Anniversary
text: My husband surprised me for our wedding anniversary this weekend and made reservations at the Towers at Lotte New York Palace.  From the moment we walked in  the lobby we were welcomed  by friendly courteous staff, specially Ryan Porcasi, Front Office Manager and Concierges  Noureddine and Marco, they went out of their way to assist  my husband in making this a special day for us...for me. Really world class service!  The room was magnificent, spacious, super clean, and had great a view of  St. Patrick Cathedral and midtown...I was in awe!   When we walked in our room there was  a bottle of champagne, chocolate cover strawberries, cheese and crackers...what a great start, we thought it was so thoughtful and such a nice gesture. It was super quiet too!! We had such a great time wish we could have stayed longer.  All the staff, especially Ryan, Noureddine and Marcos, our room and the services exceeded  our expectations!   My husband and I will return maybe next month for my daughters birthday....either way we will be back! Thank you all for making our stay so memorable and special!

title: The Lotte NY Palace is one of the best in NY City.
text: My wife and I have stayed at the Palace many times over the years. This was our first time in the TOWER.  It was truly a unique and wonderful experience.  The room, the view and the location were spectacular.   Great personalized service all around. We will be going back.

title: A Special Stay at The Towers!
text:
The Lotte New York Palace is my family's go-to hotel, and this time around, we decided to stay in The Towers, which is consistently a complete delight. This trip was for my wife's birthday, and to make it special, I booked with Dan Nelson and Lily Cohen, who I have been in touch with before, knowing they would go above and beyond to make sure we had the best stay possible.

When we arrived at the hotel, we were greeted by friendly faces and a flute of champagne. The woman at the front desk immediately noted that she would try to upgrade us and already knew it was my wife's birthday weekend. The hotel was sold out, so we went up to the double Queen room we had initially booked, and we couldn't have asked for anything more! The room is huge, the beds are comfortable, and we were on a high floor, so it was quiet and the view was stunning.

When we left the room and came back later that evening, there was a bottle of champagne and delicious chocolate cake with a card from Dan and Lily for my wife. It was a weekend to remember, and we are often in New York. Will definitely be coming back to The Towers! Our favorite!

title: Business visit in January
text: We have stayed at this hotel on a number of trips.  The rooms are very nice and the staff are very helpful.  We also very much enjoy the location, right in the middle of mid-town.  Our only complaint is the lack of restaurants open after lunch.

title: New York, New York, the Lotte New York Palace is top of the heap..only place to sleep!
text:
My husband Inhave enjoyed our many visits to New York and our choice of Hotel is the Lotte New York Palace Towers. We have been blessed each stay with the best front desk service, as well as room service, concierge and amenities.
Susan Jordon is very professional, friendly and certainly make us feel at home. We are always delighted to see her upon our arrival at the Towers front desk. She makes things happen!
Our rooms have varied from the Suite to Corner suite, which overlooks Tock Center. Unbelievable views.
Room service is always so prompt and elegant.
Inhave stayed at most of the five star hotels in Manhattan, this one is five stars plus to us!

title: Conference review
text: Staff was excellent, the hotel location was great.The bathroom light switches did not work and the shade did not work at check in.. They were fixed after we reported the issue.. It might be helpful to have written information as well. There needs to be a light that can be left on to read or in the bathroom only for safety in the middle of the night,

title: The downgrade of the Lotte Towers
text: Lotte NY Towers is losing its stars! The rooms and service had degraded. You can see it by the bedroom sheets, for instance. Eight months ago, there was a cover for the duvet. Now it’s just sheets and a kind of dirty duvet. Even the sheets used to be softer/nicer. The pillows have that weird smell of “every man in the world slept here and sweated”, most of the housekeepers complain they are alone in the floor, they’re nervous, the towels feel like sandpaper and it seems that nobody in that department cares anymore. I used to call housekeeping in the afternoon, considering that the hotel has 24 hours housekeeping. The housekeepers always complained a lot when they got to the room, saying they were alone on the floor. One day, one of them even yelled at my teenage sons saying she couldn’t do the work in their presence. The Wi-Fi seems to be the worst in the world. This time, my phone kept sending messages for me that iCloud couldn’t be reached. I called the hotel support and after a bunch of weird tests using Chrome, the attendant said the problem was iCloud. I was very worried, thinking I was hacked! I went to the Starbucks across the street and realized there was nothing wrong with my phone. It pains me to say this, because I like the people that work there very much. And I used to love this hotel. Hope they can sort those things out.

title: What a wonderful weekend!
text: This was our second stay at this hotel and it was even more memorable than our first one a couple of years ago.  The corner suite was spacious, well appointed, with a stunning view.  But it was the staff that really made this trip so special.  From the time we arrived, the staff was incredibly friendly, helpful and professional.

title: Wonderful respite
text: We enjoyed chatting with another guest from Europe and congratulating the basketball team from Illinois about to play in Madison Square Garden. We have stayed at the Palace several times in the past, but we had never eaten breakfast in the Villard Room, which was truly an unforgettable experience.

title: Our Wedding
text: Me and my husband got married at Lotte New York Palace on 10/13/18 and we are still over the moon about how wonderful our whole experience was throughout planning up until the last second. Megan Barry you are absolutely amazing and I couldn't of asked for anyone better to help us plan our big day! From showing us around the venue, to making sure every little detail was executed properly, and making sure we felt at home anytime we stopped by the hotel. I couldn't recommend this hotel and staff enough! I couldn't of been more lucky to have Megan & Elaina for my big day (I miss you both already!). The food is absolutely amazing, the hotel is insanely beautiful and iconic! If you are thinking about staying here or planning any event at The Palace you have come to the right place!!

title: Outstanding Experience
text: I went to stay for New Year’s Eve. The experience was 5 stars, the room beautiful and the view stunning. The hotel decoration for Christmas was beautiful. I recommended this hotel 200%. The location is great ,very close to Rockeffeller Center.

title: Beautiful centrally located hotel
text: Quintessential New York Hotel in midtown. Central to many great spots. Exceptional staff and customer service. Coffee in the shop is delicious and the security friendly and helpful. Wonderful stay at wonderful hotel with wonderful people.

title: The Palace Gem
text: Unrivaled luxury and outstanding views of NYC’s Staint Patrick Cathedral and the city.Superior customer service and value for the locations.  Beautifully appointed rooms as well as spacious, safe, and clean.

title: The best of the best!
text: I don’t have a single complaint. The hotel is gorgeous and views were amazing! My room was pristine. All of the staff went above and be beyond to make for a wonderful visit. I only wish I could have stayed longer!

title: Amazing Stay As Expected!
text:
I came to New York with my husband to see my daughter for my birthday, and while we usually stay at the Palace, this time around was certainly the most memorable! 

To make it special, my husband booked a fabulous room in the Towers and we couldnt have had a better experience! Upon arrival, we were greeted in the lobby by a very nice woman who checked us in, wished me a happy birthday, told us she would see if she could get us an upgrade and offered us a glass of champagne. It was lovely! Once the room was ready we were delighted with our double queen setup, which was increadibly spacious, on the 50th floor, and had an incredible view of the sunrise in the morning.

To make things even more special and enjoyable, when we arrived back at the room after dinner, there was a bottle of champagne and beautiful chocolate cake with a sweet note from Lily Cohen and Dan Nelson, who my husband had the pleasure of working with while booking the room. He told them it was my birthday and they totally went above and beyond to make my stay the best it could be. 

We are incredibly excited to come back every time we come to the city!

title: Excellent option for a splurge in Manhattan without breaking the bank
text:
I spent a weekend at the Towers in the Lotte NY Palace, staying in a 2 bedroom Tower corner suite. We had spectacular views of St. Patrick's cathedral, the Rockefeller center and Midtown. The room was elegantly appointed, with a large corner suite connected to a 2 queen bed room. The final price was lower than comparable hotels, especially considering the sheer size of the rooms, which is rare to find in other high-end Manhattan hotels. Bathrooms and toiletries were at a luxury level. Minor improvements could be made on the TV sets (remote controls not working very well) and the lack of a coffee machine, ice machine on the floor. However, we had a kitchenette with minibar, microwave oven and wine cellar. Room service was excellent, Tower concierge and reception polite but not exceptional. 
The Villard restaurant is very expensive and food is good (not great), but the place is so beautiful that it is worth at least one visit. 
The main entrance and the staircases are just as well beautiful and remind you of the old times.
Overall a great stay, would definitely consider staying there again.

title: Nice hotel
text: We stayed in a Tower room with the most amazing view of St. Patrick’s Cathedral. The room was lacking in a dressing table with mirror for the ladies to get ready. Also no kettle with tea/coffee in the room. Room service food was average - American breakfast was not good and totally over priced. Nice location if you want to shop, not too far from Times Square and Rockefeller just over the road. Staff can be quite abrupt and come across rude, I don’t know if that’s New Yorkers in general? Overall, nice hotel and I would stay here again.

title: AVR Trip
text: Hotel did an excellent job in delivering hospitality and service.  I ate breakfast on property and the food was very good and the service very attentive.  The work out room was equipped properly and the men's changing room was very convenient.
